built with pdoc

seqeas.subduction2d

Module containing the rheologies, fault setup, and ODE cycles code for the 2D subduction case.

   1"""
   2Module containing the rheologies, fault setup, and ODE cycles code
   3for the 2D subduction case.
   4"""
   5
   6# general imports
   7import json
   8import configparser
   9import numpy as np
  10import pandas as pd
  11from scipy.integrate import solve_ivp
  12from numba import njit, objmode, float64, int64, boolean
  13from scipy.interpolate import interp1d
  14from warnings import warn
  15from abc import ABC
  16
  17# seqeas imports
  18from .kernels2d import Glinedisp, Klinedisp
  19
  20
  21class Rheology(ABC):
  22    """
  23    Abstract base class for rheologies.
  24    """
  25
  26
  27class NonlinearViscous(Rheology):
  28    r"""
  29    Implement a nonlinear viscous fault rheology, where the velocity :math:`v` is
  30    :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n` given the shear stress :math:`\tau`, a strength
  31    constant :math:`\alpha_n`, and a constant exponent :math:`n`.
  32    """
  33
  34    def __init__(self, n, alpha_n, n_mid=None, alpha_n_mid=None, mid_transition=None,
  35                 n_deep=None, alpha_n_deep=None, deep_transition=None,
  36                 deep_transition_width=None, n_boundary=None, alpha_n_boundary=None):
  37        r"""
  38        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
  39
  40        Parameters
  41        ----------
  42        alpha_n : float
  43            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
  44        n : float
  45            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
  46        """
  47        # input check
  48        assert not np.logical_xor(deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None)
  49        # set number of variables
  50        self.n_vars = 2
  51        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
  52        # initialization
  53        self._n = float(n)
  54        self._n_mid = float(n_mid) if n_mid is not None else self.n
  55        self._n_deep = float(n_deep) if n_deep is not None else self.n_mid
  56        self.n_boundary = float(n_boundary) if n_boundary is not None else self.n_deep
  57        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
  58        self.alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
  59        self.alpha_n_mid = (float(alpha_n_mid) if alpha_n_mid is not None
  60                            else self.alpha_n)
  61        self.alpha_n_deep = (float(alpha_n_deep) if alpha_n_deep is not None
  62                             else self.alpha_n_mid)
  63        self.alpha_n_boundary = (float(alpha_n_boundary) if alpha_n_boundary is not None
  64                                 else self.alpha_n_deep)
  65        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
  66        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
  67        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
  68        self.deep_transition = None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
  69        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
  70        self.deep_transition_width = (None if deep_transition_width is None
  71                                      else float(deep_transition_width))
  72        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
  73
  74    @property
  75    def alpha_n(self):
  76        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
  77        return self._alpha_n
  78
  79    @alpha_n.setter
  80    def alpha_n(self, alpha_n):
  81        self._alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
  82        self._A = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n, self._n)
  83
  84    @property
  85    def alpha_n_mid(self):
  86        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
  87        return self._alpha_n_mid
  88
  89    @alpha_n_mid.setter
  90    def alpha_n_mid(self, alpha_n_mid):
  91        self._alpha_n_mid = float(alpha_n_mid)
  92        self._A_mid = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_mid, self._n_mid)
  93
  94    @property
  95    def alpha_n_deep(self):
  96        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
  97        return self._alpha_n_deep
  98
  99    @alpha_n_deep.setter
 100    def alpha_n_deep(self, alpha_n_deep):
 101        self._alpha_n_deep = float(alpha_n_deep)
 102        self._A_deep = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_deep, self._n_deep)
 103
 104    @property
 105    def n(self):
 106        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
 107        return self._n
 108
 109    @n.setter
 110    def n(self, n):
 111        self._n = float(n)
 112        self._A = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n, self._n)
 113
 114    @property
 115    def n_mid(self):
 116        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
 117        return self._n_mid
 118
 119    @n_mid.setter
 120    def n_mid(self, n_mid):
 121        self._n_mid = float(n_mid)
 122        self._A_mid = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_mid, self._n_mid)
 123
 124    @property
 125    def n_deep(self):
 126        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
 127        return self._n_deep
 128
 129    @n_deep.setter
 130    def n_deep(self, n_deep):
 131        self._n_deep = float(n_deep)
 132        self._A_deep = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_deep, self._n_deep)
 133
 134    @property
 135    def A(self):
 136        r""" Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] """
 137        return self._A
 138
 139    @property
 140    def A_mid(self):
 141        r""" Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] """
 142        return self._A_mid
 143
 144    @property
 145    def A_deep(self):
 146        r""" Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] """
 147        return self._A_deep
 148
 149    @staticmethod
 150    def calc_A(alpha_n, n):
 151        """ Calculate A from alpha_n and n """
 152        return alpha_n ** (1 / n)
 153
 154    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, v_eff):
 155        r"""
 156        Calculate the depth-dependent arrays of :math:`\alpha_n`, :math:`n`, and :math:`A`,
 157        assuming :math:`\alpha_n` and :math:`\alpha_{n,eff}` vary log-linearly with depth,
 158        and :math:`n` adapts between the transition points.
 159        """
 160        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
 161        # start knots list
 162        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
 163        vals_alpha_n = [self.alpha_n]
 164        vals_n = [self.n]
 165        # add optional mid transition
 166        if self.mid_transition is not None:
 167            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))])
 168            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_mid)
 169            vals_n.append(self.n_mid)
 170        # add optional deep transition
 171        if self.deep_transition is not None:
 172            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))])
 173            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_deep)
 174            vals_n.append(self.n_deep)
 175            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths
 176                                                       - self.deep_transition
 177                                                       - self.deep_transition_width))])
 178            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
 179            vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
 180        # add final value
 181        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
 182        vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
 183        vals_alpha_n = np.array(vals_alpha_n)
 184        vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
 185        vals_n = np.array(vals_n)
 186        vals_alpha_eff = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(vals_alpha_n, vals_n, v_eff)
 187        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
 188        alpha_n_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_n))(patch_depths)
 189        alpha_eff_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_eff))(patch_depths)
 190        # get n and A
 191        n_vec = SubductionSimulation.get_n(alpha_n_vec, alpha_eff_vec, v_eff)
 192        A_vec = alpha_n_vec ** (1 / n_vec)
 193        return alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec
 194
 195
 196class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic(Rheology):
 197    r"""
 198    Implement a steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the ageing law (effectively
 199    becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by
 200
 201    :math:`f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E`
 202
 203    where :math:`f_{ss}` is the steady-state friction, :math:`f_0` is a reference
 204    friction, :math:`a` and :math:`b` are the rate-and-state frictional parameters,
 205    :math:`\zeta = \log (v / v_0)` is the logarithmic velocity, :math:`\tau` is the shear
 206    stress, and :math:`\sigma_E` is the effective fault normal stress.
 207    """
 208
 209    def __init__(self, v_0, alpha_h, alpha_h_mid=None, mid_transition=None,
 210                 alpha_h_deep=None, deep_transition=None, deep_transition_width=None,
 211                 alpha_h_boundary=None):
 212        r"""
 213        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
 214
 215        Parameters
 216        ----------
 217        v_0 : float
 218            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
 219        alpha_h : float
 220            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
 221            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
 222            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
 223        """
 224        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
 225        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 226        # input check
 227        assert not np.logical_xor(deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None)
 228        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
 229        # set number of variables
 230        self.n_vars = 2
 231        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
 232        # initialization
 233        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
 234        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
 235        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
 236        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 237        self.alpha_h_mid = (float(alpha_h_mid) if alpha_h_mid is not None
 238                            else self.alpha_h)
 239        r""" Middle rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 240        self.alpha_h_deep = (float(alpha_h_deep) if alpha_h_deep is not None
 241                             else self.alpha_h_mid)
 242        r""" Deep rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 243        self.alpha_h_boundary = (float(alpha_h_boundary) if alpha_h_boundary is not None
 244                                 else self.alpha_h_deep)
 245        r""" Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
 246        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
 247        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
 248        self.deep_transition = None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
 249        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
 250        self.deep_transition_width = (None if deep_transition_width is None
 251                                      else float(deep_transition_width))
 252        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
 253
 254    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths):
 255        r"""
 256        Calculate the depth-dependent array of :math:`\alpha_h`, assuming it
 257        varies log-linearly with depth.
 258        """
 259        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
 260        # start knots list
 261        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
 262        vals_alpha_h = [self.alpha_h]
 263        # add optional mid transition
 264        if self.mid_transition is not None:
 265            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))])
 266            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_mid)
 267        # add optional deep transition
 268        if self.deep_transition is not None:
 269            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))])
 270            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
 271            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths
 272                                                       - self.deep_transition
 273                                                       - self.deep_transition_width))])
 274            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
 275        # add final value
 276        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
 277        vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
 278        vals_alpha_h = np.array(vals_alpha_h)
 279        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
 280        alpha_h_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_h))(patch_depths)
 281        return alpha_h_vec
 282
 283
 284@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
 285def dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A, n):
 286    r"""
 287    Calculate the velocity derivative for a power-law viscous rheology.
 288
 289    From :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n` we get:
 290
 291    :math:`\frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{\alpha_n} \tau^{n-1} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
 292
 293    where
 294
 295    :math:`\tau^{n-1} = \left( \alpha_n v \right)^{\frac{n-1}{n}}`
 296
 297    simplifying to
 298
 299    :math:`\frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{A} v^{1-\frac{1}{n}} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
 300
 301    Parameters
 302    ----------
 303    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
 304        1D array of the shear stress derivative
 305    v : numpy.ndarray
 306        1D array of the current velocity
 307    A : numpy.ndarray
 308        Rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 309    n : numpy.ndarray
 310        Power-law exponent
 311
 312    Returns
 313    -------
 314    dvdt : numpy.ndarray
 315        1D array of the velocity derivative.
 316    """
 317    signs = np.sign(v)
 318    return (n / A) * (signs * v)**(1 - 1 / n) * dtaudt
 319
 320
 321@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
 322def dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec):
 323    r"""
 324    Return the velocity derivative in logarithmic space given the current traction
 325    rate in linear space.
 326
 327    Taking the derivative of the steady-state friction gives an explicit
 328    formulation for the slip acceleration :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}`:
 329
 330    :math:`\frac{df_{ss}}{dt} = (a-b) \frac{d \zeta}{dt}`
 331
 332    Recognizing that :math:`\tau = f_{ss} \sigma_E` and assuming
 333    constant effective normal stress leads to
 334    :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt} = \sigma_E \frac{df_{ss}}{dt}`, which
 335    can be rearranged to give the final expression
 336
 337    :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt} = \frac{1}{(a-b) \sigma_E} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
 338
 339    Parameters
 340    ----------
 341    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
 342        Traction derivative :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt}` [Pa/s] in linear space
 343    alpha_h_vec : float
 344        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
 345
 346    Returns
 347    -------
 348    dzetadt : numpy.ndarray
 349        Velocity derivative :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}` [1/s] in logarithmic space.
 350    """
 351    return dtaudt / alpha_h_vec
 352
 353
 354@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
 355def get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus, delta_tau, alpha_n, n, A):
 356    r"""
 357    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change due to an instantaneous stress change
 358    to the fault patches. It is derived from:
 359
 360    :math:`\tau_{+} = \tau_{-} + \Delta \tau`
 361
 362    and plugging in the relationship :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n`, we get
 363
 364    :math:`\sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{+}} = \sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{-}} + \Delta \tau`
 365
 366    and finally
 367
 368    :math:`v_{+} = \frac{\left( A \sqrt[n]{v_{-}} + \Delta \tau \right)^n}{\alpha_n}`
 369
 370    Parameters
 371    ----------
 372    v_minus : numpy.ndarray
 373        Initial velocity :math:`v_{-}` [m/s]
 374    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray
 375        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
 376    alpha_n : numpy.ndarray
 377        Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
 378    n : numpy.ndarray
 379        Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
 380    A : numpy.ndarray
 381        Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]
 382
 383    Returns
 384    -------
 385    v_plus : numpy.ndarray
 386        Velocity :math:`v_{+}` [m/s] after stress change
 387    """
 388    signs = np.sign(v_minus)
 389    temp = A * (signs * v_minus)**(1 / n) + (signs * delta_tau)
 390    return np.abs(temp) ** (n - 1) * temp / alpha_n * signs
 391
 392
 393@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
 394def get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus, delta_tau, alpha_h_vec):
 395    r"""
 396    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change (in logarithmic space) due to an
 397    instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. We can kickstart the
 398    derivatuion from the expression in ``RateStateSteadyLinear.get_new_vel``:
 399
 400    :math:`\log (v_{+}/v_0) = \log (v_{-}/v_0) + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
 401
 402    and realize that we only have to plug in our definition for :math:`\zeta`
 403    to give us the final result
 404
 405    :math:`\zeta_{+} = \zeta_{-} + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
 406
 407    Parameters
 408    ----------
 409    zeta_minus : numpy.ndarray
 410        Initial velocity :math:`\zeta_{-}` [-] in logarithmic space
 411    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray, optional
 412        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
 413    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
 414        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
 415
 416    Returns
 417    -------
 418    zeta_plus : numpy.ndarray
 419        Velocity :math:`\zeta_{+}` [-] in logarithmic space after stress change
 420
 421    See Also
 422    --------
 423    alpha_h
 424    """
 425    return zeta_minus + delta_tau / alpha_h_vec
 426
 427
 428@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], float64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
 429                 float64[:], float64[:], float64), cache=True)
 430def flat_ode_plvis(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, mu_over_2vs):
 431    r"""
 432    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
 433    powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
 434    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
 435
 436    Parameters
 437    ----------
 438    t : float
 439        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
 440    state : numpy.ndarray
 441        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
 442        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
 443    v_plate : float
 444        Plate velocity.
 445    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 446        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
 447    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 448        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
 449        patches onto the creeping patches.
 450    A_upper : numpy.ndarray
 451        Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 452    n_upper : numpy.ndarray
 453        Upper plate interface power-law exponent
 454    mu_over_2vs : float
 455        Radiation damping factor
 456
 457    Returns
 458    -------
 459    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
 460        1D array with the state derivative.
 461    """
 462    # get number of variables within state
 463    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
 464    n_vars_upper = 2
 465    n_creeping_upper = state.size // n_vars_upper
 466    assert K_int.shape == (n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_upper)
 467    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping_upper
 468    # extract total velocities
 469    v = state[n_creeping_upper:]
 470    # get shear strain rate
 471    signs = np.sign(v)
 472    temp = mu_over_2vs * (n_upper / A_upper) * (signs * v)**(1 - 1 / n_upper)
 473    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate, axis=1)
 474              ) / (1 + temp)
 475    # get ODE
 476    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A_upper, n_upper)))
 477    # return
 478    return dstatedt
 479
 480
 481@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], float64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
 482                 float64, float64[:], float64), cache=True)
 483def flat_ode_rdlog(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs):
 484    r"""
 485    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
 486    powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
 487    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
 488
 489    Parameters
 490    ----------
 491    t : float
 492        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
 493    state : numpy.ndarray
 494        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
 495        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
 496    v_plate : float
 497        Plate velocity.
 498    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 499        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
 500    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 501        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
 502        patches onto the creeping patches.
 503    v_0 : float
 504        Reference velocity [m/s]
 505    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
 506        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
 507    mu_over_2vs : float
 508        Radiation damping factor
 509
 510    Returns
 511    -------
 512    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
 513        1D array with the state derivative.
 514    """
 515    # get number of variables within state
 516    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
 517    n_vars_upper = 2
 518    n_creeping_upper = state.size // n_vars_upper
 519    assert K_int.shape == (n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_upper)
 520    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping_upper
 521    # extract total velocities
 522    zeta = state[n_creeping_upper:]
 523    v = v_0 * np.exp(zeta)
 524    # get shear strain rate
 525    temp = mu_over_2vs * v / alpha_h_vec
 526    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate, axis=1)
 527              ) / (1 + temp)
 528    # get ODE
 529    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec)))
 530    # return
 531    return dstatedt
 532
 533
 534@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
 535                 float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
 536def flat_ode_plvis_plvis(t, state, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
 537                         A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower):
 538    """
 539    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
 540    powerlaw-viscous rheology in both the upper and lower plate interface.
 541
 542    Parameters
 543    ----------
 544    t : float
 545        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
 546    state : numpy.ndarray
 547        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
 548        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity,
 549        lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
 550    n_creeping_upper : int
 551        Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface.
 552        The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then
 553        be derived from the size of ``state``.
 554    v_plate_vec : float
 555        Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
 556    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 557        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
 558    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 559        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
 560        patches onto the creeping patches.
 561    A_upper : float
 562        Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 563    n_upper : float
 564        Upper plate interface power-law exponent
 565    A_lower : float
 566        Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 567    n_lower : float
 568        Lower plate interface power-law exponent
 569
 570    Returns
 571    -------
 572    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
 573        1D array with the state derivative.
 574    """
 575    # get number of variables within state
 576    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
 577    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
 578    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
 579    n_state_lower = state.size - n_state_upper
 580    n_creeping_lower = n_state_lower // n_vars_lower
 581    n_creeping = n_creeping_lower + n_creeping_upper
 582    assert K_int.shape[0] == K_int.shape[1] == n_creeping
 583    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping
 584    # split up state
 585    state_upper = state[:n_state_upper]
 586    state_lower = state[n_state_upper:]
 587    # extract total velocities
 588    v_upper = state_upper[n_creeping_upper:]
 589    v_lower = state_lower[n_creeping_lower:]
 590    # get shear strain rate
 591    v = np.concatenate((v_upper, v_lower))
 592    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate_vec) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate_vec[0], axis=1))
 593    dtaudt_upper = dtaudt[:n_creeping_upper]
 594    dtaudt_lower = dtaudt[n_creeping_upper:]
 595    # get individual rheologies' ODE
 596    dstatedt_upper = \
 597        np.concatenate((v_upper, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt_upper, v_upper,
 598                                            np.ones_like(v_upper) * A_upper,
 599                                            np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_upper)))
 600    dstatedt_lower = \
 601        np.concatenate((v_lower, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt_lower, v_lower,
 602                                            np.ones_like(v_lower) * A_lower,
 603                                            np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_lower)))
 604    # concatenate and return
 605    return np.concatenate((dstatedt_upper, dstatedt_lower))
 606
 607
 608@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
 609                 float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
 610def flat_ode_rdlog_plvis(t, state, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
 611                         v_0, alpha_h_upper, A_lower, n_lower):
 612    r"""
 613    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
 614    rate-dependent (log-space) rheology in the upper and nonlinear viscous
 615    rheology in the lower plate interface.
 616
 617    Parameters
 618    ----------
 619    t : float
 620        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
 621    state : numpy.ndarray
 622        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
 623        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity,
 624        lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
 625    n_creeping_upper : int
 626        Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface.
 627        The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then
 628        be derived from the size of ``state``.
 629    v_plate_vec : float
 630        Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
 631    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 632        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
 633    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 634        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
 635        patches onto the creeping patches.
 636    v_0 : float
 637        Reference velocity [m/s]
 638    alpha_h_upper : float
 639        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
 640    A_lower : float
 641        Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 642    n_lower : float
 643        Lower plate interface power-law exponent
 644
 645    Returns
 646    -------
 647    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
 648        1D array with the state derivative.
 649    """
 650    # get number of variables within state
 651    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
 652    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
 653    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
 654    n_state_lower = state.size - n_state_upper
 655    n_creeping_lower = n_state_lower // n_vars_lower
 656    n_creeping = n_creeping_lower + n_creeping_upper
 657    assert K_int.shape[0] == K_int.shape[1] == n_creeping
 658    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping
 659    # split up state
 660    state_upper = state[:n_state_upper]
 661    state_lower = state[n_state_upper:]
 662    # extract total velocities
 663    v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(state_upper[n_creeping_upper:])
 664    v_lower = state_lower[n_creeping_lower:]
 665    # get shear strain rate
 666    v = np.concatenate((v_upper, v_lower))
 667    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate_vec) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate_vec[0], axis=1))
 668    dtaudt_upper = dtaudt[:n_creeping_upper]
 669    dtaudt_lower = dtaudt[n_creeping_upper:]
 670    # get individual rheologies' ODE
 671    dstatedt_upper = \
 672        np.concatenate((v_upper, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt_upper,
 673                                               np.ones_like(v_lower) * alpha_h_upper)))
 674    dstatedt_lower = \
 675        np.concatenate((v_lower, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt_lower, v_lower,
 676                                            np.ones_like(v_lower) * A_lower,
 677                                            np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_lower)))
 678    # concatenate and return
 679    return np.concatenate((dstatedt_upper, dstatedt_lower))
 680
 681
 682# simple rk4
 683@njit(float64[:, :](float64, float64, float64[:], float64[:], int64, float64[:],
 684                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64),
 685      cache=True)
 686def myrk4(ti, tf, state0, t_eval, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec,
 687          K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower):
 688    h = t_eval[1] - t_eval[0]
 689    num_state = state0.size
 690    num_eval = t_eval.size
 691    sol = np.zeros((num_eval, num_state))
 692    sol[0, :] = state0
 693    for i in range(1, num_eval):
 694        cur = sol[i-1, :]
 695        k1 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(ti, cur, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
 696                                  A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
 697        cur = sol[i-1, :] + (h / 2) * k1
 698        k2 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(ti, cur, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
 699                                  A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
 700        cur = sol[i-1, :] + (h / 2) * k2
 701        k3 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(ti, cur, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
 702                                  A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
 703        cur = sol[i-1, :] + h * k3
 704        k4 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(ti, cur, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
 705                                  A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
 706        sol[i, :] = sol[i-1, :] + (h / 6) * (k1 + 2 * k2 + 2 * k3 + k4)
 707    return sol
 708
 709
 710@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1],
 711                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
 712                    float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64), cache=True)
 713def flat_run_plvis(t_eval, i_break, i_eq,
 714                   n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext,
 715                   v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded,
 716                   alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec, mu_over_2vs):
 717    r"""
 718    Run the simulation.
 719
 720    Parameters
 721    ----------
 722    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
 723        Evaluation times [s]
 724    i_break : numpy.ndarray
 725        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
 726    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
 727        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
 728    n_creeping_upper : int
 729        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
 730    n_creeping_lower : int
 731        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
 732    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 733        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
 734    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 735        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
 736    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
 737        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
 738    v_init : numpy.ndarray
 739        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
 740    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
 741        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
 742    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
 743        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
 744    alpha_n_vec : numpy.ndarray
 745        Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
 746        at each patch
 747    n_vec : float
 748        Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-] at each patch
 749    A_vec : float
 750        Rescaled upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
 751        [Pa^n * s/m] at each patch
 752    mu_over_2vs : float
 753        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
 754        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
 755
 756    Returns
 757    -------
 758    full_state : numpy.ndarray
 759        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
 760    """
 761    # initialize parameters
 762    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
 763    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
 764    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
 765    n_eval = t_eval.size
 766    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
 767
 768    # initialize arrays
 769    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
 770    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
 771    v_minus_upper = v_init[:n_creeping_upper]
 772    v_minus_lower = v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]
 773    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
 774    full_state[:] = np.NaN
 775    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower))
 776
 777    # make flat ODE function arguments
 778    args = (v_plate_vec[0], K_int[:n_creeping_upper, :n_creeping_upper].copy(),
 779            K_ext[:n_creeping_upper, :], A_vec, n_vec, mu_over_2vs)
 780
 781    # integrate
 782    spun_up = 0
 783    i_slip = 0
 784    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
 785    i = 0
 786    atol = np.ones(n_state_upper) * 1e-6
 787    atol[n_creeping_upper:] = 1e-15
 788    while i < steps.size - 1:
 789        # print(f"{i+1}/{steps.size - 1}")
 790        # get indices
 791        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i+1]
 792        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
 793        # call integrator
 794        with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
 795            sol = solve_ivp(flat_ode_plvis,
 796                            t_span=[ti, tf],
 797                            y0=state_plus[:n_state_upper],
 798                            t_eval=t_eval[ji:jf + 1],
 799                            method="LSODA", rtol=1e-6, atol=atol, args=args)
 800            success = sol.success
 801            if success:
 802                sol = sol.y
 803            else:
 804                sol = np.empty((1, 1))
 805        if not success:
 806            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
 807        # save state to output array
 808        full_state[:n_state_upper, ji:jf + 1] = sol
 809        # fill in the imposed lower state
 810        full_state[n_state_upper:n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower, ji:jf + 1] = \
 811            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1)) \
 812            * np.ascontiguousarray(t_eval[ji:jf + 1]).reshape((1, -1))
 813        full_state[n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower:, ji:jf + 1] = \
 814            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
 815        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
 816        if i == steps.size - 2:
 817            break
 818        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
 819        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
 820            old_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-2*n_slips-1]:steps[i-n_slips]]
 821            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-n_slips]:steps[i+1]]
 822            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
 823            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
 824            old_v_upper = old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
 825            new_v_upper = new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
 826            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
 827            rhs_upper = (1e-3) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-3) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
 828            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
 829            if stop_now:
 830                spun_up = jf
 831                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
 832                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
 833        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
 834            break
 835        # apply step change only if there is one
 836        if (jf in i_eq):
 837            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
 838            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
 839            v_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
 840            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
 841            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
 842            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
 843            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
 844            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
 845            v_plus_upper = get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus_upper,
 846                                             delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
 847                                             alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec)
 848            v_plus_lower = v_minus_lower.ravel()
 849            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, v_plus_upper,
 850                                         s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower))
 851            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
 852        else:
 853            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
 854        # advance
 855        i += 1
 856
 857    # warn if we never spun up
 858    if not spun_up:
 859        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
 860
 861    # done
 862    return full_state
 863
 864
 865@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1],
 866                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
 867                    float64, float64[:], float64), cache=True)
 868def flat_run_rdlog(t_eval, i_break, i_eq,
 869                   n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext,
 870                   v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded,
 871                   v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs):
 872    r"""
 873    Run the simulation.
 874
 875    Parameters
 876    ----------
 877    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
 878        Evaluation times [s]
 879    i_break : numpy.ndarray
 880        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
 881    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
 882        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
 883    n_creeping_upper : int
 884        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
 885    n_creeping_lower : int
 886        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
 887    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 888        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
 889    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 890        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
 891    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
 892        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
 893    v_init : numpy.ndarray
 894        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
 895    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
 896        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
 897    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
 898        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
 899    v_0 : float
 900        Reference velocity [m/s]
 901    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
 902        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
 903    mu_over_2vs : float
 904        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
 905        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
 906
 907    Returns
 908    -------
 909    full_state : numpy.ndarray
 910        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
 911    """
 912    # initialize parameters
 913    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
 914    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
 915    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
 916    n_eval = t_eval.size
 917    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
 918
 919    # initialize arrays
 920    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
 921    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
 922    assert np.all(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] > 0)
 923    zeta_minus_upper = np.log(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] / v_0)
 924    v_minus_lower = v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]
 925    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
 926    full_state[:] = np.NaN
 927    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, zeta_minus_upper,
 928                                 s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower))
 929
 930    # make flat ODE function arguments
 931    args = (v_plate_vec[0], K_int[:n_creeping_upper, :n_creeping_upper].copy(),
 932            K_ext[:n_creeping_upper, :], v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs)
 933
 934    # integrate
 935    spun_up = 0
 936    i_slip = 0
 937    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
 938    i = 0
 939    while i < steps.size - 1:
 940        # print(f"{i+1}/{steps.size - 1}")
 941        # get indices
 942        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i+1]
 943        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
 944        # call integrator
 945        with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
 946            sol = solve_ivp(flat_ode_rdlog,
 947                            t_span=[ti, tf],
 948                            y0=state_plus[:n_state_upper],
 949                            t_eval=t_eval[ji:jf + 1],
 950                            method="LSODA", args=args)
 951            success = sol.success
 952            if success:
 953                sol = sol.y
 954            else:
 955                sol = np.empty((1, 1))
 956        if not success:
 957            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
 958        # save state to output array
 959        full_state[:n_state_upper, ji:jf + 1] = sol
 960        # fill in the imposed lower state
 961        full_state[n_state_upper:n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower, ji:jf + 1] = \
 962            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1)) \
 963            * np.ascontiguousarray(t_eval[ji:jf + 1]).reshape((1, -1))
 964        full_state[n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower:, ji:jf + 1] = \
 965            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
 966        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
 967        if i == steps.size - 2:
 968            break
 969        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
 970        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
 971            old_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-2*n_slips-1]:steps[i-n_slips]]
 972            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-n_slips]:steps[i+1]]
 973            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
 974            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
 975            old_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
 976            new_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
 977            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
 978            rhs_upper = (1e-3) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-3) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
 979            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
 980            if stop_now:
 981                spun_up = jf
 982                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
 983                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
 984        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
 985            break
 986        # apply step change only if there is one
 987        if (jf in i_eq):
 988            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
 989            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
 990            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
 991            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
 992            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
 993            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
 994            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
 995            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
 996            zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus_upper,
 997                                                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
 998                                                alpha_h_vec)
 999            v_plus_lower = v_minus_lower.ravel()
1000            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper,
1001                                         s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower))
1002            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1003        else:
1004            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1005        # advance
1006        i += 1
1007
1008    # warn if we never spun up
1009    if not spun_up:
1010        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1011
1012    full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :] = \
1013        v_0 * np.exp(full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :])
1014
1015    # done
1016    return full_state
1017
1018
1019@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1],
1020                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
1021                    float64, float64, float64, float64, boolean), cache=True)
1022def flat_run_plvis_plvis(t_eval, i_break, i_eq,
1023                         n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext,
1024                         v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded,
1025                         alpha_n_upper, n_upper, alpha_n_lower, n_lower,
1026                         simple_rk4):
1027    """
1028    Run the simulation.
1029
1030    Parameters
1031    ----------
1032    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1033        Evaluation times [s]
1034    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1035        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1036    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1037        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1038    n_creeping_upper : int
1039        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1040    n_creeping_lower : int
1041        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1042    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1043        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1044    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1045        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1046    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1047        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1048    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1049        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1050    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1051        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1052    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1053        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1054    alpha_n_upper : float
1055        Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1056    n_upper : float
1057        Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1058    alpha_n_lower : float
1059        Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1060    n_lower : float
1061        Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1062    simple_rk4 : bool
1063        Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
1064
1065    Returns
1066    -------
1067    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1068        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1069    """
1070    # initialize parameters
1071    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1072    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1073    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1074    A_upper = alpha_n_upper ** (1 / n_upper)
1075    A_lower = alpha_n_lower ** (1 / n_lower)
1076    n_eval = t_eval.size
1077    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1078
1079    # initialize arrays
1080    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1081    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1082    v_minus_upper = v_init[:n_creeping_upper]
1083    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1084    #     v_minus_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.v2zeta(v_minus_upper)
1085    v_minus_lower = v_init[n_creeping_upper:]
1086    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1087    full_state[:] = np.NaN
1088    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower))
1089
1090    # make flat ODE function arguments
1091    args = (n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
1092            A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
1093
1094    # integrate
1095    spun_up = 0
1096    i_slip = 0
1097    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1098    i = 0
1099    while i < steps.size - 1:
1100        # get indices
1101        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i+1]
1102        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1103        # call integrator
1104        if simple_rk4:
1105            sol = myrk4(ti, tf, state_plus, t_eval[ji:jf + 1], *args).T
1106        else:
1107            with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1108                sol = solve_ivp(flat_ode_plvis_plvis,
1109                                t_span=[ti, tf],
1110                                y0=state_plus,
1111                                t_eval=t_eval[ji:jf + 1],
1112                                method="RK45", rtol=1e-9, atol=1e-12, args=args)
1113                success = sol.success
1114                sol = sol.y
1115            if not success:
1116                raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1117        # save state to output array
1118        full_state[:, ji:jf + 1] = sol
1119        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1120        if i == steps.size - 2:
1121            break
1122        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1123        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1124            old_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-2*n_slips-1]:steps[i-n_slips]]
1125            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-n_slips]:steps[i+1]]
1126            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1127            old_state_lower = old_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1128            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1129            new_state_lower = new_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1130            old_v_upper = old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1131            old_v_lower = old_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1132            new_v_upper = new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1133            new_v_lower = new_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1134            # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1135            #     old_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(old_v_upper)
1136            #     new_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(new_v_upper)
1137            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1138            lhs_lower = np.abs(old_v_lower - new_v_lower)
1139            rhs_upper = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1140            rhs_lower = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[-1]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_lower)
1141            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper) & np.all(lhs_lower <= rhs_lower)
1142            if stop_now:
1143                spun_up = jf
1144                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1145                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1146        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1147            break
1148        # apply step change only if there is one
1149        if (jf in i_eq):
1150            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1151            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1152            v_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1153            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1154            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1155            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1156            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1157            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1158            v_plus_upper = get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus_upper,
1159                                             delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1160                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_upper,
1161                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_upper,
1162                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_upper)
1163            v_plus_lower = get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus_lower,
1164                                             delta_tau_bounded[n_creeping_upper:, i_slip],
1165                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_lower,
1166                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_lower,
1167                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_lower)
1168            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, v_plus_upper,
1169                                         s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower))
1170            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1171        else:
1172            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1173        # advance
1174        i += 1
1175
1176    # warn if we never spun up
1177    if not spun_up:
1178        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1179
1180    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1181    #     vel_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(vel_upper)
1182
1183    # done
1184    return full_state
1185
1186
1187@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1],
1188                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
1189                    float64, float64, float64, float64, boolean), cache=True)
1190def flat_run_rdlog_plvis(t_eval, i_break, i_eq,
1191                         n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext,
1192                         v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded,
1193                         v_0, alpha_h_upper, alpha_n_lower, n_lower,
1194                         simple_rk4):
1195    r"""
1196    Run the simulation.
1197
1198    Parameters
1199    ----------
1200    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1201        Evaluation times [s]
1202    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1203        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1204    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1205        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1206    n_creeping_upper : int
1207        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1208    n_creeping_lower : int
1209        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1210    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1211        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1212    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1213        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1214    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1215        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1216    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1217        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1218    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1219        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1220    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1221        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1222    v_0 : float
1223        Reference velocity [m/s]
1224    alpha_h_upper : float
1225        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
1226    alpha_n_lower : float
1227        Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1228    n_lower : float
1229        Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1230    simple_rk4 : bool
1231        Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
1232
1233    Returns
1234    -------
1235    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1236        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1237    """
1238    # initialize parameters
1239    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1240    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1241    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1242    A_lower = alpha_n_lower ** (1 / n_lower)
1243    n_eval = t_eval.size
1244    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1245
1246    # initialize arrays
1247    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1248    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1249    assert np.all(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] > 0)
1250    v_minus_upper = np.log(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] / v_0)
1251    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1252    #     v_minus_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.v2zeta(v_minus_upper)
1253    v_minus_lower = v_init[n_creeping_upper:]
1254    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1255    full_state[:] = np.NaN
1256    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower))
1257
1258    # make flat ODE function arguments
1259    args = (n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
1260            v_0, alpha_h_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
1261
1262    # integrate
1263    spun_up = 0
1264    i_slip = 0
1265    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1266    i = 0
1267    while i < steps.size - 1:
1268        # get indices
1269        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i+1]
1270        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1271        # call integrator
1272        if simple_rk4:
1273            sol = myrk4(ti, tf, state_plus, t_eval[ji:jf + 1], *args).T
1274        else:
1275            with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1276                sol = solve_ivp(flat_ode_rdlog_plvis,
1277                                t_span=[ti, tf],
1278                                y0=state_plus,
1279                                t_eval=t_eval[ji:jf + 1],
1280                                method="RK45", rtol=1e-9, atol=1e-12, args=args)
1281                success = sol.success
1282                sol = sol.y
1283            if not success:
1284                raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1285        # save state to output array
1286        full_state[:, ji:jf + 1] = sol
1287        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1288        if i == steps.size - 2:
1289            break
1290        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1291        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1292            old_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-2*n_slips-1]:steps[i-n_slips]]
1293            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-n_slips]:steps[i+1]]
1294            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1295            old_state_lower = old_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1296            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1297            new_state_lower = new_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1298            old_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1299            old_v_lower = old_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1300            new_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1301            new_v_lower = new_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1302            # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1303            #     old_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(old_v_upper)
1304            #     new_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(new_v_upper)
1305            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1306            lhs_lower = np.abs(old_v_lower - new_v_lower)
1307            rhs_upper = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1308            rhs_lower = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[-1]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_lower)
1309            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper) & np.all(lhs_lower <= rhs_lower)
1310            if stop_now:
1311                spun_up = jf
1312                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1313                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1314        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1315            break
1316        # apply step change only if there is one
1317        if (jf in i_eq):
1318            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1319            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1320            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1321            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1322            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1323            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1324            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1325            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1326            zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus_upper,
1327                                                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1328                                                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_h_upper)
1329            v_plus_lower = get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus_lower,
1330                                             delta_tau_bounded[n_creeping_upper:, i_slip],
1331                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_lower,
1332                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_lower,
1333                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_lower)
1334            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper,
1335                                         s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower))
1336            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1337        else:
1338            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1339        # advance
1340        i += 1
1341
1342    # warn if we never spun up
1343    if not spun_up:
1344        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1345
1346    full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :] = \
1347        v_0 * np.exp(full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :])
1348    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1349    #     vel_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(vel_upper)
1350
1351    # done
1352    return full_state
1353
1354
1355@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:, ::1], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1]),
1356      cache=True)
1357# optional(float64[:, ::1]), optional(float64[:, ::1])))
1358def get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis(full_state, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower,
1359                                          G_surf, deep_creep_slip):  # , locked_slip):
1360    """
1361    Calculate the surface displacements given the output of ``run``.
1362
1363    Parameters
1364    ----------
1365    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1366        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1367    n_creeping_upper : int
1368        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1369    n_creeping_lower : int
1370        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1371    G_surf : numpy.ndarray
1372        Surface displacements Green's matrix [-] (dimensions must whether `locked_slip`
1373        and/or `deep_creep_slip` are passed to function)
1374    deep_creep_slip : numpy.ndarray
1375        Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches
1376    locked_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
1377        Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches
1378
1379    Returns
1380    -------
1381    surf_disp : numpy.ndarray
1382        Surface displacement timeseries.
1383    """
1384    # extract timeseries from solution
1385    slip_upper = full_state[:n_creeping_upper, :]
1386    slip_lower = full_state[2 * n_creeping_upper:2 * n_creeping_upper + n_creeping_lower, :]
1387    # add the locked and deep patches to the combined upper & lower slip history matrix
1388    slips_all = np.concatenate((slip_upper, slip_lower), axis=0)
1389    # if locked_slip is not None:s
1390    #     slips_all = np.concatenate((locked_slip[:, :slip_upper.shape[1]], slips_all),
1391    #                                axis=0)
1392    # if deep_creep_slip is not None:
1393    slips_all = np.concatenate((slips_all, deep_creep_slip), axis=0)
1394    # calculate all surface displacements for last full cycle
1395    surf_disps = G_surf @ slips_all
1396    return surf_disps
1397
1398
1399class Fault2D():
1400    """
1401    Base class for the subduction fault mesh.
1402    """
1403
1404    def __init__(self, theta, D_lock, H, nu, E, v_s, halflen,
1405                 upper_rheo, n_upper, lower_rheo, n_lower_left,
1406                 n_lower_right, halflen_factor_lower,
1407                 D_max=None, x1_pretrench=None):
1408        """
1409        Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the
1410        Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.
1411
1412        Parameters
1413        ----------
1414        theta : float
1415            Dip angle [rad] of the plate interface (positive).
1416        D_lock : float
1417            Locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1418        H : float
1419            Subducting plate thickness [m].
1420        nu : float
1421            Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone.
1422        E : float
1423            Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone.
1424        v_s : float
1425            Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
1426        halflen : float
1427            Fault patch half-length [m], used for all locked patches.
1428            If ``D_max`` and ``x1_pretrench`` are not set, this length is also used for all
1429            creeping patches, otherwise, this is their minimum half-length.
1430        upper_rheo : Rheology
1431            Upper plate interface's rheology.
1432        n_upper : int
1433            Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface.
1434        lower_rheo : Rheology
1435            Lower plate interface's rheology. Pass ``None`` if it should not be simulated,
1436            but enforced to have the plate velocity.
1437        n_lower_left : int
1438            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of the bend).
1439        n_lower_right : int
1440            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of the bend).
1441        halflen_factor_lower : float
1442            Factor used to get a different minimum half-length of the patches on the lower
1443            plate interface.
1444        D_max : float, optional
1445            Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1446            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1447            locked zone. (``x1_pretrench`` must be set as well.)
1448        x1_pretrench : float, optional
1449            Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (positive).
1450            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1451            locked zone. (``D_max`` must be set as well.)
1452
1453        References
1454        ----------
1455
1456        .. [kanda2010] Kanda, R. V. S., & Simons, M. (2010).
1457           *An elastic plate model for interseismic deformation in subduction zones.*
1458           Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 115(B3).
1459           doi:`10.1029/2009JB006611 <https://doi.org/10.1029/2009JB006611>`_.
1460        """
1461        # initialize
1462        self.theta = float(theta)
1463        """ Subducting plate dip angle [rad] """
1464        assert 0 < self.theta < np.pi / 2
1465        self.D_lock = float(D_lock)
1466        """ Theoretical locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1467        assert self.D_lock > 0
1468        self.H = float(H)
1469        """ Subducting plate thickness [m] """
1470        assert self.H >= 0
1471        self.nu = float(nu)
1472        """ Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone """
1473        self.E = float(E)
1474        """ Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone """
1475        self.halflen = float(halflen)
1476        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on upper interface """
1477        assert self.halflen > 0
1478        self.upper_rheo = upper_rheo
1479        """ Upper plate interface's rheology """
1480        assert isinstance(self.upper_rheo, Rheology)
1481        self.n_upper = int(n_upper)
1482        """ Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface """
1483        assert self.n_upper >= 1
1484        self.lower_rheo = lower_rheo
1485        """ Lower plate interface's rheology """
1486        assert isinstance(self.lower_rheo, Rheology) or \
1487            (self.lower_rheo is None)
1488        self.n_lower_left = int(n_lower_left)
1489        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of bend) """
1490        assert self.n_lower_left >= 1
1491        self.n_lower_right = int(n_lower_right)
1492        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of bend) """
1493        assert self.n_lower_right >= 1
1494        self.halflen_factor_lower = float(halflen_factor_lower)
1495        """ Prefactor [-] to change the lower interface half-length """
1496        assert self.halflen_factor_lower >= 1
1497        self.lower_halflen = self.halflen * self.halflen_factor_lower
1498        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on lower interface """
1499        if self.lower_rheo is not None:
1500            assert self.H >= 2 * self.lower_halflen, "Plate too thin for given patch sizes."
1501        self.v_s = float(v_s)
1502        """ Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone """
1503        self.mu_over_2vs = self.E / (2 * (1 + self.nu) * 2 * self.v_s)
1504        """ Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m] """
1505
1506        # switch between constant or linearly-varying patch sizes
1507        if (D_max is not None) and (x1_pretrench is not None):
1508            D_max = float(D_max)
1509            x1_pretrench = float(x1_pretrench)
1510            assert D_max > 0
1511            assert x1_pretrench > 0
1512            variable_mesh = True
1513        else:
1514            D_max = None
1515            x1_pretrench = None
1516            variable_mesh = False
1517        self.D_max = D_max
1518        """ Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (optional) """
1519        self.x1_pretrench = x1_pretrench
1520        """ Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (optional) """
1521        self.variable_mesh = variable_mesh
1522        """ Flag whether the creeping patches are linearly-varying in size, or not """
1523
1524        # create mesh, centered about the x2 axis
1525        if self.variable_mesh:
1526            # project the locking depth onto dip angle
1527            L_lock = self.D_lock / np.sin(self.theta)
1528            # get number of locked and creeping patches on upper interface
1529            n_lock = int(L_lock // (2 * self.halflen))
1530            n_creep_up = self.n_upper - n_lock
1531            assert n_creep_up > 0, "Current geometry yields no upper creeping patches."
1532            # project maximum interface depth onto dip angle
1533            L_max = self.D_max / np.sin(self.theta)
1534            # get length of creeping segment that needs to be linearly varying
1535            delta_L = L_max - n_lock * 2 * self.halflen
1536            # get linear half-length increase necessary given the number of patches
1537            # and length of creeping segment, on all three interface regions
1538            delta_h_upper = ((delta_L - 2 * self.halflen * n_creep_up) /
1539                             (n_creep_up**2 - n_creep_up))
1540            delta_h_lower_right = \
1541                ((L_max - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_right) /
1542                 (self.n_lower_right**2 - self.n_lower_right))
1543            delta_h_lower_left = \
1544                ((self.x1_pretrench - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_left) /
1545                 (self.n_lower_left**2 - self.n_lower_left))
1546            # check that we're not running into numerical problems from starkly
1547            # increasing patch sizes
1548            if any([d > 0.2 for d in [delta_h_upper / self.halflen,
1549                                      delta_h_lower_right / self.lower_halflen,
1550                                      delta_h_lower_left / self.lower_halflen]]):
1551                raise ValueError("Half-length increase greater than 20%.")
1552            # build vector of half-lengths
1553            halflen_vec = np.concatenate([
1554                np.ones(n_lock) * self.halflen,
1555                self.halflen + np.arange(n_creep_up) * delta_h_upper,
1556                (self.lower_halflen + np.arange(self.n_lower_left) * delta_h_lower_left)[::-1],
1557                self.lower_halflen + np.arange(self.n_lower_right) * delta_h_lower_right])
1558        else:
1559            # build half-length vector from constant size
1560            halflen_vec = np.ones(self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left + self.n_lower_right
1561                                  ) * self.halflen
1562            halflen_vec[self.n_upper:] *= self.halflen_factor_lower
1563        self.halflen_vec = halflen_vec
1564        """ Half-lengths [m] for each patch in the fault """
1565        s = self.H * np.tan(self.theta / 2)
1566        R = np.array([[np.cos(-self.theta), -np.sin(-self.theta)],
1567                      [np.sin(-self.theta), np.cos(-self.theta)]])
1568        # upper plate interface
1569        upper_right_x1 = np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2*self.halflen_vec[:self.n_upper])])
1570        upper_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(upper_right_x1)
1571        upper_right = R @ np.stack([upper_right_x1, upper_right_x2], axis=0)
1572        # lower left plate interface
1573        temp = self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left - 1:self.n_upper - 1:-1]
1574        lower_left_x1 = -s - np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2*temp)])[::-1]
1575        lower_left_x2 = -self.H * np.ones(self.n_lower_left + 1)
1576        lower_left = np.stack([lower_left_x1, lower_left_x2], axis=0)
1577        # lower right
1578        lower_right_x1 = np.concatenate([
1579            [0], np.cumsum(2*self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left:])])
1580        lower_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(lower_right_x1)
1581        lower_right = (R @ np.stack([lower_right_x1, lower_right_x2], axis=0)
1582                       - np.array([[s], [self.H]]))
1583        # concatenate mesh parts
1584        self.end_upper = upper_right
1585        """ 2-element coordinates of upper fault patch endpoints [m] """
1586        self.end_lower = np.concatenate([lower_left, lower_right[:, 1:]], axis=1)
1587        """ 2-element coordinates of lower fault patch endpoints [m] """
1588        self.end = np.concatenate([self.end_upper, self.end_lower], axis=1)
1589        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch endpoints [m] """
1590        self.mid = np.concatenate([upper_right[:, :-1] + upper_right[:, 1:],
1591                                   lower_left[:, :-1] + lower_left[:, 1:],
1592                                   lower_right[:, :-1] + lower_right[:, 1:]],
1593                                  axis=1) / 2
1594        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1595        self.mid_x1 = self.mid[0, :]
1596        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1597        self.mid_x2 = self.mid[1, :]
1598        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1599        # access subparts
1600        self.ix_upper = np.arange(self.mid_x1.size) < upper_right_x1.size
1601        """ Mask of upper fault interface patches """
1602        self.ix_lower = ~self.ix_upper
1603        """ Mask of lower fault interface patches (if existing) """
1604        # locked is the part that slips coseismically on the upper plate interface
1605        self.x1_lock = self.D_lock / np.tan(self.theta)
1606        """ Theoretical surface location [m] of end of locked interface """
1607        ix_locked = self.mid_x1 <= self.x1_lock - self.halflen
1608        ix_locked[self.n_upper:] = False
1609        self.ix_locked = ix_locked
1610        """ Mask of fault patches that are locked interseismically """
1611        self.n_locked = (self.ix_locked).sum()
1612        """ Number [-] of locked patches """
1613        # assert self.n_locked == n_lock
1614        self.n_creeping = (~self.ix_locked).sum()
1615        """ Number [-] of creeping patches """
1616        self.n_creeping_upper = (~self.ix_locked[:self.n_upper]).sum()
1617        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface """
1618        # assert self.n_creeping_upper == n_creep_up
1619        self.n_creeping_lower = self.n_creeping - self.n_creeping_upper
1620        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface """
1621        assert self.n_creeping_lower == n_lower_left + n_lower_right
1622        self.mid_x1_locked = self.mid_x1[self.ix_locked]
1623        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
1624        self.mid_x2_locked = self.mid_x2[self.ix_locked]
1625        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
1626        self.mid_x1_creeping = self.mid_x1[~self.ix_locked]
1627        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
1628        self.mid_x2_creeping = self.mid_x2[~self.ix_locked]
1629        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
1630        # for later calculations, need theta and unit vectors in vector form
1631        theta_vec = np.ones_like(self.mid_x1) * self.theta
1632        theta_vec[self.n_upper:self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left] = np.pi
1633        theta_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left:] += np.pi
1634        self.theta_vec = theta_vec
1635        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for all fault patches """
1636        self.e_f = np.stack([np.sin(self.theta_vec), np.cos(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
1637        """ Unit vectors [-] normal to fault patches"""
1638        self.e_s = np.stack([-np.cos(self.theta_vec), np.sin(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
1639        """ Unit vectors [-] in fault patch slip direction """
1640        # get external (from the locked to the creeping patches) stress kernel
1641        K = Klinedisp(self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1642                      self.mid_x1_locked, self.mid_x2_locked,
1643                      self.halflen_vec[self.ix_locked],
1644                      self.theta_vec[self.ix_locked], self.nu, self.E
1645                      )[:, :self.n_locked]
1646        Kx1x1 = K[:self.n_creeping, :]
1647        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping:2*self.n_creeping, :]
1648        Kx1x2 = K[2*self.n_creeping:3*self.n_creeping, :]
1649        K = np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()]
