1650                     ).reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_locked).transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
1651        self.K_ext = np.einsum("ki,ijkl,li->ij", self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
1652                               K, self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked], optimize=True)
1653        """ External stress kernel [Pa/m] """
1654        # get internal (within creeping patches) stress kernel
1655        K = Klinedisp(self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1656                      self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1657                      self.halflen_vec[~self.ix_locked],
1658                      self.theta_vec[~self.ix_locked], self.nu, self.E
1659                      )[:, :self.n_creeping]
1660        Kx1x1 = K[:self.n_creeping, :]
1661        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping:2*self.n_creeping, :]
1662        Kx1x2 = K[2*self.n_creeping:3*self.n_creeping, :]
1663        K = np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()]
1664                     ).reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_creeping).transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
1665        self.K_int = np.einsum("ki,ijkl,li->ij", self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
1666                               K, self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked], optimize=True)
1667        """ Internal stress kernel [Pa/m] """
1668        self.n_state_upper = self.upper_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_upper
1669        """ Size [-] of upper plate interface state variable """
1670        self.n_state_lower = (self.lower_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_lower
1671                              if self.lower_rheo is not None
1672                              else 2 * self.n_creeping_lower)
1673        """ Size [-] of lower plate interface state variable """
1674        if (self.n_creeping_upper == 0) or (self.n_creeping_lower == 0):
1675            raise ValueError("Defined geometry results in zero creeping patches in "
1676                             "either the upper or lower plate interface.")
1677        # # if upper rheology is Burgers, tell it our specific shear modulus
1678        # if isinstance(self.upper_rheo, rheologies.LinearBurgers):
1679        #     self.upper_rheo.set_G(self.K_int[:self.n_creeping_upper, :self.n_creeping_upper])
1680        # discretized locking depth
1681        self.D_lock_disc = -self.end_upper[1, self.n_locked]
1682        """ Discretized locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1683        self.x1_lock_disc = self.D_lock_disc / np.tan(self.theta)
1684        """ Discretized surface location [m] of end of locked interface """
1685
1686
1687class SubductionSimulation():
1688    """
1689    Subduction simulation container class.
1690    """
1691
1692    def __init__(self, v_plate, n_cycles_max, n_samples_per_eq, delta_tau_max, v_max,
1693                 fault, Ds_0, Ds_0_logsigma, T_rec, T_rec_logsigma, D_asp_min,
1694                 D_asp_max, T_anchor, T_last, enforce_v_plate, largehalflen,
1695                 t_obs, pts_surf):
1696        """
1697        Create a subduction simulation.
1698
1699        Parameters
1700        ----------
1701        v_plate : float
1702            Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology
1703        n_cycles_max : int
1704            Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
1705        n_samples_per_eq : int
1706            Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
1707        delta_tau_max : float
1708            Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches
1709        v_max : float
1710            Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches
1711        fault : Fault2D
1712            Fault object
1713        Ds_0 : numpy.ndarray
1714            Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es)
1715        Ds_0_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
1716            Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space
1717        T_rec : numpy.ndarray
1718            Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake
1719        T_rec_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
1720            Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
1721        D_asp_min : numpy.ndarray
1722            Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
1723        D_asp_max : numpy.ndarray
1724            Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
1725        T_anchor : str
1726            Anchor date where observations end
1727        T_last : list
1728            Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
1729        enforce_v_plate : bool
1730            Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not
1731        largehalflen : float
1732            Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m]
1733        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
1734            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
1735            or as Timestamps
1736        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
1737            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
1738        """
1739
1740        # save general sequence & fault parameters
1741        self.v_plate = float(v_plate)
1742        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology """
1743        self.n_cycles_max = int(n_cycles_max)
1744        """ Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-] """
1745        self.n_samples_per_eq = int(n_samples_per_eq)
1746        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-] """
1747        self.delta_tau_max = float(delta_tau_max)
1748        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches """
1749        self.v_max = float(v_max)
1750        """ Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches """
1751
1752        # define fault
1753        assert isinstance(fault, Fault2D)
1754        if not (isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or
1755                isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic)) or \
1756           not (isinstance(fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or
1757                (fault.lower_rheo is None)):
1758            raise NotImplementedError("SubductionSimulation is only implemented for "
1759                                      "NonlinearViscous or RateStateSteadyLogarithmic "
1760                                      "rheologies in the upper interface, and NonlinearViscous "
1761                                      "rheology in the lower interface.")
1762        self.fault = fault
1763        """ Fault object """
1764
1765        # cast earthquake slips as NumPy array
1766        self.Ds_0 = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0)
1767        """ Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es) """
1768        self.Ds_0_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0_logsigma)
1769        """ Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space """
1770        # load recurrence times
1771        self.T_rec = np.atleast_1d(T_rec)
1772        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake """
1773        self.T_rec_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(T_rec_logsigma)
1774        """ Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space """
1775        # load the minimum and maximum depths of the earthquakes
1776        self.D_asp_min = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_min)
1777        """ Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
1778        self.D_asp_max = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_max)
1779        """ Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
1780        assert all([D <= self.fault.D_lock for D in self.D_asp_max]), \
1781            f"Asperity depths {self.D_asp_max/1e3} km are deeper than the " \
1782            f"locking depth {self.fault.D_lock/1e3}."
1783        self.T_anchor = str(T_anchor)
1784        """ Anchor date where observations end """
1785        assert isinstance(T_last, list) and all([isinstance(tl, str) for tl in T_last])
1786        self.T_last = T_last
1787        """ Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake """
1788        # create a NumPy array that for each locked asperity has the slip per earthquake
1789        self.slip_mask = np.logical_and(self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1)
1790                                        < -self.D_asp_min.reshape(1, -1),
1791                                        self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1)
1792                                        > -self.D_asp_max.reshape(1, -1))
1793        """ Mask that matches each earthquake to a fault patch """
1794        self.T_fullcycle = np.lcm.reduce(self.T_rec)
1795        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle """
1796        self.n_eq = self.Ds_0.size
1797        """ Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence """
1798        self.n_eq_per_asp = (self.T_fullcycle / self.T_rec).astype(int)
1799        """ Number of earthquakes per asperity and full cycle """
1800
1801        # create realization of the slip amount and earthquake timings
1802        rng = np.random.default_rng()
1803        # first, create realizations of occurence times
1804        # note that this will result in a varying plate velocity rate
1805        # (ignore zero-slip earthquakes)
1806        self.T_rec_per_asp = [rng.lognormal(np.log(t), s, n) for t, s, n in
1807                              zip(self.T_rec, self.T_rec_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)]
1808        """ Recurrence time [a] realization """
1809        self.Ds_0_per_asp = [rng.lognormal(np.log(d), s, n) if d > 0
1810                             else np.array([d] * n) for d, s, n in
1811                             zip(self.Ds_0, self.Ds_0_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)]
1812        """ Fault slip [m] realization """
1813
1814        # sanity check that in each asperity, the nominal plate rate is recovered
1815        self.slip_asperities = self.slip_mask.astype(int) * self.Ds_0.reshape(1, -1)
1816        """ Slip [m] for each earthquake in each asperity """
1817        v_eff_in_asp = (self.slip_asperities / self.T_rec.reshape(1, -1)).sum(axis=1)
1818        assert np.allclose(v_eff_in_asp, self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25), \
1819            "The nominal plate rate is not recovered in all asperities.\n" \
1820            f"Plate velocity = {self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25}\n" \
1821            f"Effective velocity in each asperity:\n{v_eff_in_asp}"
1822
1823        # second, we need to shift the random realization for each earthquake
1824        # individually such that they all yield the same v_plate (enforced or not)
1825        # get the effective recurrence time as implied by the T_rec realizations
1826        T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(t) for t in self.T_rec_per_asp])
1827        # same for the effective cumulative slip
1828        Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(d) for d in self.Ds_0_per_asp])
1829        # we need to scale each individual sequence such that it implies the same
1830        # recurrence time and cumulative slip in each asperity
1831        # (again ignoring zero-slip earthquakes)
1832        T_fullcycle_eff_mean = np.mean(T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff)
1833        Ds_0_fullcycle_mean = np.ma.masked_equal(Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff, 0).mean()
1834        T_rec_per_asp_adj = [np.array(self.T_rec_per_asp[i]) * T_fullcycle_eff_mean
1835                             / T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i] for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1836        Ds_0_per_asp_adj = [np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i]) * Ds_0_fullcycle_mean
1837                            / Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i] if self.Ds_0[i] > 0
1838                            else np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i]) for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1839        # now each asperity has the same effective plate velocity, which can be different
1840        # from the nominal one - if we want to enforce the nominal plate velocity,
1841        # we can rescale the recurrence times again
1842        self.enforce_v_plate = bool(enforce_v_plate)
1843        """ Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not """
1844        ix_nonzero_slip = np.argmax(self.Ds_0 > 0)
1845        v_plate_eff = (sum(Ds_0_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
1846                       / sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip]) / 86400 / 365.25)
1847        if self.enforce_v_plate:
1848            v_plate_factor = self.v_plate / v_plate_eff
1849            for i in range(self.n_eq):
1850                T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] /= v_plate_factor
1851            v_plate_eff = self.v_plate
1852        self.v_plate_eff = v_plate_eff
1853        """ Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s] """
1854        self.T_eff = sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[0])
1855        """ Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence """
1856
1857        # third, we need to create a list of earthquake dates and associated slips
1858        temp_slips = np.vstack([self.slip_mask[:, i].reshape(1, -1)
1859                                * Ds_0_per_asp_adj[i].reshape(-1, 1)
1860                                for i in range(self.n_eq)])
1861        year_offsets = [(pd.Period(self.T_anchor, "D") - pd.Period(self.T_last[i], "D")
1862                         ).n / 365.25 for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1863        eq_df_index = np.concatenate(
1864            [self.T_eff -
1865             (np.cumsum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[i]) - T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] + year_offsets[i])
1866             for i in range(self.n_eq)])
1867        # round the dates to the closest day and combine earthquakes
1868        eq_df_index_rounded = np.around(eq_df_index * 365.25) / 365.25
1869        # build a DataFrame with exact and rounded times
1870        eq_df = pd.DataFrame(data=temp_slips)
1871        eq_df["time"] = eq_df_index
1872        eq_df["rounded"] = eq_df_index_rounded
1873        # now aggregate by rounded time, keeping the minimum exact time, and summing slip
1874        agg_dict = {"time": "min"}
1875        agg_dict.update({c: "sum" for c in range(self.fault.n_locked)})
1876        eq_df = eq_df.groupby("rounded").agg(agg_dict)
1877        # convert time column to index and sort
1878        eq_df.set_index("time", inplace=True)
1879        eq_df.sort_index(inplace=True)
1880        assert np.allclose(eq_df.sum(axis=0), eq_df.sum(axis=0)[0])
1881        self.eq_df = eq_df
1882        """
1883        DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m]
1884        for each asperity
1885        """
1886
1887        # fourth, we need to create a list of dates to use internally when evaluating
1888        # the earthquake cycle - this is independent of the observation dates
1889        i_frac_cumsum = np.concatenate([[self.eq_df.index[-1] - self.T_eff],
1890                                        self.eq_df.index.values])
1891        T_frac = np.diff(i_frac_cumsum)
1892        t_eval = np.concatenate(
1893            [np.logspace(0, np.log10(1 + T_frac[i]), self.n_samples_per_eq, endpoint=False)
1894             - 1 + i_frac_cumsum[i] + j*self.T_eff
1895             for j in range(self.n_cycles_max) for i, t in enumerate(T_frac)])
1896        num_neg = (t_eval < 0).sum()
1897        t_eval = np.roll(t_eval, -num_neg)
1898        t_eval[-num_neg:] += self.n_cycles_max * self.T_eff
1899        self.t_eval = np.sort(np.concatenate(
1900            [t_eval, np.arange(self.n_cycles_max + 1) * self.T_eff]))
1901        """ Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
1902        self.n_eval = self.t_eval.size
1903        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-] """
1904
1905        # fifth, for the integration, we need the indices of the timesteps that mark either
1906        # an earthquake or the start of a new cycle
1907        self.n_slips = self.eq_df.shape[0]
1908        """ Number of slips in a sequence [-] """
1909        self.ix_break = [i*(self.n_slips * self.n_samples_per_eq + 1)
1910                         for i in range(self.n_cycles_max + 1)]
1911        """ Indices of breaks between cycles """
1912        self.ix_eq = [self.ix_break[i] + j * self.n_samples_per_eq - num_neg + 1
1913                      for i in range(self.n_cycles_max) for j in range(1, 1 + self.n_slips)]
1914        """ Indices of earthquakes """
1915
1916        # sixth and last, for the final loop, we need a joint timesteps array between internal
1917        # and external (observation) timestamps, such that we can debug, check early stopping,
1918        # and restrict the output to the requested timeseries
1919        if isinstance(t_obs, pd.DatetimeIndex):
1920            t_obs = self.T_eff + (t_obs - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor)
1921                                  ).total_seconds().values / 86400 / 365.25
1922        elif isinstance(t_obs, np.ndarray):
1923            if np.all(t_obs < 0):
1924                # this format is relative to T_anchor and more stable when T_eff varies
1925                t_obs = self.T_eff + t_obs
1926            assert np.all(t_obs >= 0) and np.all(t_obs < self.T_eff), \
1927                f"Range of 't_obs' ({t_obs.min()}-{t_obs.max():} years) outside of " \
1928                f"the earthquake cycle period ({self.T_eff:} years)."
1929        else:
1930            raise ValueError("Unknown 't_obs' data type.")
1931        self.t_obs = t_obs
1932        """ Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
1933        # combine all possible timesteps
1934        t_obs_shifted = self.t_obs + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
1935        self.t_eval_joint = np.unique(np.concatenate((self.t_eval, t_obs_shifted)))
1936        """
1937        Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps
1938        [decimal years since cycle start]
1939        """
1940        # get indices of each individual subset in the new timesteps array
1941        self.ix_break_joint = \
1942            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_break]))
1943        """ Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps """
1944        self.ix_eq_joint = \
1945            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_eq]))
1946        """ Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps """
1947        self.ix_obs_joint = \
1948            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, t_obs_shifted))
1949        """ Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps """
1950
1951        # get vectors of upper plate rheology parameters
1952        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1953            # alpha_h
1954            self.alpha_h_vec = \
1955                self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
1956                    -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper])
1957            r""" Depth-variable :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] of upper plate interface """
1958        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
1959            # A, alpha_n, and n
1960            alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec = \
1961                self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
1962                    -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper], self.v_plate)
1963            self.alpha_n_vec = alpha_n_vec
1964            r""" Depth-variable :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] of upper plate interface """
1965            self.n_vec = n_vec
1966            r""" Depth-variable :math:`n` [-] of upper plate interface """
1967            self.A_vec = A_vec
1968            r""" Depth-variable :math:`A ` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] of upper plate interface """
1969        else:
1970            raise NotImplementedError
1971
1972        # get unbounded delta_tau
1973        self.delta_tau_unbounded = self.fault.K_ext @ self.eq_df.values.T
1974        """ Unbounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
1975        # get pseudoinverse of K_int for tapered slip
1976        self.K_int_inv_upper = np.linalg.pinv(
1977            self.fault.K_int[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :self.fault.n_creeping_upper])
1978        """ Inverse of K_int [m/Pa] """
1979        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower = \
1980            ((self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_max)**(1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n) -
1981             (self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_plate)**(1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n)
1982             if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None else np.inf)
1983        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in lower plate from capped velocity """
1984        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
1985            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = \
1986                (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_max)**(1 / self.n_vec) - \
1987                (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_plate)**(1 / self.n_vec)
1988        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1989            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = self.alpha_h_vec * \
1990                (np.log(self.v_max / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0) -
1991                 np.log(self.v_plate / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0))
1992        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper
1993        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in upper plate from capped velocity """
1994        self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper = np.fmin(self.delta_tau_max,
1995                                                 self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper)
1996        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in upper plate """
1997        self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower = \
1998            (min(self.delta_tau_max, self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower)
1999             if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None else np.inf)
2000        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in lower plate """
2001        # create tapered slip by making delta_tau linearly increase until delta_tau_max
2002        delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_unbounded.copy()
2003        delta_tau_bounded[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] = \
2004            np.fmin(self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper.reshape(-1, 1),
2005                    self.delta_tau_unbounded[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :])
2006        self.delta_tau_bounded = delta_tau_bounded
2007        """ Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
2008        # get the additional slip
2009        self.slip_taper = (self.K_int_inv_upper @
2010                           (self.delta_tau_bounded - self.delta_tau_unbounded
2011                            )[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :])
2012        # check if the lower plate should have been bounded as well
2013        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2014            assert not np.any(np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, :])
2015                              > self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower), \
2016                ("Maximum stress change delta_tau_bounded "
2017                 f"{np.max(np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded)):.2e} Pa in lower interface "
2018                 f"above delta_tau_max = {self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower:.2e} Pa")
2019        self.slip_taper_ts = \
2020            pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=self.slip_taper.T) \
2021            .cumsum(axis=0).reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
2022        """ Timeseries of tapered slip [m] on the upper creeping fault patches """
2023
2024        # need the imagined location and orientation of the deep creep patches
2025        self.largehalflen = float(largehalflen)
2026        """ Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m] """
2027        self.mid_deep_x1 = \
2028            np.array([self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2029                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2030                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2031                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2032                      * self.largehalflen,
2033                      self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1]
2034                      - self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1]
2035                      - self.largehalflen,
2036                      self.fault.mid_x1[-1]
2037                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2038                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2039                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2040                      * self.largehalflen])
2041        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2042        self.mid_deep_x2 = \
2043            np.array([self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2044                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2045                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2046                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2047                      * self.largehalflen,
2048                      self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1],
2049                      self.fault.mid_x2[-1]
2050                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2051                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2052                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2053                      * self.largehalflen])
2054        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2055        self.theta_vec_deep = \
2056            np.array([self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1],
2057                      np.pi,
2058                      self.fault.theta_vec[-1]])
2059        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for deep creep fault patches """
2060
2061        # create the Green's matrices
2062        self.pts_surf = pts_surf
2063        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of surface observation points [m] """
2064        self.n_stations = self.pts_surf.size
2065        """ Number of surface observing stations """
2066        self.G_surf_fault = Glinedisp(
2067            self.pts_surf, 0, self.fault.mid_x1, self.fault.mid_x2,
2068            self.fault.halflen_vec, self.fault.theta_vec, self.fault.nu
2069            )[:, :self.fault.mid_x1.size]
2070        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the main fault patches to surface motion """
2071        self.G_surf_deep = Glinedisp(
2072            self.pts_surf, 0, self.mid_deep_x1, self.mid_deep_x2,
2073            self.largehalflen, self.theta_vec_deep, self.fault.nu)[:, :3]
2074        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the deep creep patches to surface motion """
2075        self.G_surf = np.hstack([self.G_surf_fault, self.G_surf_deep])
2076        """ Joint Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the entire ESPM to surface motion """
2077
2078        # calculate the best initial velocity state from the steady state ODE
2079        v_plate_vec = np.ones(self.fault.n_creeping) * self.v_plate
2080        v_plate_vec[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:] *= -1
2081        self.v_plate_vec = v_plate_vec
2082        """ Vector with the plate velocity for each creeping patch [m/s] """
2083        # get the initial velocity, taking advantage of the option that there could be a
2084        # deep transition zone
2085        v_init = v_plate_vec.copy()
2086        if self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition is not None:
2087            ix_deep = np.argmin(np.abs(-self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
2088                                       - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition
2089                                       - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition_width))
2090            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2091                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(self.v_plate * 1e-6, self.v_plate,
2092                                               num=ix_deep, endpoint=False)
2093            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2094                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(0, self.v_plate, num=ix_deep, endpoint=False)
2095        self.v_init = v_init
2096        """ Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s] """
2097
2098    @property
2099    def locked_slip(self):
2100        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches for observation timespan """
2101        return self.eq_df.cumsum(axis=0) \
2102            .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0).values.T
2103
2104    @property
2105    def deep_creep_slip(self):
2106        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches for observation timestamps """
2107        return (np.tile(self.t_obs.reshape(1, -1), (3, 1))
2108                * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
2109                * self.v_plate_eff * 86400 * 365.25)
2110
2111    @staticmethod
2112    def read_config_file(config_file):
2113        """
2114        Read a configuration file and return it as a parsed dictionary.
2115
2116        Parameters
2117        ----------
2118        config_file : str
2119            Path to INI configuration file.
2120
2121        Returns
2122        -------
2123        cfg_dict : dict
2124            Parsed configuration file.
2125        """
2126
2127        # load configuration file
2128        cfg = configparser.ConfigParser()
2129        cfg.optionxform = str
2130        with open(config_file, mode="rt") as f:
2131            cfg.read_file(f)
2132        cfg_seq, cfg_fault, cfg_mesh = cfg["sequence"], cfg["fault"], cfg["mesh"]
2133
2134        # parse rheologies
2135        upper_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["upper_rheo"])
2136        upper_rheo_type = upper_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2137        upper_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in upper_rheo_dict.items()}
2138        try:
2139            lower_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["lower_rheo"])
2140        except KeyError:
2141            lower_rheo_type = None
2142            lower_rheo_kw_args = None
2143        else:
2144            lower_rheo_type = lower_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2145            lower_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in lower_rheo_dict.items()}
2146
2147        # parse everything else
2148        cfg_dict = {
2149            "theta": np.deg2rad(cfg_fault.getfloat("theta_deg")),
2150            "D_lock": cfg_fault.getfloat("D_lock"),
2151            "H": cfg_fault.getfloat("H"),
2152            "nu": cfg_fault.getfloat("nu"),
2153            "E": cfg_fault.getfloat("E"),
2154            "v_s": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_s"),
2155            "halflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen"),
2156            "n_upper": cfg_mesh.getint("n_up"),
2157            "n_lower_left": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_l"),
2158            "n_lower_right": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_r"),
2159            "halflen_factor_lower": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen_factor_lower"),
2160            "D_max": cfg_mesh.getfloat("D_max", fallback=None),
2161            "x1_pretrench": cfg_mesh.getfloat("x1_pretrench", fallback=None),
2162            "v_plate": cfg_seq.getfloat("v_plate"),
2163            "n_cycles_max": cfg_seq.getint("n_cycles_max"),
2164            "n_samples_per_eq": cfg_seq.getint("n_samples_per_eq"),
2165            "delta_tau_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("delta_tau_max", fallback=np.inf),
2166            "v_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_max", fallback=np.inf),
2167            "Ds_0": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["Ds_0"])),
2168            "Ds_0_logsigma": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["Ds_0_logsigma"])),
2169            "T_rec": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["T_rec"])),
2170            "T_rec_logsigma": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["T_rec_logsigma"])),
2171            "D_asp_min": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["D_asp_min"])),
2172            "D_asp_max": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["D_asp_max"])),
2173            "T_anchor": cfg_seq.get("T_anchor"),
2174            "T_last": json.loads(cfg_seq["T_last"]),
2175            "enforce_v_plate": cfg_seq.getboolean("enforce_v_plate"),
2176            "largehalflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("largehalflen"),
2177            "upper_rheo_type": upper_rheo_type,
2178            "lower_rheo_type": lower_rheo_type,
2179            "upper_rheo_kw_args": upper_rheo_kw_args,
2180            "lower_rheo_kw_args": lower_rheo_kw_args
2181            }
2182        return cfg_dict
2183
2184    @classmethod
2185    def from_config_dict(cls, cfg, t_obs, pts_surf):
2186        """
2187        Create a SubductionSimulation object from a configuration dictionary.
2188
2189        Parameters
2190        ----------
2191        cfg : dict
2192            Dictionary containing all parsed elements from the configuration file
2193        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
2194            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
2195            or as Timestamps
2196        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
2197            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
2198
2199        See Also
2200        --------
2201        read_config_file : To load a configuration file into a dictionary.
2202        """
2203
2204        # create rheology objects
2205        upper_rheo = globals()[cfg["upper_rheo_type"]](**cfg["upper_rheo_kw_args"])
2206        if cfg["lower_rheo_type"] is None:
2207            lower_rheo = None
2208        else:
2209            lower_rheo = globals()[cfg["lower_rheo_type"]](**cfg["lower_rheo_kw_args"])
2210
2211        # create fault object
2212        fault = Fault2D(theta=cfg["theta"],
2213                        D_lock=cfg["D_lock"],
2214                        H=cfg["H"],
2215                        nu=cfg["nu"],
2216                        E=cfg["E"],
2217                        v_s=cfg["v_s"],
2218                        halflen=cfg["halflen"],
2219                        upper_rheo=upper_rheo,
2220                        n_upper=cfg["n_upper"],
2221                        lower_rheo=lower_rheo,
2222                        n_lower_left=cfg["n_lower_left"],
2223                        n_lower_right=cfg["n_lower_right"],
2224                        halflen_factor_lower=cfg["halflen_factor_lower"],
2225                        D_max=cfg["D_max"],
2226                        x1_pretrench=cfg["x1_pretrench"])
2227
2228        # create simulation object
2229        return cls(v_plate=cfg["v_plate"],
2230                   n_cycles_max=cfg["n_cycles_max"],
2231                   n_samples_per_eq=cfg["n_samples_per_eq"],
2232                   delta_tau_max=cfg["delta_tau_max"],
2233                   v_max=cfg["v_max"],
2234                   fault=fault,
2235                   Ds_0=cfg["Ds_0"],
2236                   Ds_0_logsigma=cfg["Ds_0_logsigma"],
2237                   T_rec=cfg["T_rec"],
2238                   T_rec_logsigma=cfg["T_rec_logsigma"],
2239                   D_asp_min=cfg["D_asp_min"],
2240                   D_asp_max=cfg["D_asp_max"],
2241                   T_anchor=cfg["T_anchor"],
2242                   T_last=cfg["T_last"],
2243                   enforce_v_plate=cfg["enforce_v_plate"],
2244                   largehalflen=cfg["largehalflen"],
2245                   t_obs=t_obs,
2246                   pts_surf=pts_surf)
2247
2248    @staticmethod
2249    def get_n(alpha_n, alpha_eff, v_eff):
2250        r"""
2251        Calculate the real linear viscous strength constant from the effective one.
2252
2253        Parameters
2254        ----------
2255        alpha_n : float
2256            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2257        alpha_eff : float
2258            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2259        v_eff : float
2260            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2261
2262        Returns
2263        -------
2264        n : float
2265            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2266        """
2267        return (np.log(alpha_n) + np.log(v_eff)) / (np.log(alpha_eff) + np.log(v_eff))
2268
2269    @staticmethod
2270    def get_alpha_n(alpha_eff, n, v_eff):
2271        r"""
2272        Calculate the real linear viscous strength constant from the effective one.
2273
2274        Parameters
2275        ----------
2276        alpha_eff : float
2277            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2278        n : float
2279            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2280        v_eff : float
2281            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2282
2283        Returns
2284        -------
2285        alpha_n : float
2286            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2287        """
2288        alpha_n = alpha_eff**n * v_eff**(n-1)
2289        return alpha_n
2290
2291    @staticmethod
2292    def get_alpha_eff(alpha_n, n, v_eff):
2293        r"""
2294        Calculate the effective linear viscous strength constant from the real one.
2295
2296        Parameters
2297        ----------
2298        alpha_n : float
2299            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2300        n : float
2301            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2302        v_eff : float
2303            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2304
2305        Returns
2306        -------
2307        alpha_eff : float
2308            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2309        """
2310        if isinstance(v_eff, np.ndarray):
2311            temp = v_eff.copy()
2312            temp[temp == 0] = np.NaN
2313        else:
2314            temp = v_eff
2315        alpha_eff = alpha_n**(1/n) * temp**((1-n)/n)
2316        return alpha_eff
2317
2318    @staticmethod
2319    def get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(alpha_h, v_eff):
2320        r"""
2321        Calculate the effective viscosity from the rate-dependent friction.
2322
2323        Parameters
2324        ----------
2325        alpha_h : float
2326            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
2327            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
2328            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
2329        v_eff : float
2330            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2331
2332        Returns
2333        -------
2334        alpha_eff : float
2335            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2336        """
2337        if isinstance(v_eff, np.ndarray):
2338            temp = v_eff.copy()
2339            temp[temp == 0] = np.NaN
2340        else:
2341            temp = v_eff
2342        alpha_eff = alpha_h / temp
2343        return alpha_eff
2344
2345    def run(self, simple_rk4=False):
2346        """
2347        Run a full simulation.
2348        """
2349        # run forward integration
2350        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
2351            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2352                full_state = flat_run_rdlog(
2353                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25, self.ix_break_joint, self.ix_eq_joint,
2354                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower, self.fault.K_int,
2355                    self.fault.K_ext, self.v_plate_vec, self.v_init, self.slip_taper,
2356                    self.delta_tau_bounded, self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0, self.alpha_h_vec,
2357                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs)
2358            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2359                full_state = flat_run_plvis(
2360                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25, self.ix_break_joint, self.ix_eq_joint,
2361                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower, self.fault.K_int,
2362                    self.fault.K_ext, self.v_plate_vec, self.v_init, self.slip_taper,
2363                    self.delta_tau_bounded, self.alpha_n_vec, self.n_vec, self.A_vec,
2364                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs)
2365            else:
2366                raise NotImplementedError
2367        elif isinstance(self.fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2368            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2369                full_state = flat_run_plvis_plvis(
2370                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25, self.ix_break_joint, self.ix_eq_joint,
2371                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower, self.fault.K_int,
2372                    self.fault.K_ext, self.v_plate_vec, self.v_init, self.slip_taper,
2373                    self.delta_tau_bounded, self.fault.upper_rheo.alpha_n,
2374                    self.fault.upper_rheo.n, self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n,
2375                    self.fault.lower_rheo.n, simple_rk4)
2376            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2377                full_state = flat_run_rdlog_plvis(
2378                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25, self.ix_break_joint, self.ix_eq_joint,
2379                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower, self.fault.K_int,
2380                    self.fault.K_ext, self.v_plate_vec, self.v_init, self.slip_taper,
2381                    self.delta_tau_bounded, self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0,
2382                    self.fault.upper_rheo.alpha_h, self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n,
2383                    self.fault.lower_rheo.n, simple_rk4)
2384            else:
2385                raise NotImplementedError
2386        else:
2387            raise NotImplementedError
2388        # extract the observations that were actually requested
2389        obs_state = full_state[:, self.ix_obs_joint].copy()
2390        # since we're only calculating transient surface displacements, need to
2391        # remove the tapered slip due to bounded stresses
2392        obs_state[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] -= self.slip_taper_ts.values.T
2393        # convert to surface displacements
2394        surf_disps = get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis(
2395            obs_state, self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
2396            np.ascontiguousarray(self.G_surf[:, self.fault.n_locked:]),
2397            self.deep_creep_slip)
2398        return full_state, obs_state, surf_disps
2399
2400    def zero_obs_at_eq(self, surf_disps):
2401        """
2402        Reset to zero the surface displacement timeseries every time an earthquake happens.
2403        """
2404        obs_zeroed = surf_disps.copy()
2405        slips_obs = np.logical_and(self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index,
2406                                   self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index)
2407        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
2408        if n_slips_obs == 0:
2409            obs_zeroed -= obs_zeroed[:, 0].reshape(-1, 1)
2410        else:
2411            i_slips_obs = [np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq) for t_eq
2412                           in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]]
2413            obs_zeroed[:, :i_slips_obs[0]] -= obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0] - 1].reshape(-1, 1)
2414            obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0]:] -= obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0]].reshape(-1, 1)
2415            for i in range(1, n_slips_obs):
2416                obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[i]:] -= obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[i]].reshape(-1, 1)
2417        return obs_zeroed
2418
2419    def _reduce_full_state(self, data):
2420        # get all NaN columns
2421        cols_all_nan = np.all(np.isnan(data), axis=0)
2422        # check if there was early stopping
2423        if cols_all_nan.sum() > 0:
2424            # get the border indices where integrations have been skipped
2425            ix_last, ix_first = np.flatnonzero(cols_all_nan)[[0, -1]]
2426            ix_last -= 1
2427            ix_first += 1
2428            # get indices before and after the NaN period
2429            ix_valid = np.r_[0:ix_last, ix_first:self.t_eval_joint.size]
2430            # subset data
2431            data = data[:, ix_valid]
2432            t_sub = self.t_eval_joint[ix_valid].copy()
2433            t_sub[ix_last:] -= self.t_eval_joint[ix_first] - self.t_eval_joint[ix_last]
2434            n_cyc_completed = int(np.round(self.t_eval_joint[ix_last] / self.T_eff)) + 1
2435        else:
2436            t_sub = self.t_eval_joint.copy()
2437            n_cyc_completed = self.n_cycles_max + 1
2438        # done
2439        return data, t_sub, n_cyc_completed
2440
2441    def plot_surface_displacements(self, obs_zeroed, obs_noisy=None):
2442        """
2443        Plot the observers' surface displacement timeseries.
2444
2445        Parameters
2446        ----------
2447        obs_zeroed : numpy.ndarray
2448            Surface displacements as output by :meth:`~zero_obs_at_eq`.
2449        obs_noisy : numpy.ndarray, optional
2450            Noisy surface observations.
2451
2452        Returns
2453        -------
2454        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2455        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2456        """
2457        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2458        # some helper variables
2459        isort = np.argsort(self.pts_surf)
2460        i_off = 3 * np.std(obs_zeroed.ravel())
2461        # get float dates of observed earthquakes
2462        slips_obs = np.logical_and(self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index,
2463                                   self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index)
2464        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
2465        if n_slips_obs > 0:
2466            i_slips_obs = [np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq) for t_eq
2467                           in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]]
2468            t_last_slips = [self.t_obs[islip] for islip in i_slips_obs]
2469        else:
2470            t_last_slips = []
2471        # start plot
2472        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True, layout="constrained")
2473        for tslip in t_last_slips:
2474            ax[0].axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
2475            ax[1].axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
2476        for i, ix in enumerate(isort):
2477            if obs_noisy is not None:
2478                ax[0].plot(self.t_obs, obs_noisy[ix, :] + i*i_off,
2479                           ".", c="k", rasterized=True)
2480                ax[1].plot(self.t_obs, obs_noisy[ix + self.n_stations, :] + i*i_off,
2481                           ".", c="k", rasterized=True)
2482            ax[0].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix, :] + i*i_off, c=f"C{i}")
2483            ax[1].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix + self.n_stations, :] + i*i_off, c=f"C{i}")
2484        ax[1].set_xlabel("Time")
2485        ax[0].set_ylabel("Horizontal [m]")
2486        ax[1].set_ylabel("Vertical [m]")
2487        fig.suptitle("Surface Displacement")
2488        return fig, ax
2489
2490    def plot_fault_velocities(self, full_state):
2491        """
2492        Plot the velocities on all creeping fault patches.
2493
2494        Parameters
2495        ----------
2496        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2497            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2498
2499        Returns
2500        -------
2501        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2502        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2503        """
2504        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2505        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm
2506        from cmcrameri import cm
2507        # extract velocities
2508        vels = full_state[np.r_[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:self.fault.n_state_upper,
2509                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_creeping_lower:
2510                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_state_lower],
2511                          :] / self.v_plate
2512        # check whether the simulation spun up, and NaN data needs to be skipped
2513        vels, t_sub, n_cyc_completed = self._reduce_full_state(vels)
2514        # normalize time
2515        t_sub /= self.T_eff
2516        # prepare plot
2517        norm = SymLogNorm(linthresh=1, vmin=-1, vmax=100)
2518        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
2519            fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
2520            ax = [ax]
2521        else:
2522            fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True, figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
2523        # plot velocities
2524        c = ax[0].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2525                             self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked:] / 1e3,
2526                             vels[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :-1],
2527                             norm=norm, cmap=cm.vik, shading="flat")
2528        ax[0].set_yticks(self.fault.end_upper[0, [self.fault.n_locked, -1]] / 1e3)
2529        # add vertical lines for cycle breaks
2530        for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
2531            ax[0].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
2532        # make the y-axis increasing downwards to mimic depth even though we're plotting x1
2533        ax[0].invert_yaxis()
2534        # repeat for lower interface, if simulated
2535        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2536            c = ax[1].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2537                                 self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
2538                                 -vels[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, :-1],
2539                                 norm=norm, cmap=cm.vik, shading="flat")
2540            ax[1].set_yticks(self.fault.end_lower[0, [0, -1]] / 1e3)
2541            # add horizontal lines to show where the lower interface is below the locked zone
2542            ax[1].axhline(0, c="k", lw=1)
2543            ax[1].axhline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
2544            for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
2545                ax[1].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
2546            ax[1].invert_yaxis()
2547        # finish figure
2548        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
2549            ax[0].set_ylabel("Upper Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
2550            ax[0].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
2551        else:
2552            ax[0].set_ylabel("Upper Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
2553            ax[1].set_ylabel("Lower Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
2554            ax[1].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
2555        fig.colorbar(c, ax=ax, location="right", orientation="vertical", fraction=0.05,
2556                     label="$v/v_{plate}$")
2557        fig.suptitle("Normalized Fault Patch Velocities")
2558        return fig, ax
2559
2560    def plot_fault_slip(self, full_state, deficit=True, include_locked=True, include_deep=True):
2561        """
2562        Plot the cumulative slip (deficit) for the fault patches.
2563
2564        Parameters
2565        ----------
2566        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2567            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2568        deficit : bool, optional
2569            If ``True`` (default), remove the plate velocity to plot slip deficit,
2570            otherwise keep it included.
2571        include_locked : bool, optional
2572            If ``True`` (default), also plot the slip on the locked patches.
2573        include_deep : bool, optional
2574            If ``True`` (default), also plot the slip on the semi-infinite patches
2575            at the end of the interfaces.
2576
2577        Returns
2578        -------
2579        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2580        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2581        """
2582        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2583        from matplotlib.colors import Normalize, SymLogNorm
2584        from cmcrameri import cm
2585        # extract slip
2586        slip = full_state[np.r_[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
2587                                self.fault.n_state_upper:
2588                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_creeping_lower], :]
2589        # check whether the simulation spun up, and NaN data needs to be skipped
2590        slip, t_sub, n_cyc_completed = self._reduce_full_state(slip)
2591        # normalize to slip per full cycle
2592        cum_slip_per_cycle = self.v_plate_eff * self.T_eff * 86400 * 365.25
2593        slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
2594        # add optional slip histories, if desired
2595        if include_locked:
2596            eq_df_joint = pd.DataFrame(
2597                index=(self.eq_df.index.values.reshape(1, -1)
2598                       + self.T_eff * np.arange(n_cyc_completed).reshape(-1, 1)
2599                       ).ravel(),
2600                data=np.tile(self.eq_df.values, (n_cyc_completed, 1)))
2601            locked_slip = eq_df_joint.cumsum(axis=0) \
2602                .reindex(index=t_sub, method="ffill", fill_value=0).values.T
2603            locked_slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
2604        if include_deep:
2605            deep_creep_slip = (np.tile(t_sub.reshape(1, -1), (3, 1))
2606                               * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
2607                               * self.v_plate_eff * 86400 * 365.25)
2608            deep_creep_slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
2609        # remove plate velocity to get slip deficit, if desired
2610        if deficit:
2611            cmap = cm.vik
2612            norm = SymLogNorm(linthresh=1e-2, vmin=-1, vmax=1)
2613            slip[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper] -= t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
2614            slip[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:] += t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
2615            slip -= slip[:, -2].reshape(-1, 1)
2616            if include_locked:
2617                locked_slip -= t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
2618            if include_deep:
2619                deep_creep_slip -= (t_sub.reshape(1, -1)
2620                                    * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)) / self.T_eff
2621        else:
2622            norm = Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=n_cyc_completed)
2623            cmap = cm.batlow
2624        # normalize time
2625        t_sub /= self.T_eff
2626        # prepare figure
2627        nrows = (1 + int(self.fault.lower_rheo is not None)
2628                 + int(include_locked) + int(include_deep) * 3)
2629        hr_locked = ((self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked] - self.fault.end_upper[0, 0])
2630                     / (self.fault.end_lower[0, -1] - self.fault.end_lower[0, 0]))
2631        hr_lower = ((self.fault.end_lower[0, -1] - self.fault.end_lower[0, 0])
2632                    / (self.fault.end_upper[0, -1] - self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked]))
2633        hr = ([hr_locked] * int(include_locked) + [1]
2634              + [hr_locked, hr_locked] * int(include_deep)
2635              + [hr_lower] * int(self.fault.lower_rheo is not None)
2636              + [hr_locked] * int(include_deep))
2637        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=nrows, sharex=True, gridspec_kw={"height_ratios": hr},
2638                               figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
2639        iax = 0
2640        # plot locked
2641        if include_locked:
2642            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2643                                   self.fault.end_upper[0, :self.fault.n_locked + 1] / 1e3,
2644                                   locked_slip[:, :-1],
2645                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2646            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Locked\n$x_1$ [km]")
2647            temp_x1 = self.fault.end_upper[0, [0, self.fault.n_locked]] / 1e3
2648            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
2649            iax += 1
2650        # plot upper creeping
2651        c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2652                               self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked:] / 1e3,
2653                               slip[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :-1],
2654                               norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2655        ax[iax].set_ylabel("Creeping\n$x_1$ [km]")
2656        temp_x1 = self.fault.end_upper[0, [self.fault.n_locked, -1]] / 1e3
2657        ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
2658        iax += 1
2659        # plot end patch on upper interface
2660        if include_deep:
2661            temp_x1 = np.array([self.fault.end_upper[0, -1],
2662                                self.mid_deep_x1[0]]) / 1e3
2663            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2664                                   temp_x1,
2665                                   deep_creep_slip[0, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
2666                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2667            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
2668            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{temp_x1[0]:.0f}", "$-\\infty$"])
2669            iax += 1
2670        # plot left end patch on lower interface
2671        if include_deep:
2672            temp_x1 = np.array([self.mid_deep_x1[1],
2673                                self.fault.end_lower[0, 0]]) / 1e3
2674            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2675                                   temp_x1,
2676                                   -deep_creep_slip[1, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
2677                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2678            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
2679            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, ["$-\\infty$", f"{temp_x1[1]:.0f}"])
2680            iax += 1
2681        # plot lower creeping
2682        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2683            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2684                                   self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
2685                                   -slip[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, :-1],
2686                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2687            ax[iax].axhline(0, c="k", lw=1)
2688            ax[iax].axhline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
2689            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Creeping\n$x_1$ [km]")
2690            temp_x1 = self.fault.end_lower[0, [0, -1]] / 1e3
2691            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
2692            iax += 1
2693        # plot right end patch on lower interface
2694        if include_deep:
2695            temp_x1 = np.array([self.fault.end_lower[0, -1],
2696                                self.mid_deep_x1[2]]) / 1e3
2697            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2698                                   temp_x1,
2699                                   -deep_creep_slip[2, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
2700                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2701            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
2702            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{temp_x1[0]:.0f}", "$-\\infty$"])
2703            iax += 1
2704        # finish figure
2705        for iax in range(len(ax)):
2706            for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
2707                ax[iax].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
2708            ax[iax].invert_yaxis()
2709        ax[-1].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
2710        fig.colorbar(c, ax=ax, location="right", orientation="vertical", fraction=0.05,
2711                     label="$(s - t*v_{plate})/s_{full}$" if deficit else "$s/s_{full}$")
2712        suptitle = "Normalized Fault Patch Slip"
2713        if deficit:
2714            suptitle += " Deficit"
2715        fig.suptitle(suptitle)
2716        return fig, ax
2717
2718    def plot_eq_velocities(self, full_state):
2719        """
2720        Plot the before and after velocities on all creeping fault patches
2721        for each distinct earthquake.
2722
2723        Parameters
2724        ----------
2725        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2726            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2727
2728        Returns
2729        -------
2730        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2731        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2732        """
2733        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2734        # get indices of each last earthquake in last cycle
2735        temp = self.eq_df.astype(bool).drop_duplicates(keep="last")
2736        time_eq_last = temp.index.values + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
2737        tdiff = np.array([np.min(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last])
2738        if np.any(tdiff > 0):
2739            warn("Couldn't find exact indices, using time differences of "
2740                 f"{tdiff * 365.25 * 86400} seconds.")
2741        ix_eq_last = [np.argmin(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last]
2742        n_eq_found = len(ix_eq_last)
2743        assert n_eq_found == (self.Ds_0 > 0).sum(), \
2744            "Couldn't find indices of each last non-zero earthquake in the " \
2745            "last cycle, check for rounding errors."
2746        # calculate average slip for plotted earthquakes
2747        slip_last = self.eq_df.loc[temp.index, :]
2748        slip_avg = [slip_last.iloc[ieq, np.flatnonzero(temp.iloc[ieq, :])].mean()
2749                    for ieq in range(n_eq_found)]
2750        # extract velocities
2751        vels = full_state[np.r_[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:self.fault.n_state_upper,
2752                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_creeping_lower:
2753                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_state_lower],
2754                          :] / self.v_plate
2755        # prepare plot
2756        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=n_eq_found, ncols=1 if self.fault.lower_rheo is None else 2,
2757                               sharey=True, layout="constrained")
2758        ax = np.asarray(ax).reshape(n_eq_found, -1)
2759        # loop over earthquakes
2760        for irow, ieq in enumerate(ix_eq_last):
2761            # repeat plot for before and after
2762            for ioff, label in enumerate(["before", "after"]):
2763                ax[irow, 0].set_yscale("symlog", linthresh=1)
2764                ax[irow, 0].plot(self.fault.mid_x1_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
2765                                 vels[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, ieq - 1 + ioff],
2766                                 c=f"C{ioff}", label=label)
2767                if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2768                    ax[irow, 1].set_yscale("symlog", linthresh=1)
2769                    ax[irow, 1].plot(
2770                        self.fault.mid_x1_creeping[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:] / 1e3,
2771                        -vels[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, ieq - 1 + ioff],
2772                        c=f"C{ioff}", label=label)
2773        # finish plot
2774        for irow in range(n_eq_found):
2775            ax[irow, 0].set_title(f"Upper Interface: $s={slip_avg[irow]:.2g}$ m")
2776            ax[irow, 0].legend()
2777            ax[irow, 0].set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
2778            ax[irow, 0].set_ylabel("$v/v_{plate}$")
2779            if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2780                ax[irow, 1].set_title(f"Lower Interface: $s={slip_avg[irow]:.2g}$ m")
2781                ax[irow, 1].axvline(0, c="k", lw=1)
2782                ax[irow, 1].axvline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
2783                ax[irow, 1].tick_params(labelleft=True)
2784                ax[irow, 1].legend()
2785                ax[irow, 1].set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
2786                ax[irow, 1].set_ylabel("$v/v_{plate}$")
2787        fig.suptitle("Normalized Earthquake Velocity Changes")
2788        return fig, ax
2789
2790    def plot_fault(self):
2791        """
2792        Plot the fault.
2793
2794        Returns
2795        -------
2796        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2797        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2798        """
2799        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2800        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 3), layout="constrained")
2801        ax.plot(self.fault.end_upper[0, :self.fault.n_locked + 1]/1e3,
2802                self.fault.end_upper[1, :self.fault.n_locked + 1]/1e3,
2803                marker="|", markeredgecolor="k",
2804                label="Locked")
2805        ax.plot(self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked:]/1e3,
2806                self.fault.end_upper[1, self.fault.n_locked:]/1e3,
2807                marker="|", markeredgecolor="k",
2808                label="Upper Creeping")
2809        ax.plot(self.fault.end_lower[0, :]/1e3,
2810                self.fault.end_lower[1, :]/1e3,
2811                marker="|", markeredgecolor="k",
2812                label="Lower Creeping")
2813        ax.plot(self.pts_surf / 1e3, np.zeros_like(self.pts_surf),
2814                "^", markeredgecolor="none", markerfacecolor="k",
2815                label="Observers")
2816        ax.axhline(0, lw=1, c="0.5", zorder=-1)
2817        ax.legend()
2818        ax.set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
2819        ax.set_ylabel("$x_2$ [km]")
2820        ax.set_title("Fault Mesh and Observer Locations")
2821        ax.set_aspect("equal")
2822        return fig, ax
2823
2824    def plot_slip_phases(self, full_state, post_inter_transition=0.01, normalize=True):
2825        """
2826        Plot the cumulative slip on the fault for the three different
2827        phases (coseismic, early postseismic, and interseismic).
2828
2829        Only works if there is a single earthquake in the sequence.
2830
2831        Parameters
2832        ----------
2833        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2834            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2835        post_inter_transition : float, optional
2836            Fraction of the recurrence time that should be considered
2837            early postseismic and not interseismic.
2838
2839        Returns
2840        -------
2841        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2842        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2843        """
2844        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2845        from scipy.interpolate import interp1d
2846        # check that the sequence only has one earthquake
2847        if not self.n_eq == 1:
2848            raise NotImplementedError("Don't know how to plot slip phases if "
2849                                      "multiple earthquakes are present in the sequence.")
2850        # get coseismic slip
2851        co = np.concatenate([self.eq_df.values.ravel(),
2852                             self.slip_taper.ravel()])
2853        # get index of last earthquake in last cycle
2854        time_eq_last = self.eq_df.index[0] + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
2855        ix_eq_last = (np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, time_eq_last))[0]
2856                      - self.ix_break_joint[-2])
2857        # reorganize interseismic slip
2858        slip = full_state[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.ix_break_joint[-2]:]
2859        slip_pre = slip[:, :ix_eq_last]
2860        slip_post = slip[:, ix_eq_last:]
2861        slip_pre += (slip_post[:, -1] - slip_pre[:, 0]).reshape(-1, 1)
2862        slip_joint = np.hstack([slip_post, slip_pre])
2863        slip_joint -= slip_joint[:, 0].reshape(-1, 1)
2864        # same for time
2865        t_last = self.t_eval_joint[self.ix_break_joint[-2]:].copy()
2866        t_last_pre = t_last[:ix_eq_last]
2867        t_last_post = t_last[ix_eq_last:]
2868        t_last_pre += t_last_post[-1] - t_last_pre[0]
2869        t_last_joint = np.concatenate([t_last_post, t_last_pre])
2870        t_last_joint -= t_last_joint[0]
2871        # since slip_joint is now already cumulative slip since the earthquake,
2872        # with the tapered slip removed, we can just read out the early
2873        # postseismic and rest interseismic cumulative slip distributions
2874        post = interp1d(t_last_joint, slip_joint)(post_inter_transition * self.T_eff)
2875        inter = slip_joint[:, -1] - post
2876        post = np.concatenate([np.zeros(self.fault.n_locked), post])
2877        inter = np.concatenate([np.zeros(self.fault.n_locked), inter])
2878        # optionally, normalize by total expected cumulative slip over the entire cycle
2879        if normalize:
2880            total_slip = self.T_eff * self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25
2881            co /= total_slip
2882            post /= total_slip
2883            inter /= total_slip
2884        # make figure
2885        fig, ax = plt.subplots(layout="constrained")
2886        ax.plot(self.fault.mid_x1[:self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, co, label="Coseismic")
2887        ax.plot(self.fault.mid_x1[:self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, post, label="Postseismic")
2888        ax.plot(self.fault.mid_x1[:self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, inter, label="Interseismic")
2889        ax.legend()
2890        ax.set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
2891        ax.set_ylabel("Normalized cumulative slip [-]" if normalize
2892                      else "Cumulative Slip [m]")
2893        ax.set_title("Slip Phases (Post-/Interseismic cutoff at "
2894                     f"{post_inter_transition:.1%} " "$T_{rec}$)")
2895        return fig, ax
2896
2897    def plot_viscosity(self, full_state, return_viscosities=False):
2898        """
2899        Plot the viscosity structure with depth for the steady state, as well as
2900        for the immediate pre- and coseismic velocities.
2901
2902        For multiple earthquakes, it will use the minimum preseismic and maximum
2903        postseismic velocities.
2904
2905        Parameters
2906        ----------
2907        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2908            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2909        return_viscosities : bool, optional
2910            Also return the preseismic, steady-state, and postseismic viscosities.
2911
2912        Returns
2913        -------
2914        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2915        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2916        """
2917        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2918        # get indices of each last earthquake in last cycle
2919        temp = self.eq_df.astype(bool).drop_duplicates(keep="last")
2920        time_eq_last = temp.index.values + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
2921        tdiff = np.array([np.min(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last])
2922        if np.any(tdiff > 0):
2923            warn("Couldn't find exact indices, using time differences of "
2924                 f"{tdiff * 365.25 * 86400} seconds.")
2925        ix_eq_last = [np.argmin(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last]
2926        n_eq_found = len(ix_eq_last)
2927        assert n_eq_found == (self.Ds_0 > 0).sum(), \
2928            "Couldn't find indices of each last non-zero earthquake in the " \
2929            "last cycle, check for rounding errors."
2930        # calculate average slip for plotted earthquakes
2931        slip_last = self.eq_df.loc[temp.index, :]
2932        slip_avg = [slip_last.iloc[ieq, np.flatnonzero(temp.iloc[ieq, :])].mean()
2933                    for ieq in range(n_eq_found)]
2934        # extract preseismic velocities
2935        vels_pre = np.array([full_state[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:self.fault.n_state_upper,
2936                                        ix - 1] for ix in ix_eq_last]).T
2937        vels_post = np.array([full_state[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:self.fault.n_state_upper,
2938                                         ix] for ix in ix_eq_last]).T
2939        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2940            # calculate viscosity profiles
2941            vis_pre = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
2942                                                         self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
2943                                                         vels_pre)
2944            vis_ss = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(self.alpha_n_vec,
2945                                                        self.n_vec,
2946                                                        self.v_plate_eff)
2947            vis_post = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
2948                                                          self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
2949                                                          vels_post)
2950        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2951            vis_pre = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
2952                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_pre)
2953            vis_ss = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
2954                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1),  self.v_plate_eff)
2955            vis_post = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
2956                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1),  vels_post)
2957        else:
2958            raise NotImplementedError()
2959        vis_mins = 10**np.floor(np.log10(np.ma.masked_invalid(vis_post*0.999).min(axis=0)))
2960        vis_maxs = 10**np.ceil(np.log10(np.ma.masked_invalid(vis_pre*1.001).max(axis=0)))
2961        # make plot
2962        fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=n_eq_found, sharey=True, layout="constrained")
2963        ax = np.atleast_1d(ax)
2964        ax[0].set_ylabel("$x_2$ [km]")
2965        for i in range(n_eq_found):
2966            ax[i].fill_betweenx([0, self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[1] / 1e3],
2967                                vis_mins[i], vis_maxs[i], facecolor="0.8", label="Locked")
2968            ax[i].fill_betweenx(self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
2969                                vis_pre[:, i], vis_post[:, i], alpha=0.5, label="Simulated")
2970            ax[i].plot(vis_ss,
2971                       self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
2972                       label="Plate Rate")
2973            ax[i].set_xscale("log")
2974            ax[i].legend(loc="lower left")
2975            ax[i].set_ylim(self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[self.fault.n_creeping_upper - 1] / 1e3,
2976                           0)
2977            ax[i].set_xlim(vis_mins[i], vis_maxs[i])
2978            ax[i].set_title(f"$s={slip_avg[i]:.2g}$ m")
2979            ax[i].set_xlabel(r"$\alpha_{eff}$ [Pa * s/m]")
2980        # finish
2981        if return_viscosities:
2982            return fig, ax, vis_pre, vis_ss, vis_post
2983        else:
2984            return fig, ax
2985
2986    def plot_viscosity_timeseries(self, full_state, return_viscosities=False):
2987        """
2988        Plot the viscosity timeseries with depth for the entire last cycle.
2989
2990        Parameters
2991        ----------
2992        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2993            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2994        return_viscosities : bool, optional
2995            Also return the viscosity timeseries.
2996
2997        Returns
2998        -------
2999        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3000        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3001        """
3002        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3003        from matplotlib.colors import LogNorm
3004        from cmcrameri import cm
3005        # check that the sequence only has one earthquake
3006        if not self.n_eq == 1:
3007            raise NotImplementedError("Don't know how to plot viscosity timeseries if "
3008                                      "multiple earthquakes are present in the sequence.")
3009        # get index of last earthquake in last cycle
3010        time_eq_last = self.eq_df.index[0] + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3011        ix_eq_last = (np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, time_eq_last))[0]
3012                      - self.ix_break_joint[-2])
3013        # reorganize interseismic velocities
3014        vels = full_state[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:2*self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3015                          self.ix_break_joint[-2]:]
3016        vels_pre = vels[:, :ix_eq_last]
3017        vels_post = vels[:, ix_eq_last:]
3018        vels = np.hstack([vels_post, vels_pre])
3019        # same for time
3020        t_last = self.t_eval_joint[self.ix_break_joint[-2]:].copy()
3021        t_last_pre = t_last[:ix_eq_last]
3022        t_last_post = t_last[ix_eq_last:]
3023        t_last_pre += t_last_post[-1] - t_last_pre[0]
3024        t_last_joint = np.concatenate([t_last_post, t_last_pre])
3025        t_last_joint -= t_last_joint[0]
3026        # convert velocities to effective viscosity
3027        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3028            vis_ts = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
3029                                                        self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
3030                                                        vels)
3031        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
3032            vis_ts = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3033                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels)
3034        else:
3035            raise NotImplementedError()
3036        # get index of deep transition
3037        patch_depths = -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
3038        ix_deep = np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition))
3039        # subset vels to skip zero-velocity uppermost patch
3040        vis_ts = vis_ts[1:, :]
3041        # get percentage of final viscosity
3042        rel_vis = vis_ts / vis_ts[:, -1][:, None]
3043        rel_vis_masked = np.ma.MaskedArray(rel_vis, np.diff(rel_vis, axis=1,
3044                                           prepend=rel_vis[:, 0][:, None]
3045                                           ) <= 0).filled(np.NaN)
3046        levels = [0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8]
3047        rel_vis_iquant = np.concatenate([np.nanargmax(rel_vis_masked > lvl, axis=1, keepdims=True)
3048                                        for lvl in levels], axis=1)
3049        # normalize time
3050        t_sub = t_last_joint / self.T_eff
3051        # prepare plot
3052        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
3053        # plot velocities
3054        c = ax.pcolormesh(
3055            t_sub,
3056            np.abs(self.fault.end_upper[1, self.fault.n_locked+1:self.fault.n_locked+ix_deep+1]
3057                   / 1e3),
3058            vis_ts[:ix_deep-1, :-1],
3059            norm=LogNorm(vmin=10**np.floor(np.log10(np.median(vis_ts[:ix_deep-1, 0]))),
3060                         vmax=10**np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(vis_ts[:ix_deep-1, -1])))),
3061            cmap=cm.batlow, shading="flat")
3062        for i in range(len(levels)):
3063            ax.plot(t_sub[rel_vis_iquant[:ix_deep-1, i]],
3064                    patch_depths[1:ix_deep] / 1e3,
3065                    color="w")
3066        ax.set_xscale("symlog", linthresh=1e-3)
3067        ax.set_xlim([0, 1])
3068        # make the y-axis increasing downwards to mimic depth even though we're plotting x1
3069        ax.invert_yaxis()
3070        # finish figure
3071        ax.set_ylabel("Depth $x_2$ [km]")
3072        ax.set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3073        fig.colorbar(c, ax=ax, location="right", orientation="vertical", fraction=0.05,
3074                     label=r"$\alpha_{eff}$")
3075        fig.suptitle("Effective Viscosity Timeseries")
3076        # finish
3077        if return_viscosities:
3078            return fig, ax, t_sub, vis_ts
3079        else:
3080            return fig, ax
class Rheology(abc.ABC): 
22class Rheology(ABC):
23    """
24    Abstract base class for rheologies.
25    """

Abstract base class for rheologies.

class NonlinearViscous(Rheology): 
 28class NonlinearViscous(Rheology):
 29    r"""
 30    Implement a nonlinear viscous fault rheology, where the velocity :math:`v` is
 31    :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n` given the shear stress :math:`\tau`, a strength
 32    constant :math:`\alpha_n`, and a constant exponent :math:`n`.
 33    """
 34
 35    def __init__(self, n, alpha_n, n_mid=None, alpha_n_mid=None, mid_transition=None,
 36                 n_deep=None, alpha_n_deep=None, deep_transition=None,
 37                 deep_transition_width=None, n_boundary=None, alpha_n_boundary=None):
 38        r"""
 39        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
 40
 41        Parameters
 42        ----------
 43        alpha_n : float
 44            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
 45        n : float
 46            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
 47        """
 48        # input check
 49        assert not np.logical_xor(deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None)
 50        # set number of variables
 51        self.n_vars = 2
 52        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
 53        # initialization
 54        self._n = float(n)
 55        self._n_mid = float(n_mid) if n_mid is not None else self.n
 56        self._n_deep = float(n_deep) if n_deep is not None else self.n_mid
 57        self.n_boundary = float(n_boundary) if n_boundary is not None else self.n_deep
 58        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
 59        self.alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
 60        self.alpha_n_mid = (float(alpha_n_mid) if alpha_n_mid is not None
 61                            else self.alpha_n)
