 62        self.alpha_n_deep = (float(alpha_n_deep) if alpha_n_deep is not None
 63                             else self.alpha_n_mid)
 64        self.alpha_n_boundary = (float(alpha_n_boundary) if alpha_n_boundary is not None
 65                                 else self.alpha_n_deep)
 66        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
 67        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
 68        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
 69        self.deep_transition = None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
 70        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
 71        self.deep_transition_width = (None if deep_transition_width is None
 72                                      else float(deep_transition_width))
 73        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
 74
 75    @property
 76    def alpha_n(self):
 77        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
 78        return self._alpha_n
 79
 80    @alpha_n.setter
 81    def alpha_n(self, alpha_n):
 82        self._alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
 83        self._A = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n, self._n)
 84
 85    @property
 86    def alpha_n_mid(self):
 87        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
 88        return self._alpha_n_mid
 89
 90    @alpha_n_mid.setter
 91    def alpha_n_mid(self, alpha_n_mid):
 92        self._alpha_n_mid = float(alpha_n_mid)
 93        self._A_mid = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_mid, self._n_mid)
 94
 95    @property
 96    def alpha_n_deep(self):
 97        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
 98        return self._alpha_n_deep
 99
100    @alpha_n_deep.setter
101    def alpha_n_deep(self, alpha_n_deep):
102        self._alpha_n_deep = float(alpha_n_deep)
103        self._A_deep = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_deep, self._n_deep)
104
105    @property
106    def n(self):
107        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
108        return self._n
109
110    @n.setter
111    def n(self, n):
112        self._n = float(n)
113        self._A = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n, self._n)
114
115    @property
116    def n_mid(self):
117        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
118        return self._n_mid
119
120    @n_mid.setter
121    def n_mid(self, n_mid):
122        self._n_mid = float(n_mid)
123        self._A_mid = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_mid, self._n_mid)
124
125    @property
126    def n_deep(self):
127        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
128        return self._n_deep
129
130    @n_deep.setter
131    def n_deep(self, n_deep):
132        self._n_deep = float(n_deep)
133        self._A_deep = self.calc_A(self._alpha_n_deep, self._n_deep)
134
135    @property
136    def A(self):
137        r""" Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] """
138        return self._A
139
140    @property
141    def A_mid(self):
142        r""" Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] """
143        return self._A_mid
144
145    @property
146    def A_deep(self):
147        r""" Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] """
148        return self._A_deep
149
150    @staticmethod
151    def calc_A(alpha_n, n):
152        """ Calculate A from alpha_n and n """
153        return alpha_n ** (1 / n)
154
155    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, v_eff):
156        r"""
157        Calculate the depth-dependent arrays of :math:`\alpha_n`, :math:`n`, and :math:`A`,
158        assuming :math:`\alpha_n` and :math:`\alpha_{n,eff}` vary log-linearly with depth,
159        and :math:`n` adapts between the transition points.
160        """
161        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
162        # start knots list
163        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
164        vals_alpha_n = [self.alpha_n]
165        vals_n = [self.n]
166        # add optional mid transition
167        if self.mid_transition is not None:
168            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))])
169            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_mid)
170            vals_n.append(self.n_mid)
171        # add optional deep transition
172        if self.deep_transition is not None:
173            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))])
174            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_deep)
175            vals_n.append(self.n_deep)
176            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths
177                                                       - self.deep_transition
178                                                       - self.deep_transition_width))])
179            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
180            vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
181        # add final value
182        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
183        vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
184        vals_alpha_n = np.array(vals_alpha_n)
185        vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
186        vals_n = np.array(vals_n)
187        vals_alpha_eff = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(vals_alpha_n, vals_n, v_eff)
188        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
189        alpha_n_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_n))(patch_depths)
190        alpha_eff_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_eff))(patch_depths)
191        # get n and A
192        n_vec = SubductionSimulation.get_n(alpha_n_vec, alpha_eff_vec, v_eff)
193        A_vec = alpha_n_vec ** (1 / n_vec)
194        return alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec

Implement a nonlinear viscous fault rheology, where the velocity \( v \) is \( v = \tau^n / \alpha_n \) given the shear stress \( \tau \), a strength constant \( \alpha_n \), and a constant exponent \( n \).

NonlinearViscous( n, alpha_n, n_mid=None, alpha_n_mid=None, mid_transition=None, n_deep=None, alpha_n_deep=None, deep_transition=None, deep_transition_width=None, n_boundary=None, alpha_n_boundary=None) 
35    def __init__(self, n, alpha_n, n_mid=None, alpha_n_mid=None, mid_transition=None,
36                 n_deep=None, alpha_n_deep=None, deep_transition=None,
37                 deep_transition_width=None, n_boundary=None, alpha_n_boundary=None):
38        r"""
39        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
40
41        Parameters
42        ----------
43        alpha_n : float
44            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
45        n : float
46            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
47        """
48        # input check
49        assert not np.logical_xor(deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None)
50        # set number of variables
51        self.n_vars = 2
52        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
53        # initialization
54        self._n = float(n)
55        self._n_mid = float(n_mid) if n_mid is not None else self.n
56        self._n_deep = float(n_deep) if n_deep is not None else self.n_mid
57        self.n_boundary = float(n_boundary) if n_boundary is not None else self.n_deep
58        """ Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-] """
59        self.alpha_n = float(alpha_n)
60        self.alpha_n_mid = (float(alpha_n_mid) if alpha_n_mid is not None
61                            else self.alpha_n)
62        self.alpha_n_deep = (float(alpha_n_deep) if alpha_n_deep is not None
63                             else self.alpha_n_mid)
64        self.alpha_n_boundary = (float(alpha_n_boundary) if alpha_n_boundary is not None
65                                 else self.alpha_n_deep)
66        r""" Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] """
67        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
68        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
69        self.deep_transition = None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
70        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
71        self.deep_transition_width = (None if deep_transition_width is None
72                                      else float(deep_transition_width))
73        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """

Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.

Parameters
  • alpha_n (float): Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n (float): Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]
n_vars

Number of variables to track by rheology [-]

n_boundary

Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]

alpha_n

Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]

alpha_n_mid

Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]

alpha_n_deep

Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]

alpha_n_boundary

Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]

mid_transition

Depth [m] for the middle transition point

deep_transition

(Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point

deep_transition_width

(Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point

n

Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]

n_mid

Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]

n_deep

Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]

A

Rescaled strength term \( A = \alpha_n^{1/n} \) [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]

A_mid

Rescaled strength term \( A = \alpha_n^{1/n} \) [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]

A_deep

Rescaled strength term \( A = \alpha_n^{1/n} \) [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]

@staticmethod
def calc_A(alpha_n, n): 
150    @staticmethod
151    def calc_A(alpha_n, n):
152        """ Calculate A from alpha_n and n """
153        return alpha_n ** (1 / n)

Calculate A from alpha_n and n

def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, v_eff): 
155    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, v_eff):
156        r"""
157        Calculate the depth-dependent arrays of :math:`\alpha_n`, :math:`n`, and :math:`A`,
158        assuming :math:`\alpha_n` and :math:`\alpha_{n,eff}` vary log-linearly with depth,
159        and :math:`n` adapts between the transition points.
160        """
161        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
162        # start knots list
163        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
164        vals_alpha_n = [self.alpha_n]
165        vals_n = [self.n]
166        # add optional mid transition
167        if self.mid_transition is not None:
168            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))])
169            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_mid)
170            vals_n.append(self.n_mid)
171        # add optional deep transition
172        if self.deep_transition is not None:
173            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))])
174            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_deep)
175            vals_n.append(self.n_deep)
176            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths
177                                                       - self.deep_transition
178                                                       - self.deep_transition_width))])
179            vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
180            vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
181        # add final value
182        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
183        vals_alpha_n.append(self.alpha_n_boundary)
184        vals_alpha_n = np.array(vals_alpha_n)
185        vals_n.append(self.n_boundary)
186        vals_n = np.array(vals_n)
187        vals_alpha_eff = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(vals_alpha_n, vals_n, v_eff)
188        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
189        alpha_n_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_n))(patch_depths)
190        alpha_eff_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_eff))(patch_depths)
191        # get n and A
192        n_vec = SubductionSimulation.get_n(alpha_n_vec, alpha_eff_vec, v_eff)
193        A_vec = alpha_n_vec ** (1 / n_vec)
194        return alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec

Calculate the depth-dependent arrays of \( \alpha_n \), \( n \), and \( A \), assuming \( \alpha_n \) and \( \alpha_{n,eff} \) vary log-linearly with depth, and \( n \) adapts between the transition points.

class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic(Rheology): 
197class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic(Rheology):
198    r"""
199    Implement a steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the ageing law (effectively
200    becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by
201
202    :math:`f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E`
203
204    where :math:`f_{ss}` is the steady-state friction, :math:`f_0` is a reference
205    friction, :math:`a` and :math:`b` are the rate-and-state frictional parameters,
206    :math:`\zeta = \log (v / v_0)` is the logarithmic velocity, :math:`\tau` is the shear
207    stress, and :math:`\sigma_E` is the effective fault normal stress.
208    """
209
210    def __init__(self, v_0, alpha_h, alpha_h_mid=None, mid_transition=None,
211                 alpha_h_deep=None, deep_transition=None, deep_transition_width=None,
212                 alpha_h_boundary=None):
213        r"""
214        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
215
216        Parameters
217        ----------
218        v_0 : float
219            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
220        alpha_h : float
221            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
222            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
223            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
224        """
225        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
226        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
227        # input check
228        assert not np.logical_xor(deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None)
229        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
230        # set number of variables
231        self.n_vars = 2
232        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
233        # initialization
234        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
235        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
236        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
237        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
238        self.alpha_h_mid = (float(alpha_h_mid) if alpha_h_mid is not None
239                            else self.alpha_h)
240        r""" Middle rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
241        self.alpha_h_deep = (float(alpha_h_deep) if alpha_h_deep is not None
242                             else self.alpha_h_mid)
243        r""" Deep rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
244        self.alpha_h_boundary = (float(alpha_h_boundary) if alpha_h_boundary is not None
245                                 else self.alpha_h_deep)
246        r""" Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
247        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
248        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
249        self.deep_transition = None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
250        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
251        self.deep_transition_width = (None if deep_transition_width is None
252                                      else float(deep_transition_width))
253        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
254
255    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths):
256        r"""
257        Calculate the depth-dependent array of :math:`\alpha_h`, assuming it
258        varies log-linearly with depth.
259        """
260        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
261        # start knots list
262        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
263        vals_alpha_h = [self.alpha_h]
264        # add optional mid transition
265        if self.mid_transition is not None:
266            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))])
267            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_mid)
268        # add optional deep transition
269        if self.deep_transition is not None:
270            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))])
271            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
272            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths
273                                                       - self.deep_transition
274                                                       - self.deep_transition_width))])
275            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
276        # add final value
277        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
278        vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
279        vals_alpha_h = np.array(vals_alpha_h)
280        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
281        alpha_h_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_h))(patch_depths)
282        return alpha_h_vec

Implement a steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the ageing law (effectively becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by

\( f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E \)

where \( f_{ss} \) is the steady-state friction, \( f_0 \) is a reference friction, \( a \) and \( b \) are the rate-and-state frictional parameters, \( \zeta = \log (v / v_0) \) is the logarithmic velocity, \( \tau \) is the shear stress, and \( \sigma_E \) is the effective fault normal stress.

RateStateSteadyLogarithmic( v_0, alpha_h, alpha_h_mid=None, mid_transition=None, alpha_h_deep=None, deep_transition=None, deep_transition_width=None, alpha_h_boundary=None) 
210    def __init__(self, v_0, alpha_h, alpha_h_mid=None, mid_transition=None,
211                 alpha_h_deep=None, deep_transition=None, deep_transition_width=None,
212                 alpha_h_boundary=None):
213        r"""
214        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
215
216        Parameters
217        ----------
218        v_0 : float
219            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
220        alpha_h : float
221            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
222            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
223            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
224        """
225        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
226        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
227        # input check
228        assert not np.logical_xor(deep_transition is None, deep_transition_width is None)
229        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
230        # set number of variables
231        self.n_vars = 2
232        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
233        # initialization
234        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
235        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
236        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
237        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
238        self.alpha_h_mid = (float(alpha_h_mid) if alpha_h_mid is not None
239                            else self.alpha_h)
240        r""" Middle rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
241        self.alpha_h_deep = (float(alpha_h_deep) if alpha_h_deep is not None
242                             else self.alpha_h_mid)
243        r""" Deep rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
244        self.alpha_h_boundary = (float(alpha_h_boundary) if alpha_h_boundary is not None
245                                 else self.alpha_h_deep)
246        r""" Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
247        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
248        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
249        self.deep_transition = None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
250        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
251        self.deep_transition_width = (None if deep_transition_width is None
252                                      else float(deep_transition_width))
253        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """

Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.

Parameters
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
  • alpha_h (float): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \), where \( a \) and \( b \) [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties, and \( \sigma_E \) [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
alpha_h

Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

n_vars

Number of variables to track by rheology [-]

v_0

Reference velocity \( v_0 \) [m/s]

alpha_h_mid

Middle rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

alpha_h_deep

Deep rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

alpha_h_boundary

Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

mid_transition

Depth [m] for the middle transition point

deep_transition

(Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point

deep_transition_width

(Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point

def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths): 
255    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths):
256        r"""
257        Calculate the depth-dependent array of :math:`\alpha_h`, assuming it
258        varies log-linearly with depth.
259        """
260        assert np.all(np.diff(patch_depths) >= 0)
261        # start knots list
262        knots = [patch_depths[0]]
263        vals_alpha_h = [self.alpha_h]
264        # add optional mid transition
265        if self.mid_transition is not None:
266            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.mid_transition))])
267            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_mid)
268        # add optional deep transition
269        if self.deep_transition is not None:
270            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.deep_transition))])
271            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
272            knots.append(patch_depths[np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths
273                                                       - self.deep_transition
274                                                       - self.deep_transition_width))])
275            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
276        # add final value
277        knots.append(patch_depths[-1])
278        vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_boundary)
279        vals_alpha_h = np.array(vals_alpha_h)
280        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
281        alpha_h_vec = 10**interp1d(knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_h))(patch_depths)
282        return alpha_h_vec

Calculate the depth-dependent array of \( \alpha_h \), assuming it varies log-linearly with depth.

@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
def dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A, n): 
285@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
286def dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A, n):
287    r"""
288    Calculate the velocity derivative for a power-law viscous rheology.
289
290    From :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n` we get:
291
292    :math:`\frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{\alpha_n} \tau^{n-1} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
293
294    where
295
296    :math:`\tau^{n-1} = \left( \alpha_n v \right)^{\frac{n-1}{n}}`
297
298    simplifying to
299
300    :math:`\frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{A} v^{1-\frac{1}{n}} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
301
302    Parameters
303    ----------
304    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
305        1D array of the shear stress derivative
306    v : numpy.ndarray
307        1D array of the current velocity
308    A : numpy.ndarray
309        Rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
310    n : numpy.ndarray
311        Power-law exponent
312
313    Returns
314    -------
315    dvdt : numpy.ndarray
316        1D array of the velocity derivative.
317    """
318    signs = np.sign(v)
319    return (n / A) * (signs * v)**(1 - 1 / n) * dtaudt

Calculate the velocity derivative for a power-law viscous rheology.

From \( v = \tau^n / \alpha_n \) we get:

\( \frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{\alpha_n} \tau^{n-1} \frac{d \tau}{dt} \)

where

\( \tau^{n-1} = \left( \alpha_n v \right)^{\frac{n-1}{n}} \)

simplifying to

\( \frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{n}{A} v^{1-\frac{1}{n}} \frac{d \tau}{dt} \)

Parameters
  • dtaudt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array of the shear stress derivative
  • v (numpy.ndarray): 1D array of the current velocity
  • A (numpy.ndarray): Rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n (numpy.ndarray): Power-law exponent
Returns
  • dvdt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array of the velocity derivative.
@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
def dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec): 
322@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
323def dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec):
324    r"""
325    Return the velocity derivative in logarithmic space given the current traction
326    rate in linear space.
327
328    Taking the derivative of the steady-state friction gives an explicit
329    formulation for the slip acceleration :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}`:
330
331    :math:`\frac{df_{ss}}{dt} = (a-b) \frac{d \zeta}{dt}`
332
333    Recognizing that :math:`\tau = f_{ss} \sigma_E` and assuming
334    constant effective normal stress leads to
335    :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt} = \sigma_E \frac{df_{ss}}{dt}`, which
336    can be rearranged to give the final expression
337
338    :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt} = \frac{1}{(a-b) \sigma_E} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
339
340    Parameters
341    ----------
342    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
343        Traction derivative :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt}` [Pa/s] in linear space
344    alpha_h_vec : float
345        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
346
347    Returns
348    -------
349    dzetadt : numpy.ndarray
350        Velocity derivative :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}` [1/s] in logarithmic space.
351    """
352    return dtaudt / alpha_h_vec

Return the velocity derivative in logarithmic space given the current traction rate in linear space.

Taking the derivative of the steady-state friction gives an explicit formulation for the slip acceleration \( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \):

\( \frac{df_{ss}}{dt} = (a-b) \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \)

Recognizing that \( \tau = f_{ss} \sigma_E \) and assuming constant effective normal stress leads to \( \frac{d \tau}{dt} = \sigma_E \frac{df_{ss}}{dt} \), which can be rearranged to give the final expression

\( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} = \frac{1}{(a-b) \sigma_E} \frac{d \tau}{dt} \)

Parameters
  • dtaudt (numpy.ndarray): Traction derivative \( \frac{d \tau}{dt} \) [Pa/s] in linear space
  • alpha_h_vec (float): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
Returns
  • dzetadt (numpy.ndarray): Velocity derivative \( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \) [1/s] in logarithmic space.
@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
def get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus, delta_tau, alpha_n, n, A): 
355@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
356def get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus, delta_tau, alpha_n, n, A):
357    r"""
358    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change due to an instantaneous stress change
359    to the fault patches. It is derived from:
360
361    :math:`\tau_{+} = \tau_{-} + \Delta \tau`
362
363    and plugging in the relationship :math:`v = \tau^n / \alpha_n`, we get
364
365    :math:`\sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{+}} = \sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{-}} + \Delta \tau`
366
367    and finally
368
369    :math:`v_{+} = \frac{\left( A \sqrt[n]{v_{-}} + \Delta \tau \right)^n}{\alpha_n}`
370
371    Parameters
372    ----------
373    v_minus : numpy.ndarray
374        Initial velocity :math:`v_{-}` [m/s]
375    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray
376        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
377    alpha_n : numpy.ndarray
378        Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
379    n : numpy.ndarray
380        Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
381    A : numpy.ndarray
382        Rescaled strength term :math:`A = \alpha_n^{1/n}` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]
383
384    Returns
385    -------
386    v_plus : numpy.ndarray
387        Velocity :math:`v_{+}` [m/s] after stress change
388    """
389    signs = np.sign(v_minus)
390    temp = A * (signs * v_minus)**(1 / n) + (signs * delta_tau)
391    return np.abs(temp) ** (n - 1) * temp / alpha_n * signs

Calculate the instantaneous velocity change due to an instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. It is derived from:

\( \tau_{+} = \tau_{-} + \Delta \tau \)

and plugging in the relationship \( v = \tau^n / \alpha_n \), we get

\( \sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{+}} = \sqrt[n]{\alpha_n v_{-}} + \Delta \tau \)

and finally

\( v_{+} = \frac{\left( A \sqrt[n]{v_{-}} + \Delta \tau \right)^n}{\alpha_n} \)

Parameters
  • v_minus (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity \( v_{-} \) [m/s]
  • delta_tau (numpy.ndarray): Traction stress change \( \Delta \tau \) [Pa]
  • alpha_n (numpy.ndarray): Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant \( \alpha_n \) [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n (numpy.ndarray): Power-law exponent \( n \) [-]
  • A (numpy.ndarray): Rescaled strength term \( A = \alpha_n^{1/n} \) [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)]
Returns
  • v_plus (numpy.ndarray): Velocity \( v_{+} \) [m/s] after stress change
@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
def get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus, delta_tau, alpha_h_vec): 
394@njit(float64[:](float64[:], float64[:], float64[:]), cache=True)
395def get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus, delta_tau, alpha_h_vec):
396    r"""
397    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change (in logarithmic space) due to an
398    instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. We can kickstart the
399    derivatuion from the expression in ``RateStateSteadyLinear.get_new_vel``:
400
401    :math:`\log (v_{+}/v_0) = \log (v_{-}/v_0) + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
402
403    and realize that we only have to plug in our definition for :math:`\zeta`
404    to give us the final result
405
406    :math:`\zeta_{+} = \zeta_{-} + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
407
408    Parameters
409    ----------
410    zeta_minus : numpy.ndarray
411        Initial velocity :math:`\zeta_{-}` [-] in logarithmic space
412    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray, optional
413        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
414    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
415        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
416
417    Returns
418    -------
419    zeta_plus : numpy.ndarray
420        Velocity :math:`\zeta_{+}` [-] in logarithmic space after stress change
421
422    See Also
423    --------
424    alpha_h
425    """
426    return zeta_minus + delta_tau / alpha_h_vec

Calculate the instantaneous velocity change (in logarithmic space) due to an instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. We can kickstart the derivatuion from the expression in RateStateSteadyLinear.get_new_vel:

\( \log (v_{+}/v_0) = \log (v_{-}/v_0) + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h \)

and realize that we only have to plug in our definition for \( \zeta \) to give us the final result

\( \zeta_{+} = \zeta_{-} + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h \)

Parameters
  • zeta_minus (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity \( \zeta_{-} \) [-] in logarithmic space
  • delta_tau (numpy.ndarray, optional): Traction stress change \( \Delta \tau \) [Pa]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
Returns
  • zeta_plus (numpy.ndarray): Velocity \( \zeta_{+} \) [-] in logarithmic space after stress change
See Also

alpha_h

@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], float64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64), cache=True)
def flat_ode_plvis(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, mu_over_2vs): 
429@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], float64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
430                 float64[:], float64[:], float64), cache=True)
431def flat_ode_plvis(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, mu_over_2vs):
432    r"""
433    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
434    powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
435    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
436
437    Parameters
438    ----------
439    t : float
440        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
441    state : numpy.ndarray
442        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
443        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
444    v_plate : float
445        Plate velocity.
446    K_int : numpy.ndarray
447        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
448    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
449        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
450        patches onto the creeping patches.
451    A_upper : numpy.ndarray
452        Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
453    n_upper : numpy.ndarray
454        Upper plate interface power-law exponent
455    mu_over_2vs : float
456        Radiation damping factor
457
458    Returns
459    -------
460    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
461        1D array with the state derivative.
462    """
463    # get number of variables within state
464    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
465    n_vars_upper = 2
466    n_creeping_upper = state.size // n_vars_upper
467    assert K_int.shape == (n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_upper)
468    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping_upper
469    # extract total velocities
470    v = state[n_creeping_upper:]
471    # get shear strain rate
472    signs = np.sign(v)
473    temp = mu_over_2vs * (n_upper / A_upper) * (signs * v)**(1 - 1 / n_upper)
474    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate, axis=1)
475              ) / (1 + temp)
476    # get ODE
477    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt, v, A_upper, n_upper)))
478    # return
479    return dstatedt

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
  • v_plate (float): Plate velocity.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked patches onto the creeping patches.
  • A_upper (numpy.ndarray): Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n_upper (numpy.ndarray): Upper plate interface power-law exponent
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], float64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64[:], float64), cache=True)
def flat_ode_rdlog(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs): 
482@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], float64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
483                 float64, float64[:], float64), cache=True)
484def flat_ode_rdlog(t, state, v_plate, K_int, K_ext, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs):
485    r"""
486    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
487    powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
488    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
489
490    Parameters
491    ----------
492    t : float
493        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
494    state : numpy.ndarray
495        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
496        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
497    v_plate : float
498        Plate velocity.
499    K_int : numpy.ndarray
500        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
501    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
502        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
503        patches onto the creeping patches.
504    v_0 : float
505        Reference velocity [m/s]
506    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
507        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
508    mu_over_2vs : float
509        Radiation damping factor
510
511    Returns
512    -------
513    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
514        1D array with the state derivative.
515    """
516    # get number of variables within state
517    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
518    n_vars_upper = 2
519    n_creeping_upper = state.size // n_vars_upper
520    assert K_int.shape == (n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_upper)
521    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping_upper
522    # extract total velocities
523    zeta = state[n_creeping_upper:]
524    v = v_0 * np.exp(zeta)
525    # get shear strain rate
526    temp = mu_over_2vs * v / alpha_h_vec
527    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate, axis=1)
528              ) / (1 + temp)
529    # get ODE
530    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec)))
531    # return
532    return dstatedt

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with powerlaw-viscous rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip and upper velocity.
  • v_plate (float): Plate velocity.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked patches onto the creeping patches.
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
def flat_ode_plvis_plvis( t, state, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower): 
535@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
536                 float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
537def flat_ode_plvis_plvis(t, state, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
538                         A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower):
539    """
540    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
541    powerlaw-viscous rheology in both the upper and lower plate interface.
542
543    Parameters
544    ----------
545    t : float
546        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
547    state : numpy.ndarray
548        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
549        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity,
550        lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
551    n_creeping_upper : int
552        Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface.
553        The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then
554        be derived from the size of ``state``.
555    v_plate_vec : float
556        Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
557    K_int : numpy.ndarray
558        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
559    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
560        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
561        patches onto the creeping patches.
562    A_upper : float
563        Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
564    n_upper : float
565        Upper plate interface power-law exponent
566    A_lower : float
567        Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
568    n_lower : float
569        Lower plate interface power-law exponent
570
571    Returns
572    -------
573    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
574        1D array with the state derivative.
575    """
576    # get number of variables within state
577    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
578    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
579    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
580    n_state_lower = state.size - n_state_upper
581    n_creeping_lower = n_state_lower // n_vars_lower
582    n_creeping = n_creeping_lower + n_creeping_upper
583    assert K_int.shape[0] == K_int.shape[1] == n_creeping
584    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping
585    # split up state
586    state_upper = state[:n_state_upper]
587    state_lower = state[n_state_upper:]
588    # extract total velocities
589    v_upper = state_upper[n_creeping_upper:]
590    v_lower = state_lower[n_creeping_lower:]
591    # get shear strain rate
592    v = np.concatenate((v_upper, v_lower))
593    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate_vec) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate_vec[0], axis=1))
594    dtaudt_upper = dtaudt[:n_creeping_upper]
595    dtaudt_lower = dtaudt[n_creeping_upper:]
596    # get individual rheologies' ODE
597    dstatedt_upper = \
598        np.concatenate((v_upper, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt_upper, v_upper,
599                                            np.ones_like(v_upper) * A_upper,
600                                            np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_upper)))
601    dstatedt_lower = \
602        np.concatenate((v_lower, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt_lower, v_lower,
603                                            np.ones_like(v_lower) * A_lower,
604                                            np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_lower)))
605    # concatenate and return
606    return np.concatenate((dstatedt_upper, dstatedt_lower))

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with powerlaw-viscous rheology in both the upper and lower plate interface.

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity, lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface. The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then be derived from the size of state.
  • v_plate_vec (float): Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked patches onto the creeping patches.
  • A_upper (float): Upper plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n_upper (float): Upper plate interface power-law exponent
  • A_lower (float): Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n_lower (float): Lower plate interface power-law exponent
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
def flat_ode_rdlog_plvis( t, state, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext, v_0, alpha_h_upper, A_lower, n_lower): 
609@njit(float64[:](float64, float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
610                 float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
611def flat_ode_rdlog_plvis(t, state, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
612                         v_0, alpha_h_upper, A_lower, n_lower):
613    r"""
614    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
615    rate-dependent (log-space) rheology in the upper and nonlinear viscous
616    rheology in the lower plate interface.
617
618    Parameters
619    ----------
620    t : float
621        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
622    state : numpy.ndarray
623        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
624        containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity,
625        lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
626    n_creeping_upper : int
627        Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface.
628        The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then
629        be derived from the size of ``state``.
630    v_plate_vec : float
631        Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
632    K_int : numpy.ndarray
633        2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
634    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
635        2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked
636        patches onto the creeping patches.
637    v_0 : float
638        Reference velocity [m/s]
639    alpha_h_upper : float
640        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
641    A_lower : float
642        Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
643    n_lower : float
644        Lower plate interface power-law exponent
645
646    Returns
647    -------
648    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
649        1D array with the state derivative.
650    """
651    # get number of variables within state
652    # (depends on rheology, so is hardcoded here)
653    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
654    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
655    n_state_lower = state.size - n_state_upper
656    n_creeping_lower = n_state_lower // n_vars_lower
657    n_creeping = n_creeping_lower + n_creeping_upper
658    assert K_int.shape[0] == K_int.shape[1] == n_creeping
659    assert K_ext.shape[0] == n_creeping
660    # split up state
661    state_upper = state[:n_state_upper]
662    state_lower = state[n_state_upper:]
663    # extract total velocities
664    v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(state_upper[n_creeping_upper:])
665    v_lower = state_lower[n_creeping_lower:]
666    # get shear strain rate
667    v = np.concatenate((v_upper, v_lower))
668    dtaudt = (K_int @ (v - v_plate_vec) - np.sum(K_ext * v_plate_vec[0], axis=1))
669    dtaudt_upper = dtaudt[:n_creeping_upper]
670    dtaudt_lower = dtaudt[n_creeping_upper:]
671    # get individual rheologies' ODE
672    dstatedt_upper = \
673        np.concatenate((v_upper, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt_upper,
674                                               np.ones_like(v_lower) * alpha_h_upper)))
675    dstatedt_lower = \
676        np.concatenate((v_lower, dvdt_plvis(dtaudt_lower, v_lower,
677                                            np.ones_like(v_lower) * A_lower,
678                                            np.ones_like(v_upper) * n_lower)))
679    # concatenate and return
680    return np.concatenate((dstatedt_upper, dstatedt_lower))

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with rate-dependent (log-space) rheology in the upper and nonlinear viscous rheology in the lower plate interface.

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the upper cumulative slip, upper velocity, lower cumulative slip, lower velocity.
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number of creeping patches in the upper plate interface. The number of creeping patches in the lower plate interface can then be derived from the size of state.
  • v_plate_vec (float): Initial velocity in all creeping patches.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): 2D array with the stress kernel mapping the effect of the locked patches onto the creeping patches.
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_upper (float): Upper interface rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]
  • A_lower (float): Lower plate interface rescaled nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
  • n_lower (float): Lower plate interface power-law exponent
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64, float64, float64[:], float64[:], int64, float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64), cache=True)
def myrk4( ti, tf, state0, t_eval, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower): 
684@njit(float64[:, :](float64, float64, float64[:], float64[:], int64, float64[:],
685                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64),
686      cache=True)
687def myrk4(ti, tf, state0, t_eval, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec,
688          K_int, K_ext, A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower):
689    h = t_eval[1] - t_eval[0]
690    num_state = state0.size
691    num_eval = t_eval.size
692    sol = np.zeros((num_eval, num_state))
693    sol[0, :] = state0
694    for i in range(1, num_eval):
695        cur = sol[i-1, :]
696        k1 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(ti, cur, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
697                                  A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
698        cur = sol[i-1, :] + (h / 2) * k1
699        k2 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(ti, cur, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
700                                  A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
701        cur = sol[i-1, :] + (h / 2) * k2
702        k3 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(ti, cur, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
703                                  A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
704        cur = sol[i-1, :] + h * k3
705        k4 = flat_ode_plvis_plvis(ti, cur, n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
706                                  A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
707        sol[i, :] = sol[i-1, :] + (h / 6) * (k1 + 2 * k2 + 2 * k3 + k4)
708    return sol
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64), cache=True)
def flat_run_plvis( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext, v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded, alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec, mu_over_2vs): 
711@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1],
712                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
713                    float64[:], float64[:], float64[:], float64), cache=True)
714def flat_run_plvis(t_eval, i_break, i_eq,
715                   n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext,
716                   v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded,
717                   alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec, mu_over_2vs):
718    r"""
719    Run the simulation.
720
721    Parameters
722    ----------
723    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
724        Evaluation times [s]
725    i_break : numpy.ndarray
726        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
727    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
728        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
729    n_creeping_upper : int
730        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
731    n_creeping_lower : int
732        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
733    K_int : numpy.ndarray
734        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
735    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
736        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
737    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
738        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
739    v_init : numpy.ndarray
740        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
741    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
742        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
743    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
744        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
745    alpha_n_vec : numpy.ndarray
746        Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
747        at each patch
748    n_vec : float
749        Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-] at each patch
750    A_vec : float
751        Rescaled upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant
752        [Pa^n * s/m] at each patch
753    mu_over_2vs : float
754        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
755        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
756
757    Returns
758    -------
759    full_state : numpy.ndarray
760        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
761    """
762    # initialize parameters
763    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
764    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
765    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
766    n_eval = t_eval.size
767    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
768
769    # initialize arrays
770    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
771    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
772    v_minus_upper = v_init[:n_creeping_upper]
773    v_minus_lower = v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]
774    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
775    full_state[:] = np.NaN
776    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower))
777
778    # make flat ODE function arguments
779    args = (v_plate_vec[0], K_int[:n_creeping_upper, :n_creeping_upper].copy(),
780            K_ext[:n_creeping_upper, :], A_vec, n_vec, mu_over_2vs)
781
782    # integrate
783    spun_up = 0
784    i_slip = 0
785    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
786    i = 0
787    atol = np.ones(n_state_upper) * 1e-6
788    atol[n_creeping_upper:] = 1e-15
789    while i < steps.size - 1:
790        # print(f"{i+1}/{steps.size - 1}")
791        # get indices
792        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i+1]
793        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
794        # call integrator
795        with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
796            sol = solve_ivp(flat_ode_plvis,
797                            t_span=[ti, tf],
798                            y0=state_plus[:n_state_upper],
799                            t_eval=t_eval[ji:jf + 1],
800                            method="LSODA", rtol=1e-6, atol=atol, args=args)
801            success = sol.success
802            if success:
803                sol = sol.y
804            else:
805                sol = np.empty((1, 1))
806        if not success:
807            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
808        # save state to output array
809        full_state[:n_state_upper, ji:jf + 1] = sol
810        # fill in the imposed lower state
811        full_state[n_state_upper:n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower, ji:jf + 1] = \
812            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1)) \
813            * np.ascontiguousarray(t_eval[ji:jf + 1]).reshape((1, -1))
814        full_state[n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower:, ji:jf + 1] = \
815            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
816        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
817        if i == steps.size - 2:
818            break
819        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
820        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
821            old_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-2*n_slips-1]:steps[i-n_slips]]
822            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-n_slips]:steps[i+1]]
823            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
824            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
825            old_v_upper = old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
826            new_v_upper = new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
827            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
828            rhs_upper = (1e-3) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-3) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
829            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
830            if stop_now:
831                spun_up = jf
832                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
833                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
834        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
835            break
836        # apply step change only if there is one
837        if (jf in i_eq):
838            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
839            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
840            v_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
841            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
842            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
843            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
844            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
845            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
846            v_plus_upper = get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus_upper,
847                                             delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
848                                             alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec)
849            v_plus_lower = v_minus_lower.ravel()
850            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, v_plus_upper,
851                                         s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower))
852            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
853        else:
854            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
855        # advance
856        i += 1
857
858    # warn if we never spun up
859    if not spun_up:
860        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
861
862    # done
863    return full_state

Run the simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): External stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • slip_taper (numpy.ndarray): Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • alpha_n_vec (numpy.ndarray): Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m] at each patch
  • n_vec (float): Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-] at each patch
  • A_vec (float): Rescaled upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m] at each patch
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor \( \mu / 2 v_s \), where \( \mu \) is the shear modulus [Pa] and \( v_s \) is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
Returns
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64[:], float64), cache=True)
def flat_run_rdlog( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext, v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs): 
 866@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1],
 867                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
 868                    float64, float64[:], float64), cache=True)
 869def flat_run_rdlog(t_eval, i_break, i_eq,
 870                   n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext,
 871                   v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded,
 872                   v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs):
 873    r"""
 874    Run the simulation.
 875
 876    Parameters
 877    ----------
 878    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
 879        Evaluation times [s]
 880    i_break : numpy.ndarray
 881        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
 882    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
 883        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
 884    n_creeping_upper : int
 885        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
 886    n_creeping_lower : int
 887        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
 888    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 889        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
 890    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
 891        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
 892    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
 893        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
 894    v_init : numpy.ndarray
 895        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
 896    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
 897        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
 898    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
 899        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
 900    v_0 : float
 901        Reference velocity [m/s]
 902    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
 903        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
 904    mu_over_2vs : float
 905        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
 906        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
 907
 908    Returns
 909    -------
 910    full_state : numpy.ndarray
 911        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
 912    """
 913    # initialize parameters
 914    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
 915    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
 916    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
 917    n_eval = t_eval.size
 918    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
 919
 920    # initialize arrays
 921    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
 922    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
 923    assert np.all(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] > 0)
 924    zeta_minus_upper = np.log(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] / v_0)
 925    v_minus_lower = v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]
 926    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
 927    full_state[:] = np.NaN
 928    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, zeta_minus_upper,
 929                                 s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower))
 930
 931    # make flat ODE function arguments
 932    args = (v_plate_vec[0], K_int[:n_creeping_upper, :n_creeping_upper].copy(),
 933            K_ext[:n_creeping_upper, :], v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs)
 934
 935    # integrate
 936    spun_up = 0
 937    i_slip = 0
 938    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
 939    i = 0
 940    while i < steps.size - 1:
 941        # print(f"{i+1}/{steps.size - 1}")
 942        # get indices
 943        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i+1]
 944        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
 945        # call integrator
 946        with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
 947            sol = solve_ivp(flat_ode_rdlog,
 948                            t_span=[ti, tf],
 949                            y0=state_plus[:n_state_upper],
 950                            t_eval=t_eval[ji:jf + 1],
 951                            method="LSODA", args=args)
 952            success = sol.success
 953            if success:
 954                sol = sol.y
 955            else:
 956                sol = np.empty((1, 1))
 957        if not success:
 958            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
 959        # save state to output array
 960        full_state[:n_state_upper, ji:jf + 1] = sol
 961        # fill in the imposed lower state
 962        full_state[n_state_upper:n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower, ji:jf + 1] = \
 963            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1)) \
 964            * np.ascontiguousarray(t_eval[ji:jf + 1]).reshape((1, -1))
 965        full_state[n_state_upper + n_creeping_lower:, ji:jf + 1] = \
 966            np.ascontiguousarray(v_plate_vec[n_creeping_upper:]).reshape((-1, 1))
 967        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
 968        if i == steps.size - 2:
 969            break
 970        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
 971        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
 972            old_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-2*n_slips-1]:steps[i-n_slips]]
 973            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-n_slips]:steps[i+1]]
 974            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
 975            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
 976            old_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
 977            new_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
 978            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
 979            rhs_upper = (1e-3) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-3) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
 980            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
 981            if stop_now:
 982                spun_up = jf
 983                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
 984                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
 985        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
 986            break
 987        # apply step change only if there is one
 988        if (jf in i_eq):
 989            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
 990            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
 991            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
 992            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
 993            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
 994            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
 995            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
 996            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
 997            zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus_upper,
 998                                                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
 999                                                alpha_h_vec)
1000            v_plus_lower = v_minus_lower.ravel()
1001            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper,
1002                                         s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower))
1003            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1004        else:
1005            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1006        # advance
1007        i += 1
1008
1009    # warn if we never spun up
1010    if not spun_up:
1011        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1012
1013    full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :] = \
1014        v_0 * np.exp(full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :])
1015
1016    # done
1017    return full_state

Run the simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): External stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • slip_taper (numpy.ndarray): Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Upper interface rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor \( \mu / 2 v_s \), where \( \mu \) is the shear modulus [Pa] and \( v_s \) is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
Returns
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64, boolean), cache=True)
def flat_run_plvis_plvis( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext, v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded, alpha_n_upper, n_upper, alpha_n_lower, n_lower, simple_rk4): 
1020@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1],
1021                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
1022                    float64, float64, float64, float64, boolean), cache=True)
1023def flat_run_plvis_plvis(t_eval, i_break, i_eq,
1024                         n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext,
1025                         v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded,
1026                         alpha_n_upper, n_upper, alpha_n_lower, n_lower,
1027                         simple_rk4):
1028    """
1029    Run the simulation.
1030
1031    Parameters
1032    ----------
1033    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1034        Evaluation times [s]
1035    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1036        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1037    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1038        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1039    n_creeping_upper : int
1040        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1041    n_creeping_lower : int
1042        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1043    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1044        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1045    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1046        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1047    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1048        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1049    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1050        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1051    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1052        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1053    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1054        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1055    alpha_n_upper : float
1056        Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1057    n_upper : float
1058        Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1059    alpha_n_lower : float
1060        Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1061    n_lower : float
1062        Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1063    simple_rk4 : bool
1064        Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
1065
1066    Returns
1067    -------
1068    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1069        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1070    """
1071    # initialize parameters
1072    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1073    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1074    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1075    A_upper = alpha_n_upper ** (1 / n_upper)
1076    A_lower = alpha_n_lower ** (1 / n_lower)
1077    n_eval = t_eval.size
1078    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1079
1080    # initialize arrays
1081    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1082    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1083    v_minus_upper = v_init[:n_creeping_upper]
1084    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1085    #     v_minus_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.v2zeta(v_minus_upper)
1086    v_minus_lower = v_init[n_creeping_upper:]
1087    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1088    full_state[:] = np.NaN
1089    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower))
1090
1091    # make flat ODE function arguments
1092    args = (n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
1093            A_upper, n_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
1094
1095    # integrate
1096    spun_up = 0
1097    i_slip = 0
1098    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1099    i = 0
1100    while i < steps.size - 1:
1101        # get indices
1102        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i+1]
1103        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1104        # call integrator
1105        if simple_rk4:
1106            sol = myrk4(ti, tf, state_plus, t_eval[ji:jf + 1], *args).T
1107        else:
1108            with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1109                sol = solve_ivp(flat_ode_plvis_plvis,
1110                                t_span=[ti, tf],
1111                                y0=state_plus,
1112                                t_eval=t_eval[ji:jf + 1],
1113                                method="RK45", rtol=1e-9, atol=1e-12, args=args)
1114                success = sol.success
1115                sol = sol.y
1116            if not success:
1117                raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1118        # save state to output array
1119        full_state[:, ji:jf + 1] = sol
1120        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1121        if i == steps.size - 2:
1122            break
1123        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1124        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1125            old_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-2*n_slips-1]:steps[i-n_slips]]
1126            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-n_slips]:steps[i+1]]
1127            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1128            old_state_lower = old_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1129            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1130            new_state_lower = new_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1131            old_v_upper = old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1132            old_v_lower = old_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1133            new_v_upper = new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1]
1134            new_v_lower = new_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1135            # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1136            #     old_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(old_v_upper)
1137            #     new_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(new_v_upper)
1138            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1139            lhs_lower = np.abs(old_v_lower - new_v_lower)
1140            rhs_upper = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1141            rhs_lower = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[-1]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_lower)
1142            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper) & np.all(lhs_lower <= rhs_lower)
1143            if stop_now:
1144                spun_up = jf
1145                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1146                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1147        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1148            break
1149        # apply step change only if there is one
1150        if (jf in i_eq):
1151            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1152            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1153            v_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1154            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1155            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1156            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1157            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1158            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1159            v_plus_upper = get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus_upper,
1160                                             delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1161                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_upper,
1162                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_upper,
1163                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_upper)
1164            v_plus_lower = get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus_lower,
1165                                             delta_tau_bounded[n_creeping_upper:, i_slip],
1166                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_lower,
1167                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_lower,
1168                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_lower)
1169            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, v_plus_upper,
1170                                         s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower))
1171            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1172        else:
1173            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1174        # advance
1175        i += 1
1176
1177    # warn if we never spun up
1178    if not spun_up:
1179        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1180
1181    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1182    #     vel_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(vel_upper)
1183
1184    # done
1185    return full_state

Run the simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): External stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • slip_taper (numpy.ndarray): Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • alpha_n_upper (float): Upper plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n_upper (float): Upper plate interface power-law exponent [-]
  • alpha_n_lower (float): Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n_lower (float): Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
  • simple_rk4 (bool): Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
Returns
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1], float64, float64, float64, float64, boolean), cache=True)
def flat_run_rdlog_plvis( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext, v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded, v_0, alpha_h_upper, alpha_n_lower, n_lower, simple_rk4): 
1188@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:], int64[:], int64[:], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1],
1189                    float64[:, ::1], float64[:], float64[:], float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1],
1190                    float64, float64, float64, float64, boolean), cache=True)
1191def flat_run_rdlog_plvis(t_eval, i_break, i_eq,
1192                         n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, K_int, K_ext,
1193                         v_plate_vec, v_init, slip_taper, delta_tau_bounded,
1194                         v_0, alpha_h_upper, alpha_n_lower, n_lower,
1195                         simple_rk4):
1196    r"""
1197    Run the simulation.
1198
1199    Parameters
1200    ----------
1201    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1202        Evaluation times [s]
1203    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1204        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1205    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1206        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
