1207    n_creeping_upper : int
1208        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1209    n_creeping_lower : int
1210        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1211    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1212        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1213    K_ext : numpy.ndarray
1214        External stress kernel [Pa/m]
1215    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1216        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1217    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1218        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1219    slip_taper : numpy.ndarray
1220        Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
1221    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1222        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1223    v_0 : float
1224        Reference velocity [m/s]
1225    alpha_h_upper : float
1226        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
1227    alpha_n_lower : float
1228        Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant  [Pa^n * s/m]
1229    n_lower : float
1230        Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
1231    simple_rk4 : bool
1232        Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
1233
1234    Returns
1235    -------
1236    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1237        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1238    """
1239    # initialize parameters
1240    n_vars_upper, n_vars_lower = 2, 2
1241    n_state_upper = n_vars_upper * n_creeping_upper
1242    n_state_lower = n_vars_lower * n_creeping_lower
1243    A_lower = alpha_n_lower ** (1 / n_lower)
1244    n_eval = t_eval.size
1245    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[1]
1246
1247    # initialize arrays
1248    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_vars_upper - 1) * n_creeping_upper)
1249    s_minus_lower = np.zeros(n_creeping_lower)
1250    assert np.all(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] > 0)
1251    v_minus_upper = np.log(v_init[:n_creeping_upper] / v_0)
1252    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1253    #     v_minus_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.v2zeta(v_minus_upper)
1254    v_minus_lower = v_init[n_creeping_upper:]
1255    full_state = np.empty((n_state_upper + n_state_lower, n_eval))
1256    full_state[:] = np.NaN
1257    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, v_minus_upper, s_minus_lower, v_minus_lower))
1258
1259    # make flat ODE function arguments
1260    args = (n_creeping_upper, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext,
1261            v_0, alpha_h_upper, A_lower, n_lower)
1262
1263    # integrate
1264    spun_up = 0
1265    i_slip = 0
1266    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1267    i = 0
1268    while i < steps.size - 1:
1269        # get indices
1270        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i+1]
1271        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1272        # call integrator
1273        if simple_rk4:
1274            sol = myrk4(ti, tf, state_plus, t_eval[ji:jf + 1], *args).T
1275        else:
1276            with objmode(sol="float64[:, :]", success="boolean"):
1277                sol = solve_ivp(flat_ode_rdlog_plvis,
1278                                t_span=[ti, tf],
1279                                y0=state_plus,
1280                                t_eval=t_eval[ji:jf + 1],
1281                                method="RK45", rtol=1e-9, atol=1e-12, args=args)
1282                success = sol.success
1283                sol = sol.y
1284            if not success:
1285                raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1286        # save state to output array
1287        full_state[:, ji:jf + 1] = sol
1288        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1289        if i == steps.size - 2:
1290            break
1291        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1292        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1293            old_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-2*n_slips-1]:steps[i-n_slips]]
1294            new_full_state = full_state[:, steps[i-n_slips]:steps[i+1]]
1295            old_state_upper = old_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1296            old_state_lower = old_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1297            new_state_upper = new_full_state[:n_state_upper, :]
1298            new_state_lower = new_full_state[n_state_upper:, :]
1299            old_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(old_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1300            old_v_lower = old_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1301            new_v_upper = v_0 * np.exp(new_state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:, -1])
1302            new_v_lower = new_state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:, -1]
1303            # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1304            #     old_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(old_v_upper)
1305            #     new_v_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(new_v_upper)
1306            lhs_upper = np.abs(old_v_upper - new_v_upper)
1307            lhs_lower = np.abs(old_v_lower - new_v_lower)
1308            rhs_upper = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[0]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_upper)
1309            rhs_lower = (1e-4) * np.abs(v_plate_vec[-1]) + (1e-4) * np.abs(new_v_lower)
1310            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper) & np.all(lhs_lower <= rhs_lower)
1311            if stop_now:
1312                spun_up = jf
1313                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1314                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1315        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1316            break
1317        # apply step change only if there is one
1318        if (jf in i_eq):
1319            state_upper, state_lower = sol[:n_state_upper, -1], sol[n_state_upper:, -1]
1320            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:-n_creeping_upper]
1321            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[-n_creeping_upper:]
1322            s_minus_lower = state_lower[:-n_creeping_lower]
1323            v_minus_lower = state_lower[-n_creeping_lower:]
1324            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.ravel().copy()
1325            s_plus_upper[:n_creeping_upper] += slip_taper[:, i_slip]
1326            s_plus_lower = s_minus_lower.ravel()
1327            zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus_upper,
1328                                                delta_tau_bounded[:n_creeping_upper, i_slip],
1329                                                np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_h_upper)
1330            v_plus_lower = get_new_vel_plvis(v_minus_lower,
1331                                             delta_tau_bounded[n_creeping_upper:, i_slip],
1332                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * alpha_n_lower,
1333                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * n_lower,
1334                                             np.ones(n_creeping_upper) * A_lower)
1335            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper,
1336                                         s_plus_lower, v_plus_lower))
1337            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1338        else:
1339            state_plus = sol[:, -1]
1340        # advance
1341        i += 1
1342
1343    # warn if we never spun up
1344    if not spun_up:
1345        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1346
1347    full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :] = \
1348        v_0 * np.exp(full_state[n_creeping_upper:n_state_upper, :])
1349    # if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, rheologies.RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1350    #     vel_upper = self.fault.upper_rheo.zeta2v(vel_upper)
1351
1352    # done
1353    return full_state

Run the simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext (numpy.ndarray): External stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • slip_taper (numpy.ndarray): Compensating coseismic tapered slip on creeping patches [m]
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_upper (float): Upper interface rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]
  • alpha_n_lower (float): Lower plate interface nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant [Pa^n * s/m]
  • n_lower (float): Lower plate interface power-law exponent [-]
  • simple_rk4 (bool): Decide whether to use the simple RK4 integrator or not
Returns
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:, ::1], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1]), cache=True)
def get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis( full_state, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower, G_surf, deep_creep_slip): 
1356@njit(float64[:, :](float64[:, ::1], int64, int64, float64[:, ::1], float64[:, ::1]),
1357      cache=True)
1358# optional(float64[:, ::1]), optional(float64[:, ::1])))
1359def get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis(full_state, n_creeping_upper, n_creeping_lower,
1360                                          G_surf, deep_creep_slip):  # , locked_slip):
1361    """
1362    Calculate the surface displacements given the output of ``run``.
1363
1364    Parameters
1365    ----------
1366    full_state : numpy.ndarray
1367        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1368    n_creeping_upper : int
1369        Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
1370    n_creeping_lower : int
1371        Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
1372    G_surf : numpy.ndarray
1373        Surface displacements Green's matrix [-] (dimensions must whether `locked_slip`
1374        and/or `deep_creep_slip` are passed to function)
1375    deep_creep_slip : numpy.ndarray
1376        Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches
1377    locked_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
1378        Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches
1379
1380    Returns
1381    -------
1382    surf_disp : numpy.ndarray
1383        Surface displacement timeseries.
1384    """
1385    # extract timeseries from solution
1386    slip_upper = full_state[:n_creeping_upper, :]
1387    slip_lower = full_state[2 * n_creeping_upper:2 * n_creeping_upper + n_creeping_lower, :]
1388    # add the locked and deep patches to the combined upper & lower slip history matrix
1389    slips_all = np.concatenate((slip_upper, slip_lower), axis=0)
1390    # if locked_slip is not None:s
1391    #     slips_all = np.concatenate((locked_slip[:, :slip_upper.shape[1]], slips_all),
1392    #                                axis=0)
1393    # if deep_creep_slip is not None:
1394    slips_all = np.concatenate((slips_all, deep_creep_slip), axis=0)
1395    # calculate all surface displacements for last full cycle
1396    surf_disps = G_surf @ slips_all
1397    return surf_disps

Calculate the surface displacements given the output of run.

Parameters
  • full_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
  • n_creeping_upper (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface
  • n_creeping_lower (int): Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface
  • G_surf (numpy.ndarray): Surface displacements Green's matrix [-] (dimensions must whether locked_slip and/or deep_creep_slip are passed to function)
  • deep_creep_slip (numpy.ndarray): Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches
  • locked_slip (numpy.ndarray, optional): Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches
Returns
  • surf_disp (numpy.ndarray): Surface displacement timeseries.
class Fault2D: 
1400class Fault2D():
1401    """
1402    Base class for the subduction fault mesh.
1403    """
1404
1405    def __init__(self, theta, D_lock, H, nu, E, v_s, halflen,
1406                 upper_rheo, n_upper, lower_rheo, n_lower_left,
1407                 n_lower_right, halflen_factor_lower,
1408                 D_max=None, x1_pretrench=None):
1409        """
1410        Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the
1411        Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.
1412
1413        Parameters
1414        ----------
1415        theta : float
1416            Dip angle [rad] of the plate interface (positive).
1417        D_lock : float
1418            Locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1419        H : float
1420            Subducting plate thickness [m].
1421        nu : float
1422            Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone.
1423        E : float
1424            Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone.
1425        v_s : float
1426            Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
1427        halflen : float
1428            Fault patch half-length [m], used for all locked patches.
1429            If ``D_max`` and ``x1_pretrench`` are not set, this length is also used for all
1430            creeping patches, otherwise, this is their minimum half-length.
1431        upper_rheo : Rheology
1432            Upper plate interface's rheology.
1433        n_upper : int
1434            Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface.
1435        lower_rheo : Rheology
1436            Lower plate interface's rheology. Pass ``None`` if it should not be simulated,
1437            but enforced to have the plate velocity.
1438        n_lower_left : int
1439            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of the bend).
1440        n_lower_right : int
1441            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of the bend).
1442        halflen_factor_lower : float
1443            Factor used to get a different minimum half-length of the patches on the lower
1444            plate interface.
1445        D_max : float, optional
1446            Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1447            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1448            locked zone. (``x1_pretrench`` must be set as well.)
1449        x1_pretrench : float, optional
1450            Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (positive).
1451            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1452            locked zone. (``D_max`` must be set as well.)
1453
1454        References
1455        ----------
1456
1457        .. [kanda2010] Kanda, R. V. S., & Simons, M. (2010).
1458           *An elastic plate model for interseismic deformation in subduction zones.*
1459           Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 115(B3).
1460           doi:`10.1029/2009JB006611 <https://doi.org/10.1029/2009JB006611>`_.
1461        """
1462        # initialize
1463        self.theta = float(theta)
1464        """ Subducting plate dip angle [rad] """
1465        assert 0 < self.theta < np.pi / 2
1466        self.D_lock = float(D_lock)
1467        """ Theoretical locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1468        assert self.D_lock > 0
1469        self.H = float(H)
1470        """ Subducting plate thickness [m] """
1471        assert self.H >= 0
1472        self.nu = float(nu)
1473        """ Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone """
1474        self.E = float(E)
1475        """ Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone """
1476        self.halflen = float(halflen)
1477        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on upper interface """
1478        assert self.halflen > 0
1479        self.upper_rheo = upper_rheo
1480        """ Upper plate interface's rheology """
1481        assert isinstance(self.upper_rheo, Rheology)
1482        self.n_upper = int(n_upper)
1483        """ Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface """
1484        assert self.n_upper >= 1
1485        self.lower_rheo = lower_rheo
1486        """ Lower plate interface's rheology """
1487        assert isinstance(self.lower_rheo, Rheology) or \
1488            (self.lower_rheo is None)
1489        self.n_lower_left = int(n_lower_left)
1490        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of bend) """
1491        assert self.n_lower_left >= 1
1492        self.n_lower_right = int(n_lower_right)
1493        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of bend) """
1494        assert self.n_lower_right >= 1
1495        self.halflen_factor_lower = float(halflen_factor_lower)
1496        """ Prefactor [-] to change the lower interface half-length """
1497        assert self.halflen_factor_lower >= 1
1498        self.lower_halflen = self.halflen * self.halflen_factor_lower
1499        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on lower interface """
1500        if self.lower_rheo is not None:
1501            assert self.H >= 2 * self.lower_halflen, "Plate too thin for given patch sizes."
1502        self.v_s = float(v_s)
1503        """ Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone """
1504        self.mu_over_2vs = self.E / (2 * (1 + self.nu) * 2 * self.v_s)
1505        """ Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m] """
1506
1507        # switch between constant or linearly-varying patch sizes
1508        if (D_max is not None) and (x1_pretrench is not None):
1509            D_max = float(D_max)
1510            x1_pretrench = float(x1_pretrench)
1511            assert D_max > 0
1512            assert x1_pretrench > 0
1513            variable_mesh = True
1514        else:
1515            D_max = None
1516            x1_pretrench = None
1517            variable_mesh = False
1518        self.D_max = D_max
1519        """ Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (optional) """
1520        self.x1_pretrench = x1_pretrench
1521        """ Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (optional) """
1522        self.variable_mesh = variable_mesh
1523        """ Flag whether the creeping patches are linearly-varying in size, or not """
1524
1525        # create mesh, centered about the x2 axis
1526        if self.variable_mesh:
1527            # project the locking depth onto dip angle
1528            L_lock = self.D_lock / np.sin(self.theta)
1529            # get number of locked and creeping patches on upper interface
1530            n_lock = int(L_lock // (2 * self.halflen))
1531            n_creep_up = self.n_upper - n_lock
1532            assert n_creep_up > 0, "Current geometry yields no upper creeping patches."
1533            # project maximum interface depth onto dip angle
1534            L_max = self.D_max / np.sin(self.theta)
1535            # get length of creeping segment that needs to be linearly varying
1536            delta_L = L_max - n_lock * 2 * self.halflen
1537            # get linear half-length increase necessary given the number of patches
1538            # and length of creeping segment, on all three interface regions
1539            delta_h_upper = ((delta_L - 2 * self.halflen * n_creep_up) /
1540                             (n_creep_up**2 - n_creep_up))
1541            delta_h_lower_right = \
1542                ((L_max - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_right) /
1543                 (self.n_lower_right**2 - self.n_lower_right))
1544            delta_h_lower_left = \
1545                ((self.x1_pretrench - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_left) /
1546                 (self.n_lower_left**2 - self.n_lower_left))
1547            # check that we're not running into numerical problems from starkly
1548            # increasing patch sizes
1549            if any([d > 0.2 for d in [delta_h_upper / self.halflen,
1550                                      delta_h_lower_right / self.lower_halflen,
1551                                      delta_h_lower_left / self.lower_halflen]]):
1552                raise ValueError("Half-length increase greater than 20%.")
1553            # build vector of half-lengths
1554            halflen_vec = np.concatenate([
1555                np.ones(n_lock) * self.halflen,
1556                self.halflen + np.arange(n_creep_up) * delta_h_upper,
1557                (self.lower_halflen + np.arange(self.n_lower_left) * delta_h_lower_left)[::-1],
1558                self.lower_halflen + np.arange(self.n_lower_right) * delta_h_lower_right])
1559        else:
1560            # build half-length vector from constant size
1561            halflen_vec = np.ones(self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left + self.n_lower_right
1562                                  ) * self.halflen
1563            halflen_vec[self.n_upper:] *= self.halflen_factor_lower
1564        self.halflen_vec = halflen_vec
1565        """ Half-lengths [m] for each patch in the fault """
1566        s = self.H * np.tan(self.theta / 2)
1567        R = np.array([[np.cos(-self.theta), -np.sin(-self.theta)],
1568                      [np.sin(-self.theta), np.cos(-self.theta)]])
1569        # upper plate interface
1570        upper_right_x1 = np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2*self.halflen_vec[:self.n_upper])])
1571        upper_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(upper_right_x1)
1572        upper_right = R @ np.stack([upper_right_x1, upper_right_x2], axis=0)
1573        # lower left plate interface
1574        temp = self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left - 1:self.n_upper - 1:-1]
1575        lower_left_x1 = -s - np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2*temp)])[::-1]
1576        lower_left_x2 = -self.H * np.ones(self.n_lower_left + 1)
1577        lower_left = np.stack([lower_left_x1, lower_left_x2], axis=0)
1578        # lower right
1579        lower_right_x1 = np.concatenate([
1580            [0], np.cumsum(2*self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left:])])
1581        lower_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(lower_right_x1)
1582        lower_right = (R @ np.stack([lower_right_x1, lower_right_x2], axis=0)
1583                       - np.array([[s], [self.H]]))
1584        # concatenate mesh parts
1585        self.end_upper = upper_right
1586        """ 2-element coordinates of upper fault patch endpoints [m] """
1587        self.end_lower = np.concatenate([lower_left, lower_right[:, 1:]], axis=1)
1588        """ 2-element coordinates of lower fault patch endpoints [m] """
1589        self.end = np.concatenate([self.end_upper, self.end_lower], axis=1)
1590        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch endpoints [m] """
1591        self.mid = np.concatenate([upper_right[:, :-1] + upper_right[:, 1:],
1592                                   lower_left[:, :-1] + lower_left[:, 1:],
1593                                   lower_right[:, :-1] + lower_right[:, 1:]],
1594                                  axis=1) / 2
1595        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1596        self.mid_x1 = self.mid[0, :]
1597        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1598        self.mid_x2 = self.mid[1, :]
1599        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1600        # access subparts
1601        self.ix_upper = np.arange(self.mid_x1.size) < upper_right_x1.size
1602        """ Mask of upper fault interface patches """
1603        self.ix_lower = ~self.ix_upper
1604        """ Mask of lower fault interface patches (if existing) """
1605        # locked is the part that slips coseismically on the upper plate interface
1606        self.x1_lock = self.D_lock / np.tan(self.theta)
1607        """ Theoretical surface location [m] of end of locked interface """
1608        ix_locked = self.mid_x1 <= self.x1_lock - self.halflen
1609        ix_locked[self.n_upper:] = False
1610        self.ix_locked = ix_locked
1611        """ Mask of fault patches that are locked interseismically """
1612        self.n_locked = (self.ix_locked).sum()
1613        """ Number [-] of locked patches """
1614        # assert self.n_locked == n_lock
1615        self.n_creeping = (~self.ix_locked).sum()
1616        """ Number [-] of creeping patches """
1617        self.n_creeping_upper = (~self.ix_locked[:self.n_upper]).sum()
1618        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface """
1619        # assert self.n_creeping_upper == n_creep_up
1620        self.n_creeping_lower = self.n_creeping - self.n_creeping_upper
1621        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface """
1622        assert self.n_creeping_lower == n_lower_left + n_lower_right
1623        self.mid_x1_locked = self.mid_x1[self.ix_locked]
1624        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
1625        self.mid_x2_locked = self.mid_x2[self.ix_locked]
1626        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
1627        self.mid_x1_creeping = self.mid_x1[~self.ix_locked]
1628        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
1629        self.mid_x2_creeping = self.mid_x2[~self.ix_locked]
1630        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
1631        # for later calculations, need theta and unit vectors in vector form
1632        theta_vec = np.ones_like(self.mid_x1) * self.theta
1633        theta_vec[self.n_upper:self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left] = np.pi
1634        theta_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left:] += np.pi
1635        self.theta_vec = theta_vec
1636        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for all fault patches """
1637        self.e_f = np.stack([np.sin(self.theta_vec), np.cos(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
1638        """ Unit vectors [-] normal to fault patches"""
1639        self.e_s = np.stack([-np.cos(self.theta_vec), np.sin(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
1640        """ Unit vectors [-] in fault patch slip direction """
1641        # get external (from the locked to the creeping patches) stress kernel
1642        K = Klinedisp(self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1643                      self.mid_x1_locked, self.mid_x2_locked,
1644                      self.halflen_vec[self.ix_locked],
1645                      self.theta_vec[self.ix_locked], self.nu, self.E
1646                      )[:, :self.n_locked]
1647        Kx1x1 = K[:self.n_creeping, :]
1648        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping:2*self.n_creeping, :]
1649        Kx1x2 = K[2*self.n_creeping:3*self.n_creeping, :]
1650        K = np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()]
1651                     ).reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_locked).transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
1652        self.K_ext = np.einsum("ki,ijkl,li->ij", self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
1653                               K, self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked], optimize=True)
1654        """ External stress kernel [Pa/m] """
1655        # get internal (within creeping patches) stress kernel
1656        K = Klinedisp(self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1657                      self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1658                      self.halflen_vec[~self.ix_locked],
1659                      self.theta_vec[~self.ix_locked], self.nu, self.E
1660                      )[:, :self.n_creeping]
1661        Kx1x1 = K[:self.n_creeping, :]
1662        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping:2*self.n_creeping, :]
1663        Kx1x2 = K[2*self.n_creeping:3*self.n_creeping, :]
1664        K = np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()]
1665                     ).reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_creeping).transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
1666        self.K_int = np.einsum("ki,ijkl,li->ij", self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
1667                               K, self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked], optimize=True)
1668        """ Internal stress kernel [Pa/m] """
1669        self.n_state_upper = self.upper_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_upper
1670        """ Size [-] of upper plate interface state variable """
1671        self.n_state_lower = (self.lower_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_lower
1672                              if self.lower_rheo is not None
1673                              else 2 * self.n_creeping_lower)
1674        """ Size [-] of lower plate interface state variable """
1675        if (self.n_creeping_upper == 0) or (self.n_creeping_lower == 0):
1676            raise ValueError("Defined geometry results in zero creeping patches in "
1677                             "either the upper or lower plate interface.")
1678        # # if upper rheology is Burgers, tell it our specific shear modulus
1679        # if isinstance(self.upper_rheo, rheologies.LinearBurgers):
1680        #     self.upper_rheo.set_G(self.K_int[:self.n_creeping_upper, :self.n_creeping_upper])
1681        # discretized locking depth
1682        self.D_lock_disc = -self.end_upper[1, self.n_locked]
1683        """ Discretized locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1684        self.x1_lock_disc = self.D_lock_disc / np.tan(self.theta)
1685        """ Discretized surface location [m] of end of locked interface """

Base class for the subduction fault mesh.

Fault2D( theta, D_lock, H, nu, E, v_s, halflen, upper_rheo, n_upper, lower_rheo, n_lower_left, n_lower_right, halflen_factor_lower, D_max=None, x1_pretrench=None) 
1405    def __init__(self, theta, D_lock, H, nu, E, v_s, halflen,
1406                 upper_rheo, n_upper, lower_rheo, n_lower_left,
1407                 n_lower_right, halflen_factor_lower,
1408                 D_max=None, x1_pretrench=None):
1409        """
1410        Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the
1411        Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.
1412
1413        Parameters
1414        ----------
1415        theta : float
1416            Dip angle [rad] of the plate interface (positive).
1417        D_lock : float
1418            Locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1419        H : float
1420            Subducting plate thickness [m].
1421        nu : float
1422            Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone.
1423        E : float
1424            Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone.
1425        v_s : float
1426            Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
1427        halflen : float
1428            Fault patch half-length [m], used for all locked patches.
1429            If ``D_max`` and ``x1_pretrench`` are not set, this length is also used for all
1430            creeping patches, otherwise, this is their minimum half-length.
1431        upper_rheo : Rheology
1432            Upper plate interface's rheology.
1433        n_upper : int
1434            Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface.
1435        lower_rheo : Rheology
1436            Lower plate interface's rheology. Pass ``None`` if it should not be simulated,
1437            but enforced to have the plate velocity.
1438        n_lower_left : int
1439            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of the bend).
1440        n_lower_right : int
1441            Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of the bend).
1442        halflen_factor_lower : float
1443            Factor used to get a different minimum half-length of the patches on the lower
1444            plate interface.
1445        D_max : float, optional
1446            Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
1447            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1448            locked zone. (``x1_pretrench`` must be set as well.)
1449        x1_pretrench : float, optional
1450            Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (positive).
1451            If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the
1452            locked zone. (``D_max`` must be set as well.)
1453
1454        References
1455        ----------
1456
1457        .. [kanda2010] Kanda, R. V. S., & Simons, M. (2010).
1458           *An elastic plate model for interseismic deformation in subduction zones.*
1459           Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 115(B3).
1460           doi:`10.1029/2009JB006611 <https://doi.org/10.1029/2009JB006611>`_.
1461        """
1462        # initialize
1463        self.theta = float(theta)
1464        """ Subducting plate dip angle [rad] """
1465        assert 0 < self.theta < np.pi / 2
1466        self.D_lock = float(D_lock)
1467        """ Theoretical locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1468        assert self.D_lock > 0
1469        self.H = float(H)
1470        """ Subducting plate thickness [m] """
1471        assert self.H >= 0
1472        self.nu = float(nu)
1473        """ Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone """
1474        self.E = float(E)
1475        """ Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone """
1476        self.halflen = float(halflen)
1477        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on upper interface """
1478        assert self.halflen > 0
1479        self.upper_rheo = upper_rheo
1480        """ Upper plate interface's rheology """
1481        assert isinstance(self.upper_rheo, Rheology)
1482        self.n_upper = int(n_upper)
1483        """ Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface """
1484        assert self.n_upper >= 1
1485        self.lower_rheo = lower_rheo
1486        """ Lower plate interface's rheology """
1487        assert isinstance(self.lower_rheo, Rheology) or \
1488            (self.lower_rheo is None)
1489        self.n_lower_left = int(n_lower_left)
1490        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of bend) """
1491        assert self.n_lower_left >= 1
1492        self.n_lower_right = int(n_lower_right)
1493        """ Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of bend) """
1494        assert self.n_lower_right >= 1
1495        self.halflen_factor_lower = float(halflen_factor_lower)
1496        """ Prefactor [-] to change the lower interface half-length """
1497        assert self.halflen_factor_lower >= 1
1498        self.lower_halflen = self.halflen * self.halflen_factor_lower
1499        """ Fault patch half-length [m] on lower interface """
1500        if self.lower_rheo is not None:
1501            assert self.H >= 2 * self.lower_halflen, "Plate too thin for given patch sizes."
1502        self.v_s = float(v_s)
1503        """ Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone """
1504        self.mu_over_2vs = self.E / (2 * (1 + self.nu) * 2 * self.v_s)
1505        """ Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m] """
1506
1507        # switch between constant or linearly-varying patch sizes
1508        if (D_max is not None) and (x1_pretrench is not None):
1509            D_max = float(D_max)
1510            x1_pretrench = float(x1_pretrench)
1511            assert D_max > 0
1512            assert x1_pretrench > 0
1513            variable_mesh = True
1514        else:
1515            D_max = None
1516            x1_pretrench = None
1517            variable_mesh = False
1518        self.D_max = D_max
1519        """ Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (optional) """
1520        self.x1_pretrench = x1_pretrench
1521        """ Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (optional) """
1522        self.variable_mesh = variable_mesh
1523        """ Flag whether the creeping patches are linearly-varying in size, or not """
1524
1525        # create mesh, centered about the x2 axis
1526        if self.variable_mesh:
1527            # project the locking depth onto dip angle
1528            L_lock = self.D_lock / np.sin(self.theta)
1529            # get number of locked and creeping patches on upper interface
1530            n_lock = int(L_lock // (2 * self.halflen))
1531            n_creep_up = self.n_upper - n_lock
1532            assert n_creep_up > 0, "Current geometry yields no upper creeping patches."
1533            # project maximum interface depth onto dip angle
1534            L_max = self.D_max / np.sin(self.theta)
1535            # get length of creeping segment that needs to be linearly varying
1536            delta_L = L_max - n_lock * 2 * self.halflen
1537            # get linear half-length increase necessary given the number of patches
1538            # and length of creeping segment, on all three interface regions
1539            delta_h_upper = ((delta_L - 2 * self.halflen * n_creep_up) /
1540                             (n_creep_up**2 - n_creep_up))
1541            delta_h_lower_right = \
1542                ((L_max - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_right) /
1543                 (self.n_lower_right**2 - self.n_lower_right))
1544            delta_h_lower_left = \
1545                ((self.x1_pretrench - 2 * self.lower_halflen * self.n_lower_left) /
1546                 (self.n_lower_left**2 - self.n_lower_left))
1547            # check that we're not running into numerical problems from starkly
1548            # increasing patch sizes
1549            if any([d > 0.2 for d in [delta_h_upper / self.halflen,
1550                                      delta_h_lower_right / self.lower_halflen,
1551                                      delta_h_lower_left / self.lower_halflen]]):
1552                raise ValueError("Half-length increase greater than 20%.")
1553            # build vector of half-lengths
1554            halflen_vec = np.concatenate([
1555                np.ones(n_lock) * self.halflen,
1556                self.halflen + np.arange(n_creep_up) * delta_h_upper,
1557                (self.lower_halflen + np.arange(self.n_lower_left) * delta_h_lower_left)[::-1],
1558                self.lower_halflen + np.arange(self.n_lower_right) * delta_h_lower_right])
1559        else:
1560            # build half-length vector from constant size
1561            halflen_vec = np.ones(self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left + self.n_lower_right
1562                                  ) * self.halflen
1563            halflen_vec[self.n_upper:] *= self.halflen_factor_lower
1564        self.halflen_vec = halflen_vec
1565        """ Half-lengths [m] for each patch in the fault """
1566        s = self.H * np.tan(self.theta / 2)
1567        R = np.array([[np.cos(-self.theta), -np.sin(-self.theta)],
1568                      [np.sin(-self.theta), np.cos(-self.theta)]])
1569        # upper plate interface
1570        upper_right_x1 = np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2*self.halflen_vec[:self.n_upper])])
1571        upper_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(upper_right_x1)
1572        upper_right = R @ np.stack([upper_right_x1, upper_right_x2], axis=0)
1573        # lower left plate interface
1574        temp = self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left - 1:self.n_upper - 1:-1]
1575        lower_left_x1 = -s - np.concatenate([[0], np.cumsum(2*temp)])[::-1]
1576        lower_left_x2 = -self.H * np.ones(self.n_lower_left + 1)
1577        lower_left = np.stack([lower_left_x1, lower_left_x2], axis=0)
1578        # lower right
1579        lower_right_x1 = np.concatenate([
1580            [0], np.cumsum(2*self.halflen_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left:])])
1581        lower_right_x2 = np.zeros_like(lower_right_x1)
1582        lower_right = (R @ np.stack([lower_right_x1, lower_right_x2], axis=0)
1583                       - np.array([[s], [self.H]]))
1584        # concatenate mesh parts
1585        self.end_upper = upper_right
1586        """ 2-element coordinates of upper fault patch endpoints [m] """
1587        self.end_lower = np.concatenate([lower_left, lower_right[:, 1:]], axis=1)
1588        """ 2-element coordinates of lower fault patch endpoints [m] """
1589        self.end = np.concatenate([self.end_upper, self.end_lower], axis=1)
1590        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch endpoints [m] """
1591        self.mid = np.concatenate([upper_right[:, :-1] + upper_right[:, 1:],
1592                                   lower_left[:, :-1] + lower_left[:, 1:],
1593                                   lower_right[:, :-1] + lower_right[:, 1:]],
1594                                  axis=1) / 2
1595        """ 2-element coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1596        self.mid_x1 = self.mid[0, :]
1597        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1598        self.mid_x2 = self.mid[1, :]
1599        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m] """
1600        # access subparts
1601        self.ix_upper = np.arange(self.mid_x1.size) < upper_right_x1.size
1602        """ Mask of upper fault interface patches """
1603        self.ix_lower = ~self.ix_upper
1604        """ Mask of lower fault interface patches (if existing) """
1605        # locked is the part that slips coseismically on the upper plate interface
1606        self.x1_lock = self.D_lock / np.tan(self.theta)
1607        """ Theoretical surface location [m] of end of locked interface """
1608        ix_locked = self.mid_x1 <= self.x1_lock - self.halflen
1609        ix_locked[self.n_upper:] = False
1610        self.ix_locked = ix_locked
1611        """ Mask of fault patches that are locked interseismically """
1612        self.n_locked = (self.ix_locked).sum()
1613        """ Number [-] of locked patches """
1614        # assert self.n_locked == n_lock
1615        self.n_creeping = (~self.ix_locked).sum()
1616        """ Number [-] of creeping patches """
1617        self.n_creeping_upper = (~self.ix_locked[:self.n_upper]).sum()
1618        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface """
1619        # assert self.n_creeping_upper == n_creep_up
1620        self.n_creeping_lower = self.n_creeping - self.n_creeping_upper
1621        """ Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface """
1622        assert self.n_creeping_lower == n_lower_left + n_lower_right
1623        self.mid_x1_locked = self.mid_x1[self.ix_locked]
1624        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
1625        self.mid_x2_locked = self.mid_x2[self.ix_locked]
1626        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m] """
1627        self.mid_x1_creeping = self.mid_x1[~self.ix_locked]
1628        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
1629        self.mid_x2_creeping = self.mid_x2[~self.ix_locked]
1630        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m] """
1631        # for later calculations, need theta and unit vectors in vector form
1632        theta_vec = np.ones_like(self.mid_x1) * self.theta
1633        theta_vec[self.n_upper:self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left] = np.pi
1634        theta_vec[self.n_upper + self.n_lower_left:] += np.pi
1635        self.theta_vec = theta_vec
1636        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for all fault patches """
1637        self.e_f = np.stack([np.sin(self.theta_vec), np.cos(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
1638        """ Unit vectors [-] normal to fault patches"""
1639        self.e_s = np.stack([-np.cos(self.theta_vec), np.sin(self.theta_vec)], axis=0)
1640        """ Unit vectors [-] in fault patch slip direction """
1641        # get external (from the locked to the creeping patches) stress kernel
1642        K = Klinedisp(self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1643                      self.mid_x1_locked, self.mid_x2_locked,
1644                      self.halflen_vec[self.ix_locked],
1645                      self.theta_vec[self.ix_locked], self.nu, self.E
1646                      )[:, :self.n_locked]
1647        Kx1x1 = K[:self.n_creeping, :]
1648        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping:2*self.n_creeping, :]
1649        Kx1x2 = K[2*self.n_creeping:3*self.n_creeping, :]
1650        K = np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()]
1651                     ).reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_locked).transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
1652        self.K_ext = np.einsum("ki,ijkl,li->ij", self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
1653                               K, self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked], optimize=True)
1654        """ External stress kernel [Pa/m] """
1655        # get internal (within creeping patches) stress kernel
1656        K = Klinedisp(self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1657                      self.mid_x1_creeping, self.mid_x2_creeping,
1658                      self.halflen_vec[~self.ix_locked],
1659                      self.theta_vec[~self.ix_locked], self.nu, self.E
1660                      )[:, :self.n_creeping]
1661        Kx1x1 = K[:self.n_creeping, :]
1662        Kx2x2 = K[self.n_creeping:2*self.n_creeping, :]
1663        Kx1x2 = K[2*self.n_creeping:3*self.n_creeping, :]
1664        K = np.stack([Kx1x1.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx1x2.ravel(), Kx2x2.ravel()]
1665                     ).reshape(2, 2, self.n_creeping, self.n_creeping).transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
1666        self.K_int = np.einsum("ki,ijkl,li->ij", self.e_s[:, ~self.ix_locked],
1667                               K, self.e_f[:, ~self.ix_locked], optimize=True)
1668        """ Internal stress kernel [Pa/m] """
1669        self.n_state_upper = self.upper_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_upper
1670        """ Size [-] of upper plate interface state variable """
1671        self.n_state_lower = (self.lower_rheo.n_vars * self.n_creeping_lower
1672                              if self.lower_rheo is not None
1673                              else 2 * self.n_creeping_lower)
1674        """ Size [-] of lower plate interface state variable """
1675        if (self.n_creeping_upper == 0) or (self.n_creeping_lower == 0):
1676            raise ValueError("Defined geometry results in zero creeping patches in "
1677                             "either the upper or lower plate interface.")
1678        # # if upper rheology is Burgers, tell it our specific shear modulus
1679        # if isinstance(self.upper_rheo, rheologies.LinearBurgers):
1680        #     self.upper_rheo.set_G(self.K_int[:self.n_creeping_upper, :self.n_creeping_upper])
1681        # discretized locking depth
1682        self.D_lock_disc = -self.end_upper[1, self.n_locked]
1683        """ Discretized locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface """
1684        self.x1_lock_disc = self.D_lock_disc / np.tan(self.theta)
1685        """ Discretized surface location [m] of end of locked interface """

Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.

Parameters
  • theta (float): Dip angle [rad] of the plate interface (positive).
  • D_lock (float): Locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive).
  • H (float): Subducting plate thickness [m].
  • nu (float): Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone.
  • E (float): Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone.
  • v_s (float): Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
  • halflen (float): Fault patch half-length [m], used for all locked patches. If D_max and x1_pretrench are not set, this length is also used for all creeping patches, otherwise, this is their minimum half-length.
  • upper_rheo (Rheology): Upper plate interface's rheology.
  • n_upper (int): Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface.
  • lower_rheo (Rheology): Lower plate interface's rheology. Pass None if it should not be simulated, but enforced to have the plate velocity.
  • n_lower_left (int): Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of the bend).
  • n_lower_right (int): Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of the bend).
  • halflen_factor_lower (float): Factor used to get a different minimum half-length of the patches on the lower plate interface.
  • D_max (float, optional): Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (positive). If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the locked zone. (x1_pretrench must be set as well.)
  • x1_pretrench (float, optional): Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (positive). If set, this makes the mesh use linearly-increasing patch sizes away from the locked zone. (D_max must be set as well.)
References

.. [kanda2010] Kanda, R. V. S., & Simons, M. (2010). An elastic plate model for interseismic deformation in subduction zones. Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 115(B3). doi:10.1029/2009JB006611 .

theta

Subducting plate dip angle [rad]

D_lock

Theoretical locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface

H

Subducting plate thickness [m]

nu

Poisson's ratio [-] of the fault zone

E

Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone

halflen

Fault patch half-length [m] on upper interface

upper_rheo

Upper plate interface's rheology

n_upper

Number [-] of patches on upper plate interface

lower_rheo

Lower plate interface's rheology

n_lower_left

Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (left of bend)

n_lower_right

Number [-] of patches on lower plate interface (right of bend)

halflen_factor_lower

Prefactor [-] to change the lower interface half-length

lower_halflen

Fault patch half-length [m] on lower interface

v_s

Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone

mu_over_2vs

Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m]

D_max

Maximum depth [m] of the upper plate interface (optional)

x1_pretrench

Horizontal distance [m] of the lower plate interface before the trench (optional)

variable_mesh

Flag whether the creeping patches are linearly-varying in size, or not

halflen_vec

Half-lengths [m] for each patch in the fault

end_upper

2-element coordinates of upper fault patch endpoints [m]

end_lower

2-element coordinates of lower fault patch endpoints [m]

end

2-element coordinates of fault patch endpoints [m]

mid

2-element coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x1

\( x_1 \) coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x2

\( x_2 \) coordinates of fault patch midpoints [m]

ix_upper

Mask of upper fault interface patches

ix_lower

Mask of lower fault interface patches (if existing)

x1_lock

Theoretical surface location [m] of end of locked interface

ix_locked

Mask of fault patches that are locked interseismically

n_locked

Number [-] of locked patches

n_creeping

Number [-] of creeping patches

n_creeping_upper

Number [-] of creeping patches in the upper fault interface

n_creeping_lower

Number [-] of creeping patches in the lower fault interface

mid_x1_locked

\( x_1 \) coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x2_locked

\( x_2 \) coordinates of locked fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x1_creeping

\( x_1 \) coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_x2_creeping

\( x_2 \) coordinates of creeping fault patch midpoints [m]

theta_vec

Plate dip angle [rad] for all fault patches

e_f

Unit vectors [-] normal to fault patches

e_s

Unit vectors [-] in fault patch slip direction

K_ext

External stress kernel [Pa/m]

K_int

Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]

n_state_upper

Size [-] of upper plate interface state variable

n_state_lower

Size [-] of lower plate interface state variable

D_lock_disc

Discretized locking depth [m] of the upper plate interface

x1_lock_disc

Discretized surface location [m] of end of locked interface

class SubductionSimulation: 
1688class SubductionSimulation():
1689    """
1690    Subduction simulation container class.
1691    """
1692
1693    def __init__(self, v_plate, n_cycles_max, n_samples_per_eq, delta_tau_max, v_max,
1694                 fault, Ds_0, Ds_0_logsigma, T_rec, T_rec_logsigma, D_asp_min,
1695                 D_asp_max, T_anchor, T_last, enforce_v_plate, largehalflen,
1696                 t_obs, pts_surf):
1697        """
1698        Create a subduction simulation.
1699
1700        Parameters
1701        ----------
1702        v_plate : float
1703            Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology
1704        n_cycles_max : int
1705            Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
1706        n_samples_per_eq : int
1707            Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
1708        delta_tau_max : float
1709            Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches
1710        v_max : float
1711            Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches
1712        fault : Fault2D
1713            Fault object
1714        Ds_0 : numpy.ndarray
1715            Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es)
1716        Ds_0_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
1717            Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space
1718        T_rec : numpy.ndarray
1719            Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake
1720        T_rec_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
1721            Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
1722        D_asp_min : numpy.ndarray
1723            Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
1724        D_asp_max : numpy.ndarray
1725            Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
1726        T_anchor : str
1727            Anchor date where observations end
1728        T_last : list
1729            Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
1730        enforce_v_plate : bool
1731            Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not
1732        largehalflen : float
1733            Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m]
1734        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
1735            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
1736            or as Timestamps
1737        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
1738            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
1739        """
1740
1741        # save general sequence & fault parameters
1742        self.v_plate = float(v_plate)
1743        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology """
1744        self.n_cycles_max = int(n_cycles_max)
1745        """ Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-] """
1746        self.n_samples_per_eq = int(n_samples_per_eq)
1747        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-] """
1748        self.delta_tau_max = float(delta_tau_max)
1749        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches """
1750        self.v_max = float(v_max)
1751        """ Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches """
1752
1753        # define fault
1754        assert isinstance(fault, Fault2D)
1755        if not (isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or
1756                isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic)) or \
1757           not (isinstance(fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or
1758                (fault.lower_rheo is None)):
1759            raise NotImplementedError("SubductionSimulation is only implemented for "
1760                                      "NonlinearViscous or RateStateSteadyLogarithmic "
1761                                      "rheologies in the upper interface, and NonlinearViscous "
1762                                      "rheology in the lower interface.")
1763        self.fault = fault
1764        """ Fault object """
1765
1766        # cast earthquake slips as NumPy array
1767        self.Ds_0 = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0)
1768        """ Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es) """
1769        self.Ds_0_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0_logsigma)
1770        """ Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space """
1771        # load recurrence times
1772        self.T_rec = np.atleast_1d(T_rec)
1773        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake """
1774        self.T_rec_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(T_rec_logsigma)
1775        """ Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space """
1776        # load the minimum and maximum depths of the earthquakes
1777        self.D_asp_min = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_min)
1778        """ Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
1779        self.D_asp_max = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_max)
1780        """ Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
1781        assert all([D <= self.fault.D_lock for D in self.D_asp_max]), \
1782            f"Asperity depths {self.D_asp_max/1e3} km are deeper than the " \
1783            f"locking depth {self.fault.D_lock/1e3}."
1784        self.T_anchor = str(T_anchor)
1785        """ Anchor date where observations end """
1786        assert isinstance(T_last, list) and all([isinstance(tl, str) for tl in T_last])
1787        self.T_last = T_last
1788        """ Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake """
1789        # create a NumPy array that for each locked asperity has the slip per earthquake
1790        self.slip_mask = np.logical_and(self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1)
1791                                        < -self.D_asp_min.reshape(1, -1),
1792                                        self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1)
1793                                        > -self.D_asp_max.reshape(1, -1))
1794        """ Mask that matches each earthquake to a fault patch """
1795        self.T_fullcycle = np.lcm.reduce(self.T_rec)
1796        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle """
1797        self.n_eq = self.Ds_0.size
1798        """ Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence """
1799        self.n_eq_per_asp = (self.T_fullcycle / self.T_rec).astype(int)
1800        """ Number of earthquakes per asperity and full cycle """
1801
1802        # create realization of the slip amount and earthquake timings
1803        rng = np.random.default_rng()
1804        # first, create realizations of occurence times
1805        # note that this will result in a varying plate velocity rate
1806        # (ignore zero-slip earthquakes)
1807        self.T_rec_per_asp = [rng.lognormal(np.log(t), s, n) for t, s, n in
1808                              zip(self.T_rec, self.T_rec_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)]
1809        """ Recurrence time [a] realization """
1810        self.Ds_0_per_asp = [rng.lognormal(np.log(d), s, n) if d > 0
1811                             else np.array([d] * n) for d, s, n in
1812                             zip(self.Ds_0, self.Ds_0_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)]
1813        """ Fault slip [m] realization """
1814
1815        # sanity check that in each asperity, the nominal plate rate is recovered
1816        self.slip_asperities = self.slip_mask.astype(int) * self.Ds_0.reshape(1, -1)
1817        """ Slip [m] for each earthquake in each asperity """
1818        v_eff_in_asp = (self.slip_asperities / self.T_rec.reshape(1, -1)).sum(axis=1)
1819        assert np.allclose(v_eff_in_asp, self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25), \
1820            "The nominal plate rate is not recovered in all asperities.\n" \
1821            f"Plate velocity = {self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25}\n" \
1822            f"Effective velocity in each asperity:\n{v_eff_in_asp}"
1823
1824        # second, we need to shift the random realization for each earthquake
1825        # individually such that they all yield the same v_plate (enforced or not)
1826        # get the effective recurrence time as implied by the T_rec realizations
1827        T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(t) for t in self.T_rec_per_asp])
1828        # same for the effective cumulative slip
1829        Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(d) for d in self.Ds_0_per_asp])
1830        # we need to scale each individual sequence such that it implies the same
1831        # recurrence time and cumulative slip in each asperity
1832        # (again ignoring zero-slip earthquakes)
1833        T_fullcycle_eff_mean = np.mean(T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff)
1834        Ds_0_fullcycle_mean = np.ma.masked_equal(Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff, 0).mean()
1835        T_rec_per_asp_adj = [np.array(self.T_rec_per_asp[i]) * T_fullcycle_eff_mean
1836                             / T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i] for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1837        Ds_0_per_asp_adj = [np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i]) * Ds_0_fullcycle_mean
1838                            / Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i] if self.Ds_0[i] > 0
1839                            else np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i]) for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1840        # now each asperity has the same effective plate velocity, which can be different
1841        # from the nominal one - if we want to enforce the nominal plate velocity,
1842        # we can rescale the recurrence times again
1843        self.enforce_v_plate = bool(enforce_v_plate)
1844        """ Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not """
1845        ix_nonzero_slip = np.argmax(self.Ds_0 > 0)
1846        v_plate_eff = (sum(Ds_0_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
1847                       / sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip]) / 86400 / 365.25)
1848        if self.enforce_v_plate:
1849            v_plate_factor = self.v_plate / v_plate_eff
1850            for i in range(self.n_eq):
1851                T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] /= v_plate_factor
1852            v_plate_eff = self.v_plate
1853        self.v_plate_eff = v_plate_eff
1854        """ Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s] """
1855        self.T_eff = sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[0])
1856        """ Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence """
1857
1858        # third, we need to create a list of earthquake dates and associated slips
1859        temp_slips = np.vstack([self.slip_mask[:, i].reshape(1, -1)
1860                                * Ds_0_per_asp_adj[i].reshape(-1, 1)
1861                                for i in range(self.n_eq)])
1862        year_offsets = [(pd.Period(self.T_anchor, "D") - pd.Period(self.T_last[i], "D")
1863                         ).n / 365.25 for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1864        eq_df_index = np.concatenate(
1865            [self.T_eff -
1866             (np.cumsum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[i]) - T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] + year_offsets[i])
1867             for i in range(self.n_eq)])
1868        # round the dates to the closest day and combine earthquakes
1869        eq_df_index_rounded = np.around(eq_df_index * 365.25) / 365.25
1870        # build a DataFrame with exact and rounded times
1871        eq_df = pd.DataFrame(data=temp_slips)
1872        eq_df["time"] = eq_df_index
1873        eq_df["rounded"] = eq_df_index_rounded
1874        # now aggregate by rounded time, keeping the minimum exact time, and summing slip
1875        agg_dict = {"time": "min"}
1876        agg_dict.update({c: "sum" for c in range(self.fault.n_locked)})
1877        eq_df = eq_df.groupby("rounded").agg(agg_dict)
1878        # convert time column to index and sort
1879        eq_df.set_index("time", inplace=True)
1880        eq_df.sort_index(inplace=True)
1881        assert np.allclose(eq_df.sum(axis=0), eq_df.sum(axis=0)[0])
1882        self.eq_df = eq_df
1883        """
1884        DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m]
1885        for each asperity
1886        """
1887
1888        # fourth, we need to create a list of dates to use internally when evaluating
1889        # the earthquake cycle - this is independent of the observation dates
1890        i_frac_cumsum = np.concatenate([[self.eq_df.index[-1] - self.T_eff],
1891                                        self.eq_df.index.values])
1892        T_frac = np.diff(i_frac_cumsum)
1893        t_eval = np.concatenate(
1894            [np.logspace(0, np.log10(1 + T_frac[i]), self.n_samples_per_eq, endpoint=False)
1895             - 1 + i_frac_cumsum[i] + j*self.T_eff
1896             for j in range(self.n_cycles_max) for i, t in enumerate(T_frac)])
1897        num_neg = (t_eval < 0).sum()
1898        t_eval = np.roll(t_eval, -num_neg)
1899        t_eval[-num_neg:] += self.n_cycles_max * self.T_eff
1900        self.t_eval = np.sort(np.concatenate(
1901            [t_eval, np.arange(self.n_cycles_max + 1) * self.T_eff]))
1902        """ Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
1903        self.n_eval = self.t_eval.size
1904        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-] """
1905
1906        # fifth, for the integration, we need the indices of the timesteps that mark either
1907        # an earthquake or the start of a new cycle
1908        self.n_slips = self.eq_df.shape[0]
1909        """ Number of slips in a sequence [-] """
1910        self.ix_break = [i*(self.n_slips * self.n_samples_per_eq + 1)
1911                         for i in range(self.n_cycles_max + 1)]
1912        """ Indices of breaks between cycles """
1913        self.ix_eq = [self.ix_break[i] + j * self.n_samples_per_eq - num_neg + 1
1914                      for i in range(self.n_cycles_max) for j in range(1, 1 + self.n_slips)]
1915        """ Indices of earthquakes """
1916
1917        # sixth and last, for the final loop, we need a joint timesteps array between internal
1918        # and external (observation) timestamps, such that we can debug, check early stopping,
1919        # and restrict the output to the requested timeseries
1920        if isinstance(t_obs, pd.DatetimeIndex):
1921            t_obs = self.T_eff + (t_obs - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor)
1922                                  ).total_seconds().values / 86400 / 365.25
1923        elif isinstance(t_obs, np.ndarray):
1924            if np.all(t_obs < 0):
1925                # this format is relative to T_anchor and more stable when T_eff varies
1926                t_obs = self.T_eff + t_obs
1927            assert np.all(t_obs >= 0) and np.all(t_obs < self.T_eff), \
1928                f"Range of 't_obs' ({t_obs.min()}-{t_obs.max():} years) outside of " \
1929                f"the earthquake cycle period ({self.T_eff:} years)."
1930        else:
1931            raise ValueError("Unknown 't_obs' data type.")
1932        self.t_obs = t_obs
1933        """ Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
1934        # combine all possible timesteps
1935        t_obs_shifted = self.t_obs + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
1936        self.t_eval_joint = np.unique(np.concatenate((self.t_eval, t_obs_shifted)))
1937        """
1938        Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps
1939        [decimal years since cycle start]
1940        """
1941        # get indices of each individual subset in the new timesteps array
1942        self.ix_break_joint = \
1943            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_break]))
1944        """ Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps """
1945        self.ix_eq_joint = \
1946            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_eq]))
1947        """ Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps """
1948        self.ix_obs_joint = \
1949            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, t_obs_shifted))
1950        """ Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps """
1951
1952        # get vectors of upper plate rheology parameters
1953        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1954            # alpha_h
1955            self.alpha_h_vec = \
1956                self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
1957                    -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper])
1958            r""" Depth-variable :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] of upper plate interface """
1959        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
1960            # A, alpha_n, and n
1961            alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec = \
1962                self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
1963                    -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper], self.v_plate)
1964            self.alpha_n_vec = alpha_n_vec
1965            r""" Depth-variable :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] of upper plate interface """
1966            self.n_vec = n_vec
1967            r""" Depth-variable :math:`n` [-] of upper plate interface """
1968            self.A_vec = A_vec
1969            r""" Depth-variable :math:`A ` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] of upper plate interface """
1970        else:
1971            raise NotImplementedError
1972
1973        # get unbounded delta_tau
1974        self.delta_tau_unbounded = self.fault.K_ext @ self.eq_df.values.T
1975        """ Unbounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
1976        # get pseudoinverse of K_int for tapered slip
1977        self.K_int_inv_upper = np.linalg.pinv(
1978            self.fault.K_int[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :self.fault.n_creeping_upper])
1979        """ Inverse of K_int [m/Pa] """
1980        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower = \
1981            ((self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_max)**(1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n) -
1982             (self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_plate)**(1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n)
1983             if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None else np.inf)
1984        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in lower plate from capped velocity """
1985        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
1986            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = \
1987                (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_max)**(1 / self.n_vec) - \
1988                (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_plate)**(1 / self.n_vec)
1989        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1990            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = self.alpha_h_vec * \
1991                (np.log(self.v_max / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0) -
1992                 np.log(self.v_plate / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0))
1993        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper
1994        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in upper plate from capped velocity """
1995        self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper = np.fmin(self.delta_tau_max,
1996                                                 self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper)
1997        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in upper plate """
1998        self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower = \
1999            (min(self.delta_tau_max, self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower)
2000             if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None else np.inf)
2001        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in lower plate """
2002        # create tapered slip by making delta_tau linearly increase until delta_tau_max
2003        delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_unbounded.copy()
2004        delta_tau_bounded[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] = \
2005            np.fmin(self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper.reshape(-1, 1),
2006                    self.delta_tau_unbounded[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :])
2007        self.delta_tau_bounded = delta_tau_bounded
2008        """ Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
2009        # get the additional slip
2010        self.slip_taper = (self.K_int_inv_upper @
2011                           (self.delta_tau_bounded - self.delta_tau_unbounded
2012                            )[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :])
2013        # check if the lower plate should have been bounded as well
2014        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2015            assert not np.any(np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, :])
2016                              > self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower), \
2017                ("Maximum stress change delta_tau_bounded "
2018                 f"{np.max(np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded)):.2e} Pa in lower interface "
2019                 f"above delta_tau_max = {self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower:.2e} Pa")
2020        self.slip_taper_ts = \
2021            pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=self.slip_taper.T) \
2022            .cumsum(axis=0).reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
2023        """ Timeseries of tapered slip [m] on the upper creeping fault patches """
2024
2025        # need the imagined location and orientation of the deep creep patches
2026        self.largehalflen = float(largehalflen)
2027        """ Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m] """
2028        self.mid_deep_x1 = \
2029            np.array([self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2030                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2031                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2032                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2033                      * self.largehalflen,
2034                      self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1]
2035                      - self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1]
2036                      - self.largehalflen,
2037                      self.fault.mid_x1[-1]
2038                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2039                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2040                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2041                      * self.largehalflen])
2042        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2043        self.mid_deep_x2 = \
2044            np.array([self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2045                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2046                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2047                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2048                      * self.largehalflen,
2049                      self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1],
2050                      self.fault.mid_x2[-1]
2051                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2052                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2053                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2054                      * self.largehalflen])
2055        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2056        self.theta_vec_deep = \
2057            np.array([self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1],
2058                      np.pi,
2059                      self.fault.theta_vec[-1]])
2060        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for deep creep fault patches """
2061
2062        # create the Green's matrices
2063        self.pts_surf = pts_surf
2064        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of surface observation points [m] """
2065        self.n_stations = self.pts_surf.size
2066        """ Number of surface observing stations """
2067        self.G_surf_fault = Glinedisp(
2068            self.pts_surf, 0, self.fault.mid_x1, self.fault.mid_x2,
2069            self.fault.halflen_vec, self.fault.theta_vec, self.fault.nu
2070            )[:, :self.fault.mid_x1.size]
2071        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the main fault patches to surface motion """
2072        self.G_surf_deep = Glinedisp(
2073            self.pts_surf, 0, self.mid_deep_x1, self.mid_deep_x2,
2074            self.largehalflen, self.theta_vec_deep, self.fault.nu)[:, :3]
2075        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the deep creep patches to surface motion """
2076        self.G_surf = np.hstack([self.G_surf_fault, self.G_surf_deep])
2077        """ Joint Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the entire ESPM to surface motion """
2078
2079        # calculate the best initial velocity state from the steady state ODE
2080        v_plate_vec = np.ones(self.fault.n_creeping) * self.v_plate
2081        v_plate_vec[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:] *= -1
2082        self.v_plate_vec = v_plate_vec
2083        """ Vector with the plate velocity for each creeping patch [m/s] """
2084        # get the initial velocity, taking advantage of the option that there could be a
2085        # deep transition zone
2086        v_init = v_plate_vec.copy()
2087        if self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition is not None:
2088            ix_deep = np.argmin(np.abs(-self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
2089                                       - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition
2090                                       - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition_width))
2091            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2092                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(self.v_plate * 1e-6, self.v_plate,
2093                                               num=ix_deep, endpoint=False)
2094            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2095                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(0, self.v_plate, num=ix_deep, endpoint=False)
2096        self.v_init = v_init
2097        """ Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s] """
2098
2099    @property
2100    def locked_slip(self):
2101        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches for observation timespan """
2102        return self.eq_df.cumsum(axis=0) \
2103            .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0).values.T
2104
2105    @property
2106    def deep_creep_slip(self):
2107        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches for observation timestamps """
2108        return (np.tile(self.t_obs.reshape(1, -1), (3, 1))
2109                * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
2110                * self.v_plate_eff * 86400 * 365.25)
2111
2112    @staticmethod
2113    def read_config_file(config_file):
2114        """
2115        Read a configuration file and return it as a parsed dictionary.
2116
2117        Parameters
2118        ----------
2119        config_file : str
2120            Path to INI configuration file.
2121
2122        Returns
2123        -------
2124        cfg_dict : dict
2125            Parsed configuration file.
2126        """
2127
2128        # load configuration file
2129        cfg = configparser.ConfigParser()
2130        cfg.optionxform = str
2131        with open(config_file, mode="rt") as f:
2132            cfg.read_file(f)
2133        cfg_seq, cfg_fault, cfg_mesh = cfg["sequence"], cfg["fault"], cfg["mesh"]
2134
2135        # parse rheologies
2136        upper_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["upper_rheo"])
2137        upper_rheo_type = upper_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2138        upper_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in upper_rheo_dict.items()}
2139        try:
2140            lower_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["lower_rheo"])
2141        except KeyError:
2142            lower_rheo_type = None
2143            lower_rheo_kw_args = None
2144        else:
2145            lower_rheo_type = lower_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2146            lower_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in lower_rheo_dict.items()}
2147
2148        # parse everything else
2149        cfg_dict = {
2150            "theta": np.deg2rad(cfg_fault.getfloat("theta_deg")),
2151            "D_lock": cfg_fault.getfloat("D_lock"),
2152            "H": cfg_fault.getfloat("H"),
2153            "nu": cfg_fault.getfloat("nu"),
2154            "E": cfg_fault.getfloat("E"),
2155            "v_s": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_s"),
2156            "halflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen"),
2157            "n_upper": cfg_mesh.getint("n_up"),
2158            "n_lower_left": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_l"),
2159            "n_lower_right": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_r"),
2160            "halflen_factor_lower": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen_factor_lower"),
2161            "D_max": cfg_mesh.getfloat("D_max", fallback=None),
2162            "x1_pretrench": cfg_mesh.getfloat("x1_pretrench", fallback=None),
2163            "v_plate": cfg_seq.getfloat("v_plate"),
2164            "n_cycles_max": cfg_seq.getint("n_cycles_max"),
2165            "n_samples_per_eq": cfg_seq.getint("n_samples_per_eq"),
2166            "delta_tau_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("delta_tau_max", fallback=np.inf),
2167            "v_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_max", fallback=np.inf),
2168            "Ds_0": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["Ds_0"])),
2169            "Ds_0_logsigma": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["Ds_0_logsigma"])),
2170            "T_rec": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["T_rec"])),
2171            "T_rec_logsigma": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["T_rec_logsigma"])),
2172            "D_asp_min": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["D_asp_min"])),
2173            "D_asp_max": np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_seq["D_asp_max"])),
2174            "T_anchor": cfg_seq.get("T_anchor"),
2175            "T_last": json.loads(cfg_seq["T_last"]),
