2176            "enforce_v_plate": cfg_seq.getboolean("enforce_v_plate"),
2177            "largehalflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("largehalflen"),
2178            "upper_rheo_type": upper_rheo_type,
2179            "lower_rheo_type": lower_rheo_type,
2180            "upper_rheo_kw_args": upper_rheo_kw_args,
2181            "lower_rheo_kw_args": lower_rheo_kw_args
2182            }
2183        return cfg_dict
2184
2185    @classmethod
2186    def from_config_dict(cls, cfg, t_obs, pts_surf):
2187        """
2188        Create a SubductionSimulation object from a configuration dictionary.
2189
2190        Parameters
2191        ----------
2192        cfg : dict
2193            Dictionary containing all parsed elements from the configuration file
2194        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
2195            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
2196            or as Timestamps
2197        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
2198            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
2199
2200        See Also
2201        --------
2202        read_config_file : To load a configuration file into a dictionary.
2203        """
2204
2205        # create rheology objects
2206        upper_rheo = globals()[cfg["upper_rheo_type"]](**cfg["upper_rheo_kw_args"])
2207        if cfg["lower_rheo_type"] is None:
2208            lower_rheo = None
2209        else:
2210            lower_rheo = globals()[cfg["lower_rheo_type"]](**cfg["lower_rheo_kw_args"])
2211
2212        # create fault object
2213        fault = Fault2D(theta=cfg["theta"],
2214                        D_lock=cfg["D_lock"],
2215                        H=cfg["H"],
2216                        nu=cfg["nu"],
2217                        E=cfg["E"],
2218                        v_s=cfg["v_s"],
2219                        halflen=cfg["halflen"],
2220                        upper_rheo=upper_rheo,
2221                        n_upper=cfg["n_upper"],
2222                        lower_rheo=lower_rheo,
2223                        n_lower_left=cfg["n_lower_left"],
2224                        n_lower_right=cfg["n_lower_right"],
2225                        halflen_factor_lower=cfg["halflen_factor_lower"],
2226                        D_max=cfg["D_max"],
2227                        x1_pretrench=cfg["x1_pretrench"])
2228
2229        # create simulation object
2230        return cls(v_plate=cfg["v_plate"],
2231                   n_cycles_max=cfg["n_cycles_max"],
2232                   n_samples_per_eq=cfg["n_samples_per_eq"],
2233                   delta_tau_max=cfg["delta_tau_max"],
2234                   v_max=cfg["v_max"],
2235                   fault=fault,
2236                   Ds_0=cfg["Ds_0"],
2237                   Ds_0_logsigma=cfg["Ds_0_logsigma"],
2238                   T_rec=cfg["T_rec"],
2239                   T_rec_logsigma=cfg["T_rec_logsigma"],
2240                   D_asp_min=cfg["D_asp_min"],
2241                   D_asp_max=cfg["D_asp_max"],
2242                   T_anchor=cfg["T_anchor"],
2243                   T_last=cfg["T_last"],
2244                   enforce_v_plate=cfg["enforce_v_plate"],
2245                   largehalflen=cfg["largehalflen"],
2246                   t_obs=t_obs,
2247                   pts_surf=pts_surf)
2248
2249    @staticmethod
2250    def get_n(alpha_n, alpha_eff, v_eff):
2251        r"""
2252        Calculate the real linear viscous strength constant from the effective one.
2253
2254        Parameters
2255        ----------
2256        alpha_n : float
2257            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2258        alpha_eff : float
2259            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2260        v_eff : float
2261            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2262
2263        Returns
2264        -------
2265        n : float
2266            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2267        """
2268        return (np.log(alpha_n) + np.log(v_eff)) / (np.log(alpha_eff) + np.log(v_eff))
2269
2270    @staticmethod
2271    def get_alpha_n(alpha_eff, n, v_eff):
2272        r"""
2273        Calculate the real linear viscous strength constant from the effective one.
2274
2275        Parameters
2276        ----------
2277        alpha_eff : float
2278            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2279        n : float
2280            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2281        v_eff : float
2282            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2283
2284        Returns
2285        -------
2286        alpha_n : float
2287            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2288        """
2289        alpha_n = alpha_eff**n * v_eff**(n-1)
2290        return alpha_n
2291
2292    @staticmethod
2293    def get_alpha_eff(alpha_n, n, v_eff):
2294        r"""
2295        Calculate the effective linear viscous strength constant from the real one.
2296
2297        Parameters
2298        ----------
2299        alpha_n : float
2300            Nonlinear viscous rheology strength constant :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m]
2301        n : float
2302            Power-law exponent :math:`n` [-]
2303        v_eff : float
2304            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2305
2306        Returns
2307        -------
2308        alpha_eff : float
2309            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2310        """
2311        if isinstance(v_eff, np.ndarray):
2312            temp = v_eff.copy()
2313            temp[temp == 0] = np.NaN
2314        else:
2315            temp = v_eff
2316        alpha_eff = alpha_n**(1/n) * temp**((1-n)/n)
2317        return alpha_eff
2318
2319    @staticmethod
2320    def get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(alpha_h, v_eff):
2321        r"""
2322        Calculate the effective viscosity from the rate-dependent friction.
2323
2324        Parameters
2325        ----------
2326        alpha_h : float
2327            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
2328            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
2329            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
2330        v_eff : float
2331            Effective velocity [m/s] used for ``alpha_eff`` conversions
2332
2333        Returns
2334        -------
2335        alpha_eff : float
2336            Effective linear viscous strength constant [Pa * s/m]
2337        """
2338        if isinstance(v_eff, np.ndarray):
2339            temp = v_eff.copy()
2340            temp[temp == 0] = np.NaN
2341        else:
2342            temp = v_eff
2343        alpha_eff = alpha_h / temp
2344        return alpha_eff
2345
2346    def run(self, simple_rk4=False):
2347        """
2348        Run a full simulation.
2349        """
2350        # run forward integration
2351        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
2352            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2353                full_state = flat_run_rdlog(
2354                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25, self.ix_break_joint, self.ix_eq_joint,
2355                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower, self.fault.K_int,
2356                    self.fault.K_ext, self.v_plate_vec, self.v_init, self.slip_taper,
2357                    self.delta_tau_bounded, self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0, self.alpha_h_vec,
2358                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs)
2359            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2360                full_state = flat_run_plvis(
2361                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25, self.ix_break_joint, self.ix_eq_joint,
2362                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower, self.fault.K_int,
2363                    self.fault.K_ext, self.v_plate_vec, self.v_init, self.slip_taper,
2364                    self.delta_tau_bounded, self.alpha_n_vec, self.n_vec, self.A_vec,
2365                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs)
2366            else:
2367                raise NotImplementedError
2368        elif isinstance(self.fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2369            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2370                full_state = flat_run_plvis_plvis(
2371                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25, self.ix_break_joint, self.ix_eq_joint,
2372                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower, self.fault.K_int,
2373                    self.fault.K_ext, self.v_plate_vec, self.v_init, self.slip_taper,
2374                    self.delta_tau_bounded, self.fault.upper_rheo.alpha_n,
2375                    self.fault.upper_rheo.n, self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n,
2376                    self.fault.lower_rheo.n, simple_rk4)
2377            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2378                full_state = flat_run_rdlog_plvis(
2379                    self.t_eval_joint * 86400 * 365.25, self.ix_break_joint, self.ix_eq_joint,
2380                    self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower, self.fault.K_int,
2381                    self.fault.K_ext, self.v_plate_vec, self.v_init, self.slip_taper,
2382                    self.delta_tau_bounded, self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0,
2383                    self.fault.upper_rheo.alpha_h, self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n,
2384                    self.fault.lower_rheo.n, simple_rk4)
2385            else:
2386                raise NotImplementedError
2387        else:
2388            raise NotImplementedError
2389        # extract the observations that were actually requested
2390        obs_state = full_state[:, self.ix_obs_joint].copy()
2391        # since we're only calculating transient surface displacements, need to
2392        # remove the tapered slip due to bounded stresses
2393        obs_state[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] -= self.slip_taper_ts.values.T
2394        # convert to surface displacements
2395        surf_disps = get_surface_displacements_plvis_plvis(
2396            obs_state, self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.fault.n_creeping_lower,
2397            np.ascontiguousarray(self.G_surf[:, self.fault.n_locked:]),
2398            self.deep_creep_slip)
2399        return full_state, obs_state, surf_disps
2400
2401    def zero_obs_at_eq(self, surf_disps):
2402        """
2403        Reset to zero the surface displacement timeseries every time an earthquake happens.
2404        """
2405        obs_zeroed = surf_disps.copy()
2406        slips_obs = np.logical_and(self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index,
2407                                   self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index)
2408        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
2409        if n_slips_obs == 0:
2410            obs_zeroed -= obs_zeroed[:, 0].reshape(-1, 1)
2411        else:
2412            i_slips_obs = [np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq) for t_eq
2413                           in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]]
2414            obs_zeroed[:, :i_slips_obs[0]] -= obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0] - 1].reshape(-1, 1)
2415            obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0]:] -= obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[0]].reshape(-1, 1)
2416            for i in range(1, n_slips_obs):
2417                obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[i]:] -= obs_zeroed[:, i_slips_obs[i]].reshape(-1, 1)
2418        return obs_zeroed
2419
2420    def _reduce_full_state(self, data):
2421        # get all NaN columns
2422        cols_all_nan = np.all(np.isnan(data), axis=0)
2423        # check if there was early stopping
2424        if cols_all_nan.sum() > 0:
2425            # get the border indices where integrations have been skipped
2426            ix_last, ix_first = np.flatnonzero(cols_all_nan)[[0, -1]]
2427            ix_last -= 1
2428            ix_first += 1
2429            # get indices before and after the NaN period
2430            ix_valid = np.r_[0:ix_last, ix_first:self.t_eval_joint.size]
2431            # subset data
2432            data = data[:, ix_valid]
2433            t_sub = self.t_eval_joint[ix_valid].copy()
2434            t_sub[ix_last:] -= self.t_eval_joint[ix_first] - self.t_eval_joint[ix_last]
2435            n_cyc_completed = int(np.round(self.t_eval_joint[ix_last] / self.T_eff)) + 1
2436        else:
2437            t_sub = self.t_eval_joint.copy()
2438            n_cyc_completed = self.n_cycles_max + 1
2439        # done
2440        return data, t_sub, n_cyc_completed
2441
2442    def plot_surface_displacements(self, obs_zeroed, obs_noisy=None):
2443        """
2444        Plot the observers' surface displacement timeseries.
2445
2446        Parameters
2447        ----------
2448        obs_zeroed : numpy.ndarray
2449            Surface displacements as output by :meth:`~zero_obs_at_eq`.
2450        obs_noisy : numpy.ndarray, optional
2451            Noisy surface observations.
2452
2453        Returns
2454        -------
2455        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2456        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2457        """
2458        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2459        # some helper variables
2460        isort = np.argsort(self.pts_surf)
2461        i_off = 3 * np.std(obs_zeroed.ravel())
2462        # get float dates of observed earthquakes
2463        slips_obs = np.logical_and(self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index,
2464                                   self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index)
2465        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
2466        if n_slips_obs > 0:
2467            i_slips_obs = [np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq) for t_eq
2468                           in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]]
2469            t_last_slips = [self.t_obs[islip] for islip in i_slips_obs]
2470        else:
2471            t_last_slips = []
2472        # start plot
2473        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True, layout="constrained")
2474        for tslip in t_last_slips:
2475            ax[0].axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
2476            ax[1].axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
2477        for i, ix in enumerate(isort):
2478            if obs_noisy is not None:
2479                ax[0].plot(self.t_obs, obs_noisy[ix, :] + i*i_off,
2480                           ".", c="k", rasterized=True)
2481                ax[1].plot(self.t_obs, obs_noisy[ix + self.n_stations, :] + i*i_off,
2482                           ".", c="k", rasterized=True)
2483            ax[0].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix, :] + i*i_off, c=f"C{i}")
2484            ax[1].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix + self.n_stations, :] + i*i_off, c=f"C{i}")
2485        ax[1].set_xlabel("Time")
2486        ax[0].set_ylabel("Horizontal [m]")
2487        ax[1].set_ylabel("Vertical [m]")
2488        fig.suptitle("Surface Displacement")
2489        return fig, ax
2490
2491    def plot_fault_velocities(self, full_state):
2492        """
2493        Plot the velocities on all creeping fault patches.
2494
2495        Parameters
2496        ----------
2497        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2498            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2499
2500        Returns
2501        -------
2502        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2503        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2504        """
2505        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2506        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm
2507        from cmcrameri import cm
2508        # extract velocities
2509        vels = full_state[np.r_[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:self.fault.n_state_upper,
2510                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_creeping_lower:
2511                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_state_lower],
2512                          :] / self.v_plate
2513        # check whether the simulation spun up, and NaN data needs to be skipped
2514        vels, t_sub, n_cyc_completed = self._reduce_full_state(vels)
2515        # normalize time
2516        t_sub /= self.T_eff
2517        # prepare plot
2518        norm = SymLogNorm(linthresh=1, vmin=-1, vmax=100)
2519        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
2520            fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
2521            ax = [ax]
2522        else:
2523            fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True, figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
2524        # plot velocities
2525        c = ax[0].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2526                             self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked:] / 1e3,
2527                             vels[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :-1],
2528                             norm=norm, cmap=cm.vik, shading="flat")
2529        ax[0].set_yticks(self.fault.end_upper[0, [self.fault.n_locked, -1]] / 1e3)
2530        # add vertical lines for cycle breaks
2531        for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
2532            ax[0].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
2533        # make the y-axis increasing downwards to mimic depth even though we're plotting x1
2534        ax[0].invert_yaxis()
2535        # repeat for lower interface, if simulated
2536        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2537            c = ax[1].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2538                                 self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
2539                                 -vels[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, :-1],
2540                                 norm=norm, cmap=cm.vik, shading="flat")
2541            ax[1].set_yticks(self.fault.end_lower[0, [0, -1]] / 1e3)
2542            # add horizontal lines to show where the lower interface is below the locked zone
2543            ax[1].axhline(0, c="k", lw=1)
2544            ax[1].axhline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
2545            for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
2546                ax[1].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
2547            ax[1].invert_yaxis()
2548        # finish figure
2549        if self.fault.lower_rheo is None:
2550            ax[0].set_ylabel("Upper Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
2551            ax[0].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
2552        else:
2553            ax[0].set_ylabel("Upper Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
2554            ax[1].set_ylabel("Lower Interface\n$x_1$ [km]")
2555            ax[1].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
2556        fig.colorbar(c, ax=ax, location="right", orientation="vertical", fraction=0.05,
2557                     label="$v/v_{plate}$")
2558        fig.suptitle("Normalized Fault Patch Velocities")
2559        return fig, ax
2560
2561    def plot_fault_slip(self, full_state, deficit=True, include_locked=True, include_deep=True):
2562        """
2563        Plot the cumulative slip (deficit) for the fault patches.
2564
2565        Parameters
2566        ----------
2567        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2568            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2569        deficit : bool, optional
2570            If ``True`` (default), remove the plate velocity to plot slip deficit,
2571            otherwise keep it included.
2572        include_locked : bool, optional
2573            If ``True`` (default), also plot the slip on the locked patches.
2574        include_deep : bool, optional
2575            If ``True`` (default), also plot the slip on the semi-infinite patches
2576            at the end of the interfaces.
2577
2578        Returns
2579        -------
2580        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2581        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2582        """
2583        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2584        from matplotlib.colors import Normalize, SymLogNorm
2585        from cmcrameri import cm
2586        # extract slip
2587        slip = full_state[np.r_[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
2588                                self.fault.n_state_upper:
2589                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_creeping_lower], :]
2590        # check whether the simulation spun up, and NaN data needs to be skipped
2591        slip, t_sub, n_cyc_completed = self._reduce_full_state(slip)
2592        # normalize to slip per full cycle
2593        cum_slip_per_cycle = self.v_plate_eff * self.T_eff * 86400 * 365.25
2594        slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
2595        # add optional slip histories, if desired
2596        if include_locked:
2597            eq_df_joint = pd.DataFrame(
2598                index=(self.eq_df.index.values.reshape(1, -1)
2599                       + self.T_eff * np.arange(n_cyc_completed).reshape(-1, 1)
2600                       ).ravel(),
2601                data=np.tile(self.eq_df.values, (n_cyc_completed, 1)))
2602            locked_slip = eq_df_joint.cumsum(axis=0) \
2603                .reindex(index=t_sub, method="ffill", fill_value=0).values.T
2604            locked_slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
2605        if include_deep:
2606            deep_creep_slip = (np.tile(t_sub.reshape(1, -1), (3, 1))
2607                               * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)
2608                               * self.v_plate_eff * 86400 * 365.25)
2609            deep_creep_slip /= cum_slip_per_cycle
2610        # remove plate velocity to get slip deficit, if desired
2611        if deficit:
2612            cmap = cm.vik
2613            norm = SymLogNorm(linthresh=1e-2, vmin=-1, vmax=1)
2614            slip[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper] -= t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
2615            slip[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:] += t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
2616            slip -= slip[:, -2].reshape(-1, 1)
2617            if include_locked:
2618                locked_slip -= t_sub.reshape(1, -1) / self.T_eff
2619            if include_deep:
2620                deep_creep_slip -= (t_sub.reshape(1, -1)
2621                                    * np.array([1, -1, -1]).reshape(3, 1)) / self.T_eff
2622        else:
2623            norm = Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=n_cyc_completed)
2624            cmap = cm.batlow
2625        # normalize time
2626        t_sub /= self.T_eff
2627        # prepare figure
2628        nrows = (1 + int(self.fault.lower_rheo is not None)
2629                 + int(include_locked) + int(include_deep) * 3)
2630        hr_locked = ((self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked] - self.fault.end_upper[0, 0])
2631                     / (self.fault.end_lower[0, -1] - self.fault.end_lower[0, 0]))
2632        hr_lower = ((self.fault.end_lower[0, -1] - self.fault.end_lower[0, 0])
2633                    / (self.fault.end_upper[0, -1] - self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked]))
2634        hr = ([hr_locked] * int(include_locked) + [1]
2635              + [hr_locked, hr_locked] * int(include_deep)
2636              + [hr_lower] * int(self.fault.lower_rheo is not None)
2637              + [hr_locked] * int(include_deep))
2638        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=nrows, sharex=True, gridspec_kw={"height_ratios": hr},
2639                               figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
2640        iax = 0
2641        # plot locked
2642        if include_locked:
2643            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2644                                   self.fault.end_upper[0, :self.fault.n_locked + 1] / 1e3,
2645                                   locked_slip[:, :-1],
2646                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2647            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Locked\n$x_1$ [km]")
2648            temp_x1 = self.fault.end_upper[0, [0, self.fault.n_locked]] / 1e3
2649            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
2650            iax += 1
2651        # plot upper creeping
2652        c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2653                               self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked:] / 1e3,
2654                               slip[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :-1],
2655                               norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2656        ax[iax].set_ylabel("Creeping\n$x_1$ [km]")
2657        temp_x1 = self.fault.end_upper[0, [self.fault.n_locked, -1]] / 1e3
2658        ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
2659        iax += 1
2660        # plot end patch on upper interface
2661        if include_deep:
2662            temp_x1 = np.array([self.fault.end_upper[0, -1],
2663                                self.mid_deep_x1[0]]) / 1e3
2664            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2665                                   temp_x1,
2666                                   deep_creep_slip[0, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
2667                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2668            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
2669            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{temp_x1[0]:.0f}", "$-\\infty$"])
2670            iax += 1
2671        # plot left end patch on lower interface
2672        if include_deep:
2673            temp_x1 = np.array([self.mid_deep_x1[1],
2674                                self.fault.end_lower[0, 0]]) / 1e3
2675            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2676                                   temp_x1,
2677                                   -deep_creep_slip[1, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
2678                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2679            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
2680            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, ["$-\\infty$", f"{temp_x1[1]:.0f}"])
2681            iax += 1
2682        # plot lower creeping
2683        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2684            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2685                                   self.fault.end_lower[0, :] / 1e3,
2686                                   -slip[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, :-1],
2687                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2688            ax[iax].axhline(0, c="k", lw=1)
2689            ax[iax].axhline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
2690            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Creeping\n$x_1$ [km]")
2691            temp_x1 = self.fault.end_lower[0, [0, -1]] / 1e3
2692            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{x:.0f}" for x in temp_x1])
2693            iax += 1
2694        # plot right end patch on lower interface
2695        if include_deep:
2696            temp_x1 = np.array([self.fault.end_lower[0, -1],
2697                                self.mid_deep_x1[2]]) / 1e3
2698            c = ax[iax].pcolormesh(t_sub,
2699                                   temp_x1,
2700                                   -deep_creep_slip[2, :-1].reshape(1, -1),
2701                                   norm=norm, cmap=cmap, shading="flat")
2702            ax[iax].set_ylabel("Deep Creep\n$x_1$ [km]")
2703            ax[iax].set_yticks(temp_x1, [f"{temp_x1[0]:.0f}", "$-\\infty$"])
2704            iax += 1
2705        # finish figure
2706        for iax in range(len(ax)):
2707            for n in range(1, n_cyc_completed):
2708                ax[iax].axvline(n, c="k", lw=1)
2709            ax[iax].invert_yaxis()
2710        ax[-1].set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
2711        fig.colorbar(c, ax=ax, location="right", orientation="vertical", fraction=0.05,
2712                     label="$(s - t*v_{plate})/s_{full}$" if deficit else "$s/s_{full}$")
2713        suptitle = "Normalized Fault Patch Slip"
2714        if deficit:
2715            suptitle += " Deficit"
2716        fig.suptitle(suptitle)
2717        return fig, ax
2718
2719    def plot_eq_velocities(self, full_state):
2720        """
2721        Plot the before and after velocities on all creeping fault patches
2722        for each distinct earthquake.
2723
2724        Parameters
2725        ----------
2726        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2727            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2728
2729        Returns
2730        -------
2731        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2732        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2733        """
2734        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2735        # get indices of each last earthquake in last cycle
2736        temp = self.eq_df.astype(bool).drop_duplicates(keep="last")
2737        time_eq_last = temp.index.values + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
2738        tdiff = np.array([np.min(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last])
2739        if np.any(tdiff > 0):
2740            warn("Couldn't find exact indices, using time differences of "
2741                 f"{tdiff * 365.25 * 86400} seconds.")
2742        ix_eq_last = [np.argmin(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last]
2743        n_eq_found = len(ix_eq_last)
2744        assert n_eq_found == (self.Ds_0 > 0).sum(), \
2745            "Couldn't find indices of each last non-zero earthquake in the " \
2746            "last cycle, check for rounding errors."
2747        # calculate average slip for plotted earthquakes
2748        slip_last = self.eq_df.loc[temp.index, :]
2749        slip_avg = [slip_last.iloc[ieq, np.flatnonzero(temp.iloc[ieq, :])].mean()
2750                    for ieq in range(n_eq_found)]
2751        # extract velocities
2752        vels = full_state[np.r_[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:self.fault.n_state_upper,
2753                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_creeping_lower:
2754                                self.fault.n_state_upper + self.fault.n_state_lower],
2755                          :] / self.v_plate
2756        # prepare plot
2757        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=n_eq_found, ncols=1 if self.fault.lower_rheo is None else 2,
2758                               sharey=True, layout="constrained")
2759        ax = np.asarray(ax).reshape(n_eq_found, -1)
2760        # loop over earthquakes
2761        for irow, ieq in enumerate(ix_eq_last):
2762            # repeat plot for before and after
2763            for ioff, label in enumerate(["before", "after"]):
2764                ax[irow, 0].set_yscale("symlog", linthresh=1)
2765                ax[irow, 0].plot(self.fault.mid_x1_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
2766                                 vels[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, ieq - 1 + ioff],
2767                                 c=f"C{ioff}", label=label)
2768                if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2769                    ax[irow, 1].set_yscale("symlog", linthresh=1)
2770                    ax[irow, 1].plot(
2771                        self.fault.mid_x1_creeping[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:] / 1e3,
2772                        -vels[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, ieq - 1 + ioff],
2773                        c=f"C{ioff}", label=label)
2774        # finish plot
2775        for irow in range(n_eq_found):
2776            ax[irow, 0].set_title(f"Upper Interface: $s={slip_avg[irow]:.2g}$ m")
2777            ax[irow, 0].legend()
2778            ax[irow, 0].set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
2779            ax[irow, 0].set_ylabel("$v/v_{plate}$")
2780            if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2781                ax[irow, 1].set_title(f"Lower Interface: $s={slip_avg[irow]:.2g}$ m")
2782                ax[irow, 1].axvline(0, c="k", lw=1)
2783                ax[irow, 1].axvline(self.fault.x1_lock / 1e3, c="k", lw=1)
2784                ax[irow, 1].tick_params(labelleft=True)
2785                ax[irow, 1].legend()
2786                ax[irow, 1].set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
2787                ax[irow, 1].set_ylabel("$v/v_{plate}$")
2788        fig.suptitle("Normalized Earthquake Velocity Changes")
2789        return fig, ax
2790
2791    def plot_fault(self):
2792        """
2793        Plot the fault.
2794
2795        Returns
2796        -------
2797        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2798        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2799        """
2800        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2801        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 3), layout="constrained")
2802        ax.plot(self.fault.end_upper[0, :self.fault.n_locked + 1]/1e3,
2803                self.fault.end_upper[1, :self.fault.n_locked + 1]/1e3,
2804                marker="|", markeredgecolor="k",
2805                label="Locked")
2806        ax.plot(self.fault.end_upper[0, self.fault.n_locked:]/1e3,
2807                self.fault.end_upper[1, self.fault.n_locked:]/1e3,
2808                marker="|", markeredgecolor="k",
2809                label="Upper Creeping")
2810        ax.plot(self.fault.end_lower[0, :]/1e3,
2811                self.fault.end_lower[1, :]/1e3,
2812                marker="|", markeredgecolor="k",
2813                label="Lower Creeping")
2814        ax.plot(self.pts_surf / 1e3, np.zeros_like(self.pts_surf),
2815                "^", markeredgecolor="none", markerfacecolor="k",
2816                label="Observers")
2817        ax.axhline(0, lw=1, c="0.5", zorder=-1)
2818        ax.legend()
2819        ax.set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
2820        ax.set_ylabel("$x_2$ [km]")
2821        ax.set_title("Fault Mesh and Observer Locations")
2822        ax.set_aspect("equal")
2823        return fig, ax
2824
2825    def plot_slip_phases(self, full_state, post_inter_transition=0.01, normalize=True):
2826        """
2827        Plot the cumulative slip on the fault for the three different
2828        phases (coseismic, early postseismic, and interseismic).
2829
2830        Only works if there is a single earthquake in the sequence.
2831
2832        Parameters
2833        ----------
2834        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2835            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2836        post_inter_transition : float, optional
2837            Fraction of the recurrence time that should be considered
2838            early postseismic and not interseismic.
2839
2840        Returns
2841        -------
2842        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2843        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2844        """
2845        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2846        from scipy.interpolate import interp1d
2847        # check that the sequence only has one earthquake
2848        if not self.n_eq == 1:
2849            raise NotImplementedError("Don't know how to plot slip phases if "
2850                                      "multiple earthquakes are present in the sequence.")
2851        # get coseismic slip
2852        co = np.concatenate([self.eq_df.values.ravel(),
2853                             self.slip_taper.ravel()])
2854        # get index of last earthquake in last cycle
2855        time_eq_last = self.eq_df.index[0] + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
2856        ix_eq_last = (np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, time_eq_last))[0]
2857                      - self.ix_break_joint[-2])
2858        # reorganize interseismic slip
2859        slip = full_state[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, self.ix_break_joint[-2]:]
2860        slip_pre = slip[:, :ix_eq_last]
2861        slip_post = slip[:, ix_eq_last:]
2862        slip_pre += (slip_post[:, -1] - slip_pre[:, 0]).reshape(-1, 1)
2863        slip_joint = np.hstack([slip_post, slip_pre])
2864        slip_joint -= slip_joint[:, 0].reshape(-1, 1)
2865        # same for time
2866        t_last = self.t_eval_joint[self.ix_break_joint[-2]:].copy()
2867        t_last_pre = t_last[:ix_eq_last]
2868        t_last_post = t_last[ix_eq_last:]
2869        t_last_pre += t_last_post[-1] - t_last_pre[0]
2870        t_last_joint = np.concatenate([t_last_post, t_last_pre])
2871        t_last_joint -= t_last_joint[0]
2872        # since slip_joint is now already cumulative slip since the earthquake,
2873        # with the tapered slip removed, we can just read out the early
2874        # postseismic and rest interseismic cumulative slip distributions
2875        post = interp1d(t_last_joint, slip_joint)(post_inter_transition * self.T_eff)
2876        inter = slip_joint[:, -1] - post
2877        post = np.concatenate([np.zeros(self.fault.n_locked), post])
2878        inter = np.concatenate([np.zeros(self.fault.n_locked), inter])
2879        # optionally, normalize by total expected cumulative slip over the entire cycle
2880        if normalize:
2881            total_slip = self.T_eff * self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25
2882            co /= total_slip
2883            post /= total_slip
2884            inter /= total_slip
2885        # make figure
2886        fig, ax = plt.subplots(layout="constrained")
2887        ax.plot(self.fault.mid_x1[:self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, co, label="Coseismic")
2888        ax.plot(self.fault.mid_x1[:self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, post, label="Postseismic")
2889        ax.plot(self.fault.mid_x1[:self.fault.n_upper] / 1e3, inter, label="Interseismic")
2890        ax.legend()
2891        ax.set_xlabel("$x_1$ [km]")
2892        ax.set_ylabel("Normalized cumulative slip [-]" if normalize
2893                      else "Cumulative Slip [m]")
2894        ax.set_title("Slip Phases (Post-/Interseismic cutoff at "
2895                     f"{post_inter_transition:.1%} " "$T_{rec}$)")
2896        return fig, ax
2897
2898    def plot_viscosity(self, full_state, return_viscosities=False):
2899        """
2900        Plot the viscosity structure with depth for the steady state, as well as
2901        for the immediate pre- and coseismic velocities.
2902
2903        For multiple earthquakes, it will use the minimum preseismic and maximum
2904        postseismic velocities.
2905
2906        Parameters
2907        ----------
2908        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2909            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2910        return_viscosities : bool, optional
2911            Also return the preseismic, steady-state, and postseismic viscosities.
2912
2913        Returns
2914        -------
2915        matplotlib.figure.Figure
2916        matplotlib.axes.Axes
2917        """
2918        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
2919        # get indices of each last earthquake in last cycle
2920        temp = self.eq_df.astype(bool).drop_duplicates(keep="last")
2921        time_eq_last = temp.index.values + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
2922        tdiff = np.array([np.min(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last])
2923        if np.any(tdiff > 0):
2924            warn("Couldn't find exact indices, using time differences of "
2925                 f"{tdiff * 365.25 * 86400} seconds.")
2926        ix_eq_last = [np.argmin(np.abs(self.t_eval_joint - tlast)) for tlast in time_eq_last]
2927        n_eq_found = len(ix_eq_last)
2928        assert n_eq_found == (self.Ds_0 > 0).sum(), \
2929            "Couldn't find indices of each last non-zero earthquake in the " \
2930            "last cycle, check for rounding errors."
2931        # calculate average slip for plotted earthquakes
2932        slip_last = self.eq_df.loc[temp.index, :]
2933        slip_avg = [slip_last.iloc[ieq, np.flatnonzero(temp.iloc[ieq, :])].mean()
2934                    for ieq in range(n_eq_found)]
2935        # extract preseismic velocities
2936        vels_pre = np.array([full_state[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:self.fault.n_state_upper,
2937                                        ix - 1] for ix in ix_eq_last]).T
2938        vels_post = np.array([full_state[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:self.fault.n_state_upper,
2939                                         ix] for ix in ix_eq_last]).T
2940        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2941            # calculate viscosity profiles
2942            vis_pre = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
2943                                                         self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
2944                                                         vels_pre)
2945            vis_ss = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(self.alpha_n_vec,
2946                                                        self.n_vec,
2947                                                        self.v_plate_eff)
2948            vis_post = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
2949                                                          self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
2950                                                          vels_post)
2951        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2952            vis_pre = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
2953                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels_pre)
2954            vis_ss = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
2955                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1),  self.v_plate_eff)
2956            vis_post = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
2957                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1),  vels_post)
2958        else:
2959            raise NotImplementedError()
2960        vis_mins = 10**np.floor(np.log10(np.ma.masked_invalid(vis_post*0.999).min(axis=0)))
2961        vis_maxs = 10**np.ceil(np.log10(np.ma.masked_invalid(vis_pre*1.001).max(axis=0)))
2962        # make plot
2963        fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=n_eq_found, sharey=True, layout="constrained")
2964        ax = np.atleast_1d(ax)
2965        ax[0].set_ylabel("$x_2$ [km]")
2966        for i in range(n_eq_found):
2967            ax[i].fill_betweenx([0, self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[1] / 1e3],
2968                                vis_mins[i], vis_maxs[i], facecolor="0.8", label="Locked")
2969            ax[i].fill_betweenx(self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
2970                                vis_pre[:, i], vis_post[:, i], alpha=0.5, label="Simulated")
2971            ax[i].plot(vis_ss,
2972                       self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper] / 1e3,
2973                       label="Plate Rate")
2974            ax[i].set_xscale("log")
2975            ax[i].legend(loc="lower left")
2976            ax[i].set_ylim(self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[self.fault.n_creeping_upper - 1] / 1e3,
2977                           0)
2978            ax[i].set_xlim(vis_mins[i], vis_maxs[i])
2979            ax[i].set_title(f"$s={slip_avg[i]:.2g}$ m")
2980            ax[i].set_xlabel(r"$\alpha_{eff}$ [Pa * s/m]")
2981        # finish
2982        if return_viscosities:
2983            return fig, ax, vis_pre, vis_ss, vis_post
2984        else:
2985            return fig, ax
2986
2987    def plot_viscosity_timeseries(self, full_state, return_viscosities=False):
2988        """
2989        Plot the viscosity timeseries with depth for the entire last cycle.
2990
2991        Parameters
2992        ----------
2993        full_state : numpy.ndarray
2994            State matrix as output from :meth:`~run`.
2995        return_viscosities : bool, optional
2996            Also return the viscosity timeseries.
2997
2998        Returns
2999        -------
3000        matplotlib.figure.Figure
3001        matplotlib.axes.Axes
3002        """
3003        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3004        from matplotlib.colors import LogNorm
3005        from cmcrameri import cm
3006        # check that the sequence only has one earthquake
3007        if not self.n_eq == 1:
3008            raise NotImplementedError("Don't know how to plot viscosity timeseries if "
3009                                      "multiple earthquakes are present in the sequence.")
3010        # get index of last earthquake in last cycle
3011        time_eq_last = self.eq_df.index[0] + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3012        ix_eq_last = (np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, time_eq_last))[0]
3013                      - self.ix_break_joint[-2])
3014        # reorganize interseismic velocities
3015        vels = full_state[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:2*self.fault.n_creeping_upper,
3016                          self.ix_break_joint[-2]:]
3017        vels_pre = vels[:, :ix_eq_last]
3018        vels_post = vels[:, ix_eq_last:]
3019        vels = np.hstack([vels_post, vels_pre])
3020        # same for time
3021        t_last = self.t_eval_joint[self.ix_break_joint[-2]:].copy()
3022        t_last_pre = t_last[:ix_eq_last]
3023        t_last_post = t_last[ix_eq_last:]
3024        t_last_pre += t_last_post[-1] - t_last_pre[0]
3025        t_last_joint = np.concatenate([t_last_post, t_last_pre])
3026        t_last_joint -= t_last_joint[0]
3027        # convert velocities to effective viscosity
3028        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
3029            vis_ts = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff(self.alpha_n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
3030                                                        self.n_vec.reshape(-1, 1),
3031                                                        vels)
3032        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
3033            vis_ts = SubductionSimulation.get_alpha_eff_from_alpha_h(
3034                self.alpha_h_vec.reshape(-1, 1), vels)
3035        else:
3036            raise NotImplementedError()
3037        # get index of deep transition
3038        patch_depths = -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
3039        ix_deep = np.argmin(np.abs(patch_depths - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition))
3040        # subset vels to skip zero-velocity uppermost patch
3041        vis_ts = vis_ts[1:, :]
3042        # get percentage of final viscosity
3043        rel_vis = vis_ts / vis_ts[:, -1][:, None]
3044        rel_vis_masked = np.ma.MaskedArray(rel_vis, np.diff(rel_vis, axis=1,
3045                                           prepend=rel_vis[:, 0][:, None]
3046                                           ) <= 0).filled(np.NaN)
3047        levels = [0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8]
3048        rel_vis_iquant = np.concatenate([np.nanargmax(rel_vis_masked > lvl, axis=1, keepdims=True)
3049                                        for lvl in levels], axis=1)
3050        # normalize time
3051        t_sub = t_last_joint / self.T_eff
3052        # prepare plot
3053        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5), layout="constrained")
3054        # plot velocities
3055        c = ax.pcolormesh(
3056            t_sub,
3057            np.abs(self.fault.end_upper[1, self.fault.n_locked+1:self.fault.n_locked+ix_deep+1]
3058                   / 1e3),
3059            vis_ts[:ix_deep-1, :-1],
3060            norm=LogNorm(vmin=10**np.floor(np.log10(np.median(vis_ts[:ix_deep-1, 0]))),
3061                         vmax=10**np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(vis_ts[:ix_deep-1, -1])))),
3062            cmap=cm.batlow, shading="flat")
3063        for i in range(len(levels)):
3064            ax.plot(t_sub[rel_vis_iquant[:ix_deep-1, i]],
3065                    patch_depths[1:ix_deep] / 1e3,
3066                    color="w")
3067        ax.set_xscale("symlog", linthresh=1e-3)
3068        ax.set_xlim([0, 1])
3069        # make the y-axis increasing downwards to mimic depth even though we're plotting x1
3070        ax.invert_yaxis()
3071        # finish figure
3072        ax.set_ylabel("Depth $x_2$ [km]")
3073        ax.set_xlabel("Normalized Time $t/T$")
3074        fig.colorbar(c, ax=ax, location="right", orientation="vertical", fraction=0.05,
3075                     label=r"$\alpha_{eff}$")
3076        fig.suptitle("Effective Viscosity Timeseries")
3077        # finish
3078        if return_viscosities:
3079            return fig, ax, t_sub, vis_ts
3080        else:
3081            return fig, ax

Subduction simulation container class.

SubductionSimulation( v_plate, n_cycles_max, n_samples_per_eq, delta_tau_max, v_max, fault, Ds_0, Ds_0_logsigma, T_rec, T_rec_logsigma, D_asp_min, D_asp_max, T_anchor, T_last, enforce_v_plate, largehalflen, t_obs, pts_surf) 
1693    def __init__(self, v_plate, n_cycles_max, n_samples_per_eq, delta_tau_max, v_max,
1694                 fault, Ds_0, Ds_0_logsigma, T_rec, T_rec_logsigma, D_asp_min,
1695                 D_asp_max, T_anchor, T_last, enforce_v_plate, largehalflen,
1696                 t_obs, pts_surf):
1697        """
1698        Create a subduction simulation.
1699
1700        Parameters
1701        ----------
1702        v_plate : float
1703            Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology
1704        n_cycles_max : int
1705            Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
1706        n_samples_per_eq : int
1707            Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
1708        delta_tau_max : float
1709            Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches
1710        v_max : float
1711            Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches
1712        fault : Fault2D
1713            Fault object
1714        Ds_0 : numpy.ndarray
1715            Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es)
1716        Ds_0_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
1717            Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space
1718        T_rec : numpy.ndarray
1719            Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake
1720        T_rec_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
1721            Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
1722        D_asp_min : numpy.ndarray
1723            Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
1724        D_asp_max : numpy.ndarray
1725            Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
1726        T_anchor : str
1727            Anchor date where observations end
1728        T_last : list
1729            Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
1730        enforce_v_plate : bool
1731            Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not
1732        largehalflen : float
1733            Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m]
1734        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
1735            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
1736            or as Timestamps
1737        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
1738            Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
1739        """
1740
1741        # save general sequence & fault parameters
1742        self.v_plate = float(v_plate)
1743        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology """
1744        self.n_cycles_max = int(n_cycles_max)
1745        """ Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-] """
1746        self.n_samples_per_eq = int(n_samples_per_eq)
1747        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-] """
1748        self.delta_tau_max = float(delta_tau_max)
1749        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches """
1750        self.v_max = float(v_max)
1751        """ Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches """
1752
1753        # define fault
1754        assert isinstance(fault, Fault2D)
1755        if not (isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or
1756                isinstance(fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic)) or \
1757           not (isinstance(fault.lower_rheo, NonlinearViscous) or
1758                (fault.lower_rheo is None)):
1759            raise NotImplementedError("SubductionSimulation is only implemented for "
1760                                      "NonlinearViscous or RateStateSteadyLogarithmic "
1761                                      "rheologies in the upper interface, and NonlinearViscous "
1762                                      "rheology in the lower interface.")
1763        self.fault = fault
1764        """ Fault object """
1765
1766        # cast earthquake slips as NumPy array
1767        self.Ds_0 = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0)
1768        """ Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es) """
1769        self.Ds_0_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(Ds_0_logsigma)
1770        """ Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space """
1771        # load recurrence times
1772        self.T_rec = np.atleast_1d(T_rec)
1773        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake """
1774        self.T_rec_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(T_rec_logsigma)
1775        """ Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space """
1776        # load the minimum and maximum depths of the earthquakes
1777        self.D_asp_min = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_min)
1778        """ Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
1779        self.D_asp_max = np.atleast_1d(D_asp_max)
1780        """ Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake """
1781        assert all([D <= self.fault.D_lock for D in self.D_asp_max]), \
1782            f"Asperity depths {self.D_asp_max/1e3} km are deeper than the " \
1783            f"locking depth {self.fault.D_lock/1e3}."
1784        self.T_anchor = str(T_anchor)
1785        """ Anchor date where observations end """
1786        assert isinstance(T_last, list) and all([isinstance(tl, str) for tl in T_last])
1787        self.T_last = T_last
1788        """ Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake """
1789        # create a NumPy array that for each locked asperity has the slip per earthquake
1790        self.slip_mask = np.logical_and(self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1)
1791                                        < -self.D_asp_min.reshape(1, -1),
1792                                        self.fault.mid_x2_locked.reshape(-1, 1)
1793                                        > -self.D_asp_max.reshape(1, -1))
1794        """ Mask that matches each earthquake to a fault patch """
1795        self.T_fullcycle = np.lcm.reduce(self.T_rec)
1796        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle """
1797        self.n_eq = self.Ds_0.size
1798        """ Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence """
1799        self.n_eq_per_asp = (self.T_fullcycle / self.T_rec).astype(int)
1800        """ Number of earthquakes per asperity and full cycle """
1801
1802        # create realization of the slip amount and earthquake timings
1803        rng = np.random.default_rng()
1804        # first, create realizations of occurence times
1805        # note that this will result in a varying plate velocity rate
1806        # (ignore zero-slip earthquakes)
1807        self.T_rec_per_asp = [rng.lognormal(np.log(t), s, n) for t, s, n in
1808                              zip(self.T_rec, self.T_rec_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)]
1809        """ Recurrence time [a] realization """
1810        self.Ds_0_per_asp = [rng.lognormal(np.log(d), s, n) if d > 0
1811                             else np.array([d] * n) for d, s, n in
1812                             zip(self.Ds_0, self.Ds_0_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_asp)]
1813        """ Fault slip [m] realization """
1814
1815        # sanity check that in each asperity, the nominal plate rate is recovered
1816        self.slip_asperities = self.slip_mask.astype(int) * self.Ds_0.reshape(1, -1)
1817        """ Slip [m] for each earthquake in each asperity """
1818        v_eff_in_asp = (self.slip_asperities / self.T_rec.reshape(1, -1)).sum(axis=1)
1819        assert np.allclose(v_eff_in_asp, self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25), \
1820            "The nominal plate rate is not recovered in all asperities.\n" \
1821            f"Plate velocity = {self.v_plate * 86400 * 365.25}\n" \
1822            f"Effective velocity in each asperity:\n{v_eff_in_asp}"
1823
1824        # second, we need to shift the random realization for each earthquake
1825        # individually such that they all yield the same v_plate (enforced or not)
1826        # get the effective recurrence time as implied by the T_rec realizations
1827        T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(t) for t in self.T_rec_per_asp])
1828        # same for the effective cumulative slip
1829        Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff = np.array([sum(d) for d in self.Ds_0_per_asp])
1830        # we need to scale each individual sequence such that it implies the same
1831        # recurrence time and cumulative slip in each asperity
1832        # (again ignoring zero-slip earthquakes)
1833        T_fullcycle_eff_mean = np.mean(T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff)
1834        Ds_0_fullcycle_mean = np.ma.masked_equal(Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff, 0).mean()
1835        T_rec_per_asp_adj = [np.array(self.T_rec_per_asp[i]) * T_fullcycle_eff_mean
1836                             / T_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i] for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1837        Ds_0_per_asp_adj = [np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i]) * Ds_0_fullcycle_mean
1838                            / Ds_0_fullcycle_per_asp_eff[i] if self.Ds_0[i] > 0
1839                            else np.array(self.Ds_0_per_asp[i]) for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1840        # now each asperity has the same effective plate velocity, which can be different
1841        # from the nominal one - if we want to enforce the nominal plate velocity,
1842        # we can rescale the recurrence times again
1843        self.enforce_v_plate = bool(enforce_v_plate)
1844        """ Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not """
1845        ix_nonzero_slip = np.argmax(self.Ds_0 > 0)
1846        v_plate_eff = (sum(Ds_0_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip])
1847                       / sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[ix_nonzero_slip]) / 86400 / 365.25)
1848        if self.enforce_v_plate:
1849            v_plate_factor = self.v_plate / v_plate_eff
1850            for i in range(self.n_eq):
1851                T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] /= v_plate_factor
1852            v_plate_eff = self.v_plate
1853        self.v_plate_eff = v_plate_eff
1854        """ Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s] """
1855        self.T_eff = sum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[0])
1856        """ Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence """
1857
1858        # third, we need to create a list of earthquake dates and associated slips
1859        temp_slips = np.vstack([self.slip_mask[:, i].reshape(1, -1)
1860                                * Ds_0_per_asp_adj[i].reshape(-1, 1)
1861                                for i in range(self.n_eq)])
1862        year_offsets = [(pd.Period(self.T_anchor, "D") - pd.Period(self.T_last[i], "D")
1863                         ).n / 365.25 for i in range(self.n_eq)]
1864        eq_df_index = np.concatenate(
1865            [self.T_eff -
1866             (np.cumsum(T_rec_per_asp_adj[i]) - T_rec_per_asp_adj[i] + year_offsets[i])
1867             for i in range(self.n_eq)])
1868        # round the dates to the closest day and combine earthquakes
1869        eq_df_index_rounded = np.around(eq_df_index * 365.25) / 365.25
1870        # build a DataFrame with exact and rounded times
1871        eq_df = pd.DataFrame(data=temp_slips)
1872        eq_df["time"] = eq_df_index
1873        eq_df["rounded"] = eq_df_index_rounded
1874        # now aggregate by rounded time, keeping the minimum exact time, and summing slip
1875        agg_dict = {"time": "min"}
1876        agg_dict.update({c: "sum" for c in range(self.fault.n_locked)})
1877        eq_df = eq_df.groupby("rounded").agg(agg_dict)
1878        # convert time column to index and sort
1879        eq_df.set_index("time", inplace=True)
1880        eq_df.sort_index(inplace=True)
1881        assert np.allclose(eq_df.sum(axis=0), eq_df.sum(axis=0)[0])
1882        self.eq_df = eq_df
1883        """
1884        DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m]
1885        for each asperity
1886        """
1887
1888        # fourth, we need to create a list of dates to use internally when evaluating
1889        # the earthquake cycle - this is independent of the observation dates
1890        i_frac_cumsum = np.concatenate([[self.eq_df.index[-1] - self.T_eff],
1891                                        self.eq_df.index.values])
1892        T_frac = np.diff(i_frac_cumsum)
1893        t_eval = np.concatenate(
1894            [np.logspace(0, np.log10(1 + T_frac[i]), self.n_samples_per_eq, endpoint=False)
1895             - 1 + i_frac_cumsum[i] + j*self.T_eff
1896             for j in range(self.n_cycles_max) for i, t in enumerate(T_frac)])
1897        num_neg = (t_eval < 0).sum()
1898        t_eval = np.roll(t_eval, -num_neg)
1899        t_eval[-num_neg:] += self.n_cycles_max * self.T_eff
1900        self.t_eval = np.sort(np.concatenate(
1901            [t_eval, np.arange(self.n_cycles_max + 1) * self.T_eff]))
1902        """ Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
1903        self.n_eval = self.t_eval.size
1904        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-] """
1905
1906        # fifth, for the integration, we need the indices of the timesteps that mark either
1907        # an earthquake or the start of a new cycle
1908        self.n_slips = self.eq_df.shape[0]
1909        """ Number of slips in a sequence [-] """
1910        self.ix_break = [i*(self.n_slips * self.n_samples_per_eq + 1)
1911                         for i in range(self.n_cycles_max + 1)]
1912        """ Indices of breaks between cycles """
1913        self.ix_eq = [self.ix_break[i] + j * self.n_samples_per_eq - num_neg + 1
1914                      for i in range(self.n_cycles_max) for j in range(1, 1 + self.n_slips)]
1915        """ Indices of earthquakes """
1916
1917        # sixth and last, for the final loop, we need a joint timesteps array between internal
1918        # and external (observation) timestamps, such that we can debug, check early stopping,
1919        # and restrict the output to the requested timeseries
1920        if isinstance(t_obs, pd.DatetimeIndex):
1921            t_obs = self.T_eff + (t_obs - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor)
1922                                  ).total_seconds().values / 86400 / 365.25
1923        elif isinstance(t_obs, np.ndarray):
1924            if np.all(t_obs < 0):
1925                # this format is relative to T_anchor and more stable when T_eff varies
1926                t_obs = self.T_eff + t_obs
1927            assert np.all(t_obs >= 0) and np.all(t_obs < self.T_eff), \
1928                f"Range of 't_obs' ({t_obs.min()}-{t_obs.max():} years) outside of " \
1929                f"the earthquake cycle period ({self.T_eff:} years)."
1930        else:
1931            raise ValueError("Unknown 't_obs' data type.")
1932        self.t_obs = t_obs
1933        """ Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
1934        # combine all possible timesteps
1935        t_obs_shifted = self.t_obs + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
1936        self.t_eval_joint = np.unique(np.concatenate((self.t_eval, t_obs_shifted)))
1937        """
1938        Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps
1939        [decimal years since cycle start]
1940        """
1941        # get indices of each individual subset in the new timesteps array
1942        self.ix_break_joint = \
1943            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_break]))
1944        """ Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps """
1945        self.ix_eq_joint = \
1946            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, self.t_eval[self.ix_eq]))
1947        """ Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps """
1948        self.ix_obs_joint = \
1949            np.flatnonzero(np.isin(self.t_eval_joint, t_obs_shifted))
1950        """ Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps """
1951
1952        # get vectors of upper plate rheology parameters
1953        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1954            # alpha_h
1955            self.alpha_h_vec = \
1956                self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
1957                    -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper])
1958            r""" Depth-variable :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] of upper plate interface """
1959        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
1960            # A, alpha_n, and n
1961            alpha_n_vec, n_vec, A_vec = \
1962                self.fault.upper_rheo.get_param_vectors(
1963                    -self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper], self.v_plate)
1964            self.alpha_n_vec = alpha_n_vec
1965            r""" Depth-variable :math:`\alpha_n` [Pa^n * s/m] of upper plate interface """
1966            self.n_vec = n_vec
1967            r""" Depth-variable :math:`n` [-] of upper plate interface """
1968            self.A_vec = A_vec
1969            r""" Depth-variable :math:`A ` [Pa * (s/m)^(1/n)] of upper plate interface """
1970        else:
1971            raise NotImplementedError
1972
1973        # get unbounded delta_tau
1974        self.delta_tau_unbounded = self.fault.K_ext @ self.eq_df.values.T
1975        """ Unbounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
1976        # get pseudoinverse of K_int for tapered slip
1977        self.K_int_inv_upper = np.linalg.pinv(
1978            self.fault.K_int[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :self.fault.n_creeping_upper])
1979        """ Inverse of K_int [m/Pa] """
1980        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower = \
1981            ((self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_max)**(1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n) -
1982             (self.fault.lower_rheo.alpha_n * self.v_plate)**(1 / self.fault.lower_rheo.n)
1983             if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None else np.inf)
1984        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in lower plate from capped velocity """
1985        if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
1986            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = \
1987                (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_max)**(1 / self.n_vec) - \
1988                (self.alpha_n_vec * self.v_plate)**(1 / self.n_vec)
1989        elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
1990            delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = self.alpha_h_vec * \
1991                (np.log(self.v_max / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0) -
1992                 np.log(self.v_plate / self.fault.upper_rheo.v_0))
1993        self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper = delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper
1994        """ Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in upper plate from capped velocity """
1995        self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper = np.fmin(self.delta_tau_max,
1996                                                 self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper)
1997        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in upper plate """
1998        self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower = \
1999            (min(self.delta_tau_max, self.delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower)
2000             if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None else np.inf)
2001        """ Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in lower plate """
2002        # create tapered slip by making delta_tau linearly increase until delta_tau_max
2003        delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_unbounded.copy()
2004        delta_tau_bounded[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :] = \
2005            np.fmin(self.delta_tau_max_joint_upper.reshape(-1, 1),
2006                    self.delta_tau_unbounded[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :])
2007        self.delta_tau_bounded = delta_tau_bounded
2008        """ Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa] """
2009        # get the additional slip
2010        self.slip_taper = (self.K_int_inv_upper @
2011                           (self.delta_tau_bounded - self.delta_tau_unbounded
2012                            )[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper, :])
2013        # check if the lower plate should have been bounded as well
2014        if self.fault.lower_rheo is not None:
2015            assert not np.any(np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:, :])
2016                              > self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower), \
2017                ("Maximum stress change delta_tau_bounded "
2018                 f"{np.max(np.abs(self.delta_tau_bounded)):.2e} Pa in lower interface "
2019                 f"above delta_tau_max = {self.delta_tau_max_joint_lower:.2e} Pa")
2020        self.slip_taper_ts = \
2021            pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=self.slip_taper.T) \
2022            .cumsum(axis=0).reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
2023        """ Timeseries of tapered slip [m] on the upper creeping fault patches """
2024
2025        # need the imagined location and orientation of the deep creep patches
2026        self.largehalflen = float(largehalflen)
2027        """ Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m] """
2028        self.mid_deep_x1 = \
2029            np.array([self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2030                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2031                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2032                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2033                      * self.largehalflen,
2034                      self.fault.mid_x1[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1]
2035                      - self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1]
2036                      - self.largehalflen,
2037                      self.fault.mid_x1[-1]
2038                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2039                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2040                      + np.cos(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2041                      * self.largehalflen])
2042        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2043        self.mid_deep_x2 = \
2044            np.array([self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2045                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2046                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1]
2047                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1])
2048                      * self.largehalflen,
2049                      self.fault.mid_x2[self.fault.n_upper + self.fault.n_lower_left - 1],
2050                      self.fault.mid_x2[-1]
2051                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2052                      * self.fault.halflen_vec[-1]
2053                      - np.sin(self.fault.theta_vec[-1] - np.pi)
2054                      * self.largehalflen])
2055        """ :math:`x_2` coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m] """
2056        self.theta_vec_deep = \
2057            np.array([self.fault.theta_vec[self.fault.n_upper - 1],
2058                      np.pi,
2059                      self.fault.theta_vec[-1]])
2060        """ Plate dip angle [rad] for deep creep fault patches """
2061
2062        # create the Green's matrices
2063        self.pts_surf = pts_surf
2064        """ :math:`x_1` coordinates of surface observation points [m] """
2065        self.n_stations = self.pts_surf.size
2066        """ Number of surface observing stations """
2067        self.G_surf_fault = Glinedisp(
2068            self.pts_surf, 0, self.fault.mid_x1, self.fault.mid_x2,
2069            self.fault.halflen_vec, self.fault.theta_vec, self.fault.nu
2070            )[:, :self.fault.mid_x1.size]
2071        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the main fault patches to surface motion """
2072        self.G_surf_deep = Glinedisp(
2073            self.pts_surf, 0, self.mid_deep_x1, self.mid_deep_x2,
2074            self.largehalflen, self.theta_vec_deep, self.fault.nu)[:, :3]
2075        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the deep creep patches to surface motion """
2076        self.G_surf = np.hstack([self.G_surf_fault, self.G_surf_deep])
2077        """ Joint Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the entire ESPM to surface motion """
2078
2079        # calculate the best initial velocity state from the steady state ODE
2080        v_plate_vec = np.ones(self.fault.n_creeping) * self.v_plate
2081        v_plate_vec[self.fault.n_creeping_upper:] *= -1
2082        self.v_plate_vec = v_plate_vec
2083        """ Vector with the plate velocity for each creeping patch [m/s] """
2084        # get the initial velocity, taking advantage of the option that there could be a
2085        # deep transition zone
2086        v_init = v_plate_vec.copy()
2087        if self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition is not None:
2088            ix_deep = np.argmin(np.abs(-self.fault.mid_x2_creeping[:self.fault.n_creeping_upper]
2089                                       - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition
2090                                       - self.fault.upper_rheo.deep_transition_width))
2091            if isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic):
2092                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(self.v_plate * 1e-6, self.v_plate,
2093                                               num=ix_deep, endpoint=False)
2094            elif isinstance(self.fault.upper_rheo, NonlinearViscous):
2095                v_init[:ix_deep] = np.linspace(0, self.v_plate, num=ix_deep, endpoint=False)
2096        self.v_init = v_init
2097        """ Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s] """

Create a subduction simulation.

Parameters
  • v_plate (float): Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • n_cycles_max (int): Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
  • n_samples_per_eq (int): Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
  • delta_tau_max (float): Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches
  • v_max (float): Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches
  • fault (Fault2D): Fault object
  • Ds_0 (numpy.ndarray): Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es)
  • Ds_0_logsigma (numpy.ndarray): Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space
  • T_rec (numpy.ndarray): Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake
  • T_rec_logsigma (numpy.ndarray): Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
  • D_asp_min (numpy.ndarray): Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
  • D_asp_max (numpy.ndarray): Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake
  • T_anchor (str): Anchor date where observations end
  • T_last (list): Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
  • enforce_v_plate (bool): Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not
  • largehalflen (float): Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m]
  • t_obs (numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex): Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start, or as Timestamps
  • pts_surf (numpy.ndarray): Horizontal landward observation coordinates [m] relative to the trench
v_plate

Nominal far-field plate velocity, in the dimensions of the rheology

n_cycles_max

Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]

n_samples_per_eq

Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]

delta_tau_max

Maximum shear stress change [Pa] from coseismic slip on locked patches

v_max

Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches

fault

Fault object

Ds_0

Nominal coseismic left-lateral shearing [m] of the locked fault patch(es)

Ds_0_logsigma

Standard deviation of the fault slip in logarithmic space

T_rec

Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake

T_rec_logsigma

Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space

D_asp_min

Minimum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake

D_asp_max

Maximum depth [m] for the asperities of each earthquake

T_anchor

Anchor date where observations end

T_last

Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake

slip_mask

Mask that matches each earthquake to a fault patch

T_fullcycle

Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle

n_eq

Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence

n_eq_per_asp

Number of earthquakes per asperity and full cycle

T_rec_per_asp

Recurrence time [a] realization

Ds_0_per_asp

Fault slip [m] realization

slip_asperities

Slip [m] for each earthquake in each asperity

enforce_v_plate

Flag whether to allow v_plate to vary or not

v_plate_eff

Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s]

T_eff

Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence

eq_df

DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m] for each asperity

t_eval

Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start]

n_eval

Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-]

n_slips

Number of slips in a sequence [-]

ix_break

Indices of breaks between cycles

ix_eq

Indices of earthquakes

t_obs

Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start]

t_eval_joint

Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start]

ix_break_joint

Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps

ix_eq_joint

Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps

ix_obs_joint

Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps

delta_tau_unbounded

Unbounded coseismic stress change [Pa]

K_int_inv_upper

Inverse of K_int [m/Pa]

delta_tau_max_from_v_max_lower

Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in lower plate from capped velocity

delta_tau_max_from_v_max_upper

Maximum shear stress change [Pa] in upper plate from capped velocity

delta_tau_max_joint_upper

Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in upper plate

delta_tau_max_joint_lower

Joint maximum shear stress change [Pa] allowed in lower plate

delta_tau_bounded

Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]

slip_taper
slip_taper_ts

Timeseries of tapered slip [m] on the upper creeping fault patches

largehalflen

Fault patch half-length of the deep crreep patches [m]

mid_deep_x1

\( x_1 \) coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m]

mid_deep_x2

\( x_2 \) coordinates of deep creep fault patch midpoints [m]

theta_vec_deep

Plate dip angle [rad] for deep creep fault patches

pts_surf

\( x_1 \) coordinates of surface observation points [m]

n_stations

Number of surface observing stations

G_surf_fault

Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the main fault patches to surface motion

G_surf_deep

Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the deep creep patches to surface motion

G_surf

Joint Green's matrix [-] relating slip on the entire ESPM to surface motion

v_plate_vec

Vector with the plate velocity for each creeping patch [m/s]

v_init

Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s]

locked_slip

Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches for observation timespan

deep_creep_slip

Timeseries of slip [m] on the deep creep patches for observation timestamps

@staticmethod
def read_config_file(config_file): 
2112    @staticmethod
2113    def read_config_file(config_file):
2114        """
2115        Read a configuration file and return it as a parsed dictionary.
2116
2117        Parameters
2118        ----------
2119        config_file : str
2120            Path to INI configuration file.
2121
2122        Returns
2123        -------
2124        cfg_dict : dict
2125            Parsed configuration file.
2126        """
2127
2128        # load configuration file
2129        cfg = configparser.ConfigParser()
2130        cfg.optionxform = str
2131        with open(config_file, mode="rt") as f:
2132            cfg.read_file(f)
2133        cfg_seq, cfg_fault, cfg_mesh = cfg["sequence"], cfg["fault"], cfg["mesh"]
2134
2135        # parse rheologies
2136        upper_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["upper_rheo"])
2137        upper_rheo_type = upper_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2138        upper_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in upper_rheo_dict.items()}
2139        try:
2140            lower_rheo_dict = dict(cfg["lower_rheo"])
2141        except KeyError:
2142            lower_rheo_type = None
2143            lower_rheo_kw_args = None
2144        else:
2145            lower_rheo_type = lower_rheo_dict.pop("type")
2146            lower_rheo_kw_args = {k: float(v) for k, v in lower_rheo_dict.items()}
2147
2148        # parse everything else
2149        cfg_dict = {
2150            "theta": np.deg2rad(cfg_fault.getfloat("theta_deg")),
2151            "D_lock": cfg_fault.getfloat("D_lock"),
2152            "H": cfg_fault.getfloat("H"),
2153            "nu": cfg_fault.getfloat("nu"),
2154            "E": cfg_fault.getfloat("E"),
2155            "v_s": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_s"),
2156            "halflen": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen"),
2157            "n_upper": cfg_mesh.getint("n_up"),
2158            "n_lower_left": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_l"),
2159            "n_lower_right": cfg_mesh.getint("n_low_r"),
2160            "halflen_factor_lower": cfg_mesh.getfloat("halflen_factor_lower"),
2161            "D_max": cfg_mesh.getfloat("D_max", fallback=None),
2162            "x1_pretrench": cfg_mesh.getfloat("x1_pretrench", fallback=None),
2163            "v_plate": cfg_seq.getfloat("v_plate"),
2164            "n_cycles_max": cfg_seq.getint("n_cycles_max"),
2165            "n_samples_per_eq": cfg_seq.getint("n_samples_per_eq"),
2166            "delta_tau_max": cfg_fault.getfloat("delta_tau_max", fallback=np.inf),
